Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio P. R. de 35 años de edad, reside en el Cantón San Diego, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, este cantón esta ubicado en una de las playas más famosas del país, lugar el cual cuenta con muchos turistas tanto nacionales como internacional. En este lugar esta ubicado el negocio de José, el cual es una tienda en la que comercializan diferentes tipos de productos comestibles y agua embotellada, así mismo su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, elaborando pupusas y tortillas, las cuales se venden muy bien. José desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, sobretodo contar con mayor cantidad de productos en su tienda, ya que las vacaciones de agosto están muy cerca y esta es una de las temporadas más importantes del año en las cuales la afluencia de personas crece, el ganar más para estas vacaciones le permitirá surtir su negocio mucho más. A pesar que no poseen hijos, ellos como pareja desean contar con una vida mejor y mucho más estable en la cual puedan vivir con toda tranquilidad confiados que cuentan con un negocio estable, el cual les provee de todo lo necesario, es por esta razón que José solicita un préstamo a Integral y llevar a cabo todo lo mencionado para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
José Antonio P. R. is 35 years old and resides in Cantón San Diego, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. This canton has one of the most famous beaches in the country where many domestic and international tourists visit. José has a store on the beach where he sells different types of food products and bottles of water. His wife helps with running the business by making pupusas and tortillas that sell very well. José wants to improve his business by acquiring more products for his store. The August vacation season is approaching and it is an important time of the year when the number of people visiting the area increases. In order to earn as much as he can during this time, José wants to restock his business.

Despite not having children, José and his wife want to have a better conditions and more stability so that they can live peacefully and have a steady business that provides them everything they need. For this reason, José is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can make the necessary improvements to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

location.town: Cantón San Diego, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Agamekhti

texts.en:
Agamekhti A. is 53 years old, married, and has two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs, like candies, cookies, preserved foods, soft drinks, juice, tea, fresh fruits and many other items in the grocery store he built many years ago. 

Today, Agamekhti is requesting a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani manat (AZN) to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his goals is to open more stores. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more food products to increase his income

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo Antonio tiene 42 años y un negocio de comidas rápidas en dos sectores de la ciudad, que atiende con su cónyuge  con la cual tiene 5 hijos. Eduardo inició esta actividad  cuando trabajó durante 17 años con  su hermano, del que se independizó e invirtió sus ahorros en un negocio similar, que fue creciendo con el tiempo y hoy cuenta con 2 microempresas, habiendo iniciado solo con dos mesas;  él vende perro caliente, hamburguesas, sánduche y pechugas a la plancha entre otras picadas, a las que agrega exquisitas salsas que él mismo aprendió a preparar; su negocio lo atiende desde   5: 00 P.m.  a 11:00 P.m., y los fines de semana de 5:00 PM a 1:00 P.m.  . Este es su quinto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que lo ha apoyado mucho, pues dice que siempre está haciendo ahorros por las épocas de bajas ventas  que se presentan  y con esta organización también ha logrado dotar su negocio con sillas y mesas, que lo hacen mas elegante y cómodo; Con su credikiva comprará mesas, sillas, salsas y carnes. Aunque su negocio es su único ingreso con él ha logrado sostener a su familia y mejorar cada día mas;  ahora sueña con emprender esta misma alternativa en su pueblo en  el departamento de Córdoba para seguir prosperando
texts.en:
Eduardo Antonio, 42, operates a business selling prepared food in two city neighborhoods. His partner, with whom he has 5 children, helps him. Eduardo started the business working, with his brother for 17 years, then striking off on his own by investing his savings in a similar business. He started with just two tables but, over time, the business has grown and he now has two food stalls. Among other things, he sells hamburgers, hotdogs, sausages and grilled chicken, to which he adds his own special sauce. He operates the business from 5:00pm to 11:00pm during the week and from 5:00pm to 1:00am on weekends. This is Eduardo's fifth loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, a bank that has long supported him. He says that he always saves for slow periods of the year and that the bank has helped him buy tables and chairs which have helped him to improve the business and make it more comfortable for his customers. He will use this loan from Kiva to buy tables and chairs and ingredients for the food he makes. Although this Eduardo's only business, it has allowed him to support and improve the lives of his family. Now he hopes to set up a similar business in his home "departamento" of Cordoba so that he can continue to expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stock and supplies for food business.

loans.name: Erkan

texts.en:
Erkan B. is 47 years old and lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. His oldest two children, aged 21 and 22, currently live and study at a foreign university in Kazakhstan, while his youngest son, 17, attends a local high school.
Erkan owns and operates his own shoe repair business. He began his business in 2000 in a rented workspace at the local market. He has built his business to a consistent level and attributes its success to his strong selling and communication skills. He pays a monthly rent of 30,000 MNT. His service charge is between 1,000 and 4,000 MNT and he earns 50 per cent as net profit.
In the future, Erkan hopes to grow his business and have his own workplace. Therefore, he is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to buy more repair supplies and tools for his shoe repair center as well as to purchase three tons of coals (costing 180,000 MNT) to prepare for the winter.

loans.use: To buy more repair supplies and tools

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for the last sixteen years. His mixed farm produces maize, beans and sugarcane which he sells locally. He is also a pastor in the same region. Ayub is 43 years old and married with five school-aged children. 

He recently repaid his previous loan of 30,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 61,200KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and keep poultry. He says the extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children. His major challenge is poor prices for his products. In five years time, he hopes that his poultry farm will have expanded and that he will be the major supplier of eggs and poultry to the local market.

.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow, and keep poultry.

loans.name: Violeta Roxana

texts.en:
Violeta Roxana C. M. is 31 years old. She lives with her 12-year-old son in her parents' home in the neighborhood of La Victoria. Although this is an urban zone, it is one of the poorest in the city of Chiclayo. The majority of the population makes a living in some form of urban subsistence, selling just enough on a daily basis to meet basic needs.

Violeta works as a street vendor in and around the Mercado A-Z, one of the smaller markets just outside of the city. She sells a wide variety of fruits. She follows seasonal crop offerings in selecting her merchandise. Violeta purchases the fruit from wholesalers in the area and then resells it at retail prices.  She has been running this business for three years.

This will be Violeta’s first loan. She has never worked with a financial institution before. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional fruit at greater discounts by making a large bulk purchase. She expects that this will increase her profit margin and enable her to reinvest a greater portion of her income in growing her daily inventory.

Violeta is well respected in her neighborhood and has good references. She has great dreams of helping her son complete school and become a professional. She hopes her business will continue to maintain the family and support her son in his ongoing education.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit at greater discounts

loans.name: Sherapat

texts.ru: Кашаева Шерапат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 55 лет. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке "Дехкон". Она в основном продает носки и нужные вещи для хозяйства. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Sherapat K. lives in the town of Turzun-zoda. She is 55 years old. She is divorced and has one child.  She has secondary education.  She sells on the Dehkon market, mainly socks and other household necessities.  She has been in this business for more than ten years.  She is asking for a loan to increase sales.  She wants to expand her business and get more profit.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (20201030013) is a 54 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has adult aged children.  C. owns and operates a restaurant business, and the primary source of income comes from serving dinner foods to customers in the local community.  C. has been in this business for over 22 years, and she earns approximately 3.900.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services, to help improve her living situation, and to give her the ability to engage in business activities.  C. successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.392.000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant.  C. is requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  This will be her 5th loan from SEDA, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Nguyễn Thị (20201030013) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 54 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, C. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ phục vụ thức ăn tối cho khách hàng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 22 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.900.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn & đồ uống cho nhà hàng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Aleyda Yanira

texts.es: Aleyda Yanira C. C. de 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y junto a los cuales reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Aleyda realiza diferentes actividades para poder sostener su hogar, debido a que ella no cuenta con ningún tipo de ayuda para mantener a sus hijos y su casa. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, así mismo comercializa queso, crema y cilindros de gas propano, todo lo realiza en su hogar lo cual es una ventaja ya que esta junto a sus hijos. Aleyda solicita un préstamo con la esperanza de poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar sus ventas, ya que sólo de esta manera ella podrá contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo brindarles estudio, vestimenta y todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aleyda Yanira C. C. is a 37 year old single mother. She has three young children attending school and they live together in the Ahuachapan Department.

Aleyda does different activities since she does not have any other assistance to support her children and her home. She makes and sells tortillas. She also sells cheese, cream and propane tanks. She is able to do these activities out of her house which is advantageous because this allows her to be near her children. 

Aleyda is requesting this loan to buy more products to increase her sales which will provide better economic stability and enable her to continue providing schooling, clothing and the various necessities for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and propane gas

loans.name: Talapsu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Talapsu” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K.. Aminata is age thirty; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a lecturer and two of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Aminata has been a businesswoman for more than ten years now, she sells shoes, shirts, jeans, and mobile phones. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy shoes, shirts, jeans, and mobile phones in large quantity to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Abacuruzi Group

texts.fr: Jean Bosco N. est commerçant du riz, et il est un membre du groupe Abishyizehamwe Abacuruzi.  Il a 28 ans, il est marié, et il a 1 enfant qui a 2 ans.  Il a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter de riz pour le vendre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer ses activités de commerce.  Il voudrait devenir grossiste, payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants, acheter une parcelle, et payer les frais médicaux.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco N. sells rice. He is a member of the Abishyizehamwe Abacuruzi group. He is 28 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old child. He completed six years of primary school. 

He will use his loan to buy rice, which he will then sell. His business growth strategy is to improve his commercial activities. He wants to become a wholesaler, pay his children’s tuition fees, purchase a plot of land, and pay the medical expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of rice

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Suon P., age 46.  She lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a  living raising pigs. This business has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. 

Mrs. Suon P. is married with three children, all of whom are single and are studying in the local school. Her husband sells firewood and charcoal in his village using his old motorbike.  He earns an income of approximately $6.40 per day. 

In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Suon P.’s husband wants to buy a larger quantity of firewood and charcoal to sell to retailers in the market.  However, he doesn’t have a vehicle large enough to transport more firewood and charcoal. To achieve this goal, Mrs. Suon P. has decided to seek a loan for her husband to purchase a trailer to connect to a motorbike so that he can use it to pick up more firewood and charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase trailer to transport charcoal for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association DEME du quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 2 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de pagnes et de condiments alimentaires à l’image de BADJEGUE K.. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a une année. Elles sont à leur  2eme  prêt solidaire. 
BADJEGUE K., qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans l’achat vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, plusieurs colis de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, concentrée de tomate, oignon, sel, choux, etc.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à Ouelessebougou et dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de15.000 FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of the DEME association in the N’tentou neighbourhood of Ouelessebougou.It is made up of four women who met through family ties and neighbourhood connections. They are of an average age of 30 years. All are married and mother to at least 2 children ,they have various activities such as the commerce of traditional dresses and  food seasoning products as does  Badjegue K..They  live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou in the Kati territory (Koulikoro region, Mali Republic)
They have been working in their small business for some years and are very much in demand.
Hoping to satisfy the increasing needs of their customers, a year ago the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme. This is their second loan.
Badjegue K., who is the president of group and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in the commerce of condiments. She plans to use her loan to purchase several packets of different sorts of seasoning, (pepper, tomato concentrate, onion, salt, cabbage etc.) She buys her stock in Bamako from wholesalers and sells her produce in Ouelessebougou and at various weekly trade fairs, retail, for cash and credit, to a clientele mostly made up of women.
She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25.000FCFA, an amount which will allow her to reimburse her loan and reinvest in her business. The other group members are expecting a profit of 15.000 FCFA per month which will allow them to repay the loan and provide for their family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana E. is a single mother taking care of four children. She has been through junior high school. Nana moves around in her locality to sell ice cream at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She uses her income to maintain her home. She is requesting to use the loan to buy larger quantities of ice cream to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to add the sale of food items to her business.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAÏDOU est composé de femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs  enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Massablacoura l’un des quartier de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de voisinage, et de commerce. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un font de commerce suffisante pour satisfaire la clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour faire le commerce médicaments traditionnels, de Riz, d’habillements, des bois de chauffe et du charbon  avec Kadiatou K.. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Avec ce prêt Kadiatou K., compte acheter, 10 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe  et 20 sacs de charbon de bois.
Elle est approvisionnée par des fournisseurs venant des villages environnants pour  ensuite  être revendu en détail et en en gros, au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI et à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elles comte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour remboursé le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Laïdou Group is composed of married women, who on average are 42 years old and have seven children. They live with their children and husbands in nuclear families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of neighborhood and business.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital to satisfy their clientele, the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to finance their activities, namely selling traditional medicine, rice and clothes; Kadiatou Kanté sells firewood and coal. This is their first group loan.

Mrs Kadiatou Kanté intends to buy 10 cartloads of firewood and 20 sacks of charcoal. She gets her supplies from merchants in nearby villages and sells her goods retail or wholesale, for cash or credit, at the great market in Bougouni and from her home to a clientele made up of men and women.

Thanks to this loan, they expect to make an average profit of 20,000 CFA francs a month. They will use it to repay their loan and reinvest the remaining amount in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Maria Doraliza

texts.es:
Maria Doraliza C. G. tiene 37 años, vive en Unión Libre vive  con el cónyuge en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao y yuca.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao y yuca. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao y yuca.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es educar a los hijos en especial a los mas pequeños.

Le gusta salir el sábado tarde a la cancha a ver cono hacer deporte el conviviente y los hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old, and lives with her husband in Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.  She has 6 children.

The members of the “Juntos Venceremos” (Together We Shall Overcome) Communal Bank are located in the Matilde Esther zone of Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.  The bank has 12 members all of whom work in agriculture, cultivating chocalate and maniac root.

Maria also farms, and cultivates chocolate and manioc root.  She buys her supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells her production at the Sunday fair in Chillanes.

Maria requests a loan to buy inputs  and to confront challenges such as plagues and plant illnesses, and variations in climate.  Her dream is to educate her children, especially the youngest ones.

Maria likes to go to the football field on Saturdays to see how her husband and children are doing.

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES TO  CULTIVATE CHOCOLATE AND MANIAC ROOT

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Nicolasa L. le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder relazar la mejora que necesita, ya a la señora Nicolasa L. y a su esposo el señor Evaristo Linares les esta preocupa la seguridad y el bienestar de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene Don Evaristo como chofer de camión de carretera.
texts.en: Nicolasa L.' house needs a perimeter wall but right now she doesn't have the money she needs to buy materials and pay the person who will carry out the improvement.  She is requesting a loan which will allow her to have the necessary work done as Nicolasa L. and her husband Evaristo Linares are worried about their family's safety and well-being.  She plans to repay her loan with the income that Evaristo makes as a truck driver.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora María Lourdes C. V. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 54 años. Ella tiene una comideria la cual inicio en1990 vendiendo enchiladas, tacos, repochetas, tajadas con queso etc. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, carne, aceite, plátano... y en gaseosas.
texts.en:
Sra. María Lourdes C. V. is a hardworking, determined, and enterprising woman. She is 54 years old and has a diner that she started in 1990. María sells enchiladas, tacos, Nicaraguan quesadillas, fried plantains with cheese, and other dishes.

She will invest this loan in basic grains, meat, oil, plantains, and soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meat, oil, plantains, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco P. L., es soltero, tiene 21 años de edad, estudio los estudio de educación primaria, se dedica a la artesania, a la confeccion de pantalones para damas y caballeros, lleva 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inició como operario.

Quiere iniciar su propio negocio, por lo se acercó a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar dos maquinas planas para confeccionar pantalones lo es el objetivo principal de Francisco P. L., y en el futuro contar con su propia empresa de confecciones.
texts.en: Francisco P. L., 21, is single. He studied primary education and works as an artisan. He makes pants for both men and women. He has 10 years of experience in this line of work and began as a laborer. He wants to start his own business, which is why he approached ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan. The loan will be used for his current goal to buy two sewing machines which will be used to make pants. In the future he would like to own his own clothing business.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Alfredo, el socio tiene 44 años de edad, el socio tiene 3 hijos de 14, 12, 8 años de edad; el socio es chofer y cubre las rutas de Pisac a Calca y viceversa; el socio también se dedica a la ganadería, el socio tiene 20 vacas y ahora le gustaría compra un par mas de vacas dependiendo el tamaño dependerá el precio, el socio  es casado y junto a su esposa se dedican alternamente a la crianza y engorde de ganados, el socio desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vacas.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” and is located in the town of Pisac belonging to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

Alfredo, 44, is the members.  He has three children who are 14, 12 and 8 years of age.  He’s a driver on the Pisac-Calca and vice versa route.  He also raises livestock.  He has twenty cows and he’d now like to buy another pair of cows; price will depend on their size.  He is married and together with his wife they share raising cattle.  He wants the loan to buy cows.

He is grateful and expresses that he will meet his repayment obligations in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Innab

texts.en:
Innab is 53 years old.  She is married with six children.  For almost 6 years, Innab has been working as a market vendor.  She sells plates and dishes in the oriental style.  This kind of goods is in popular demand among the population.  This kind of china is widely used for girl's dowry and also for family celebrations.  The love for her children is the biggest reason for Innab to make an effort to provide what they need. 

Now Innab is planning to enlarge her range of goods and to purchase the china for re-sale.  For this purpose she is requesting 1,000 AZN.  She promises to make all repayments on time and is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin, tiene la edad de 43  años, está casado, el  vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto y la experiencia para el buen manejo y buena producción de su cafetal, por lo cual quiere invertir en su plantación para mejorarla y asi obtener mejores resultados de ella. El quiere generarle las mejores ganancias a su cafetal parea poder seguir adelante con sus proyectos y también para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida con mayores facilidades.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Martin is 43 years old, married, and he lives with his 2 children and his wife. They are his greatest priority. With his loan he plans on purchasing products to maintain his coffee plantation. He has an adequate plot of land and he has the experience to manage his coffee plantation and to make it productive. He wants to invest in his plantation to improve it in order to obtain better results. He wants to generate better profits through his coffee plantation to be able to keep his projets moving forward and to provide his family with a better and more comfortable quality of life. This is his first loan through Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had other loans with state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him with a loan with greater benefits and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to maintain his plantation

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Marco  vive en la casa de su madre en la zona de Chasquipampa, con sus dos hijos y su esposa, ellos tienen una tienda de ropa variada (para cholitas como ser enaguas, blusas y ropa para niños, juveniles en el  mismo domicilio tienen buena venta los fines de semana ya que hay feria los días sábados donde vienen personas desde comunidades aledañas como ser palca, unni y  zonas aledañas, ellos necesitan para incrementar mas la mercadería ya que por la demanda de sus clientes necesitan  comprar mas ropa variada para todo gusto como indican ellos, también comprar ropa de invierno ya que se acerca esta epoca de frio, el sr. Marco es una persona muy trabajadora pensando en el bienestar de su familia agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Marco lives in his mother's home in the Chasquipampa zone with his two children and his wife. They have a clothing store in their home (that sells) traditional skirts for the Cholitas ***, shirts, and other clothes for children and youth. They have good sales on the weekends since there is a market on Saturdays that the people from neighboring communities (Palca, Unni, and others) come to. They need to increase their merchandise because of customer demand. They need to purchase more clothing items that will appeal to everyone, and they also need to purchase winter clothes since the cold season is coming. Marco is a very hardworking person who is always thinking of his family's well-being. He is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.


***Cholitas are the indigenous rural women of Bolivia. They distinguish themselves by wearing bowler hats and colourful skirts and shawls and form the backbone of the social movement that in 2006 brought Evo Morales to power in their country.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothes for toddlers and youth as well as traditional indigenous clothing)

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 25 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. They are a young couple who married recently. He manages a grocery store in his town. His wife used to operate the business; however, she is going to give birth soon.

Now Batsaihan’s mother works as a salesperson at his store and sends the earnings to his bank account. He himself is working at a bakery factory in order to supplement his earnings.

Batsaihan is a polite man who says, "One must work hard." He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irene; la socia tiene 54 años de edad, la socia es casada; La socia tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la agricultura como actividad principal, la socia alterna su actividad económica con la venta de verduras ella vende tomate, zanahoria, cebollas, lechuga; la socia requiere en esta oportunidad el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz blanco para el nuevo cultivo, la socia solicita crédito para invertir en la compra de maíz para la siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semilla de maíz para la siembra.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the "Reyna de los Ángeles de Urquillos" community bank which is located in Urquillos district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

Irene is 54 years old, married, and has one child.  Her main business activity is farming.  She also sells vegetables (tomatoes, carrots, onions and lettuce).  On this occasion, Irene needs a loan to invest in buying white corn seeds to grow.

Irene is grateful for the support that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying corn seed to sow

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sat is the leader of this group of three women living in Kompong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Sat is 41 years old and married.  The couple has given birth of five kids and currently lives with three single children while the other two are married already. She earns a living by planting rice on her own farmland. She can plant her rice crop twice a year following rainy season and dry season. She would like to plant now, before the coming rainy season, which is good for her crop.  Mrs. Sat would like a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer. With the remaining funds, she will buy some piglets which she will raise for slaughter.

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop growing well and to buy some piglets to feeding.

loans.name: 9.5 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Hoa is 40 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 9.5 Đông Vệ solidarity group. Hoa lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes to maintain her business, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy lace, waxed cotton and local cotton

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 51 años, vive con su hijo y su esposo en su casa que es propia. Tiene 16 años trabajando como comerciante, pues posee una librería y bazar a la vez, atendiendo a sus clientes durante las mañanas. Es así que ofrece útiles de escritorio, escolares y algunos artículos variados para el hogar y uso personal. Asimismo en su mismo espacio de venta ha acondionado un lugar para ofrecer servicios contables, ya que ejerce de manera independiente su profesión, esto le ha servido para que ella y su esposo puedan sostener económicamente su hogar. Se siente muy contenta y feliz  porque puede seguir generándose sus propias fuentes de ingreso, a pesar  de que la competencia esta presente, siempre ofrece una buena atención y variedad de productos. Para el futuro quiere tener más mercadería disponible. Es la séptima vez que esta trabajando de manera grupal con MFP, considera que los créditos son un gran respaldo económico que beneficia su negocio cuando es necesario el aumento de capital de trabajo, esta es la razón de peso que la impulsa a seguir esforzándose y demostrar su puntualidad de pago. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de millares de papeles de diferentes calidades y colores muy necesarios para el incremento de capital para su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is 51 and lives with her son and husband in her own home. She has been working for 16 years as a merchant. She has a bookstore and a variety shop, together. She waits on her customers in the mornings. Thus she sells writing and school supplies and various articles for the home and personal use. Likewise, in the same space that she has her shop, she has prepared a place where she offers book-keeping services, thereby independently pursuing her profession. This has enabled her and her husband to provide economically for their home.

Nancy feels very happy because she can continue generating her own source of income, despite the competition. She always offers good service and a variety of products for sale. In the future she wants to have more merchandise available. This is the seventh time that she has worked as part of a group to secure a loan from MFP. She feels that the loans are a great economic support that benefits her business when she needs to increase her working capital. This is why she is motivated to continue striving and demonstrating her ability to make payments on time. She will use the loan to buy thousands of sheets of different quality and colored paper, which are quite necessary in order to increase the capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy thousands of sheets of different quality and colored paper.

loans.name: Bemilda Esperanza

texts.es:
Bemilda soltera, su oficio es comerciante, mujer emprendedora, trabajadora tiene su propio negocio. Sus planes es mejorar su nivel de vida para ofrecerle mejores alternativa a su familia.  Con el préstamo comprara: gaseosa, repostería, arroz, frijoles, carnes, aceites, jabones, artículos de uso personal, lácteo, galletas, enlatados, embutidos entre otros producto que vende y usa en su negocio. Generándole utilidad.
Agradece a la financiera por e apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Bemilda is a hardworking, enterprising single woman who has her own business. She runs a general store. Her goals include improving her situation in life so she can offer better opportunities to her family. With the loan she will buy sodas, baked goods, rice, beans, meats, oils, soap, personal items, dairy products, cookies, canned goods, cold cuts and other products to sell and use in her business, generating more profits. She is thankful to the lenders for supporting the development of her business and improving her situation in life.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise

loans.name: Mailka's Group

texts.en:
Mailka is the leader of this group. She is 54 year old widow. She has raised three sons and a daughter; the sons work in Russia and the daughter is married and lives separately with her family. In order to earn money, Malika breeds and fattens livestock and then resells it at a higher price. She earns about 2000 soms per month for her business. Mailka applied for a loan because she needs additional funds to purchase 1.5 tons of cement for house construction. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to finish the construction.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cement for house construction.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida works hard to support her family. Bienvenida is married and sell ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines.

Bienvenida requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items like t-shirts, pants etc. to sell to customers.

Bienvenida has been in this business for five years now and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Bienvenida would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like t-shirts, pants etc. to sell to customers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Los hijos de la socia tienen 8, 3 y 11 meses; la socia desea ahora comprar animales menores como cuyes, chanchos, gallinas y también comprar productos secos como maiz, moraya, chuño, y la socia vende a las diferentes tiendas y a los mercados en lso cuales tiene sus clientes, la socia comprara 300 kilos en productos secos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos como maíz, moraya, chuño, ella comprara 300 kilos en productos secos.
texts.en: The borrower’s children are 8 and 3 years and 11 months of age.  She wants to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs, pigs and chickens and also to buy dry goods like corn and dehydrated potato.  She sells to various stores and markets in Iso where she has her customers.  She will buy 300 kilograms of dry goods.  She is asking for the loan to buy dry goods like corn and dehydrated potato; she will buy 300 kilos of dry goods.

loans.use: to purchase dried products.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 57-year-old widow with nine children between the ages of 18 and 35.  To earn a living, she does dairy farming.  She has been in business for ten years. In addition, she grows potatoes, tomatoes and coffee for commercial use. She works hard in her business in order to provide for her family.  Jacinta hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years.  She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a cow and animal feed as well as to construct a cowshed.

loans.use: to buy a cow and animal feed as well as to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a responsible father who's priority in life is to uplift his family's living conditions, especially to finance the schooling of his children. According to him, education is the only legacy he could pass on to his children because his family is less fortunate. 

George is 33 years old, married to a housewife and they were blessed with three children. George now asks for a loan of PHP29,000 to pay for a license and to buy side mirrors for his motorcycle. He believes that, through the help of this loan, he can improve his services and continously operate his business. 

George hopes to make her business more profitable despite difficulties he encounters in providing motorcycle services to the people in their village.

loans.use: to pay for his license and to buy side mirrors for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos  dos quais um trabalha e o outro frequenta a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos seus pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É negociante ha mais de 2 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.700.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimo noutro banco(SENCOR) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades.Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos(amendoim, arroz, farinha, sumos, refrescos, e outros.), para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio e ampliar a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children. One of them is in the workforce and the other one still attends school. She completed 5th grade and stopped because her parents lacked financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns and does not support anyone else.
She has been a businesswoman for over two years. She sells various goods and earns an income of about 4.700mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has had a loan in another bank (SENCOR) and she was able to repay it without difficulties. She first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this insitution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase goods (peanuts, rice, flour, juice, refreshments, etc.) in order to increase the volume of her merchandise.
She pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future she intends to expand her business and make home improvements. For that purpose she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase goods for selling (peanuts, rice, flour, juice, refreshments, etc.).

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Gregory has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells groundnuts, millet and sorghum. 

To help expand his business, Gregory has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sorghum and groundnuts for resale. It will help Gregory to generate greater profits and add to his limited stock of groundnuts. Gregory hopes that in the future he will be able to construct a permanent house for his family. 

Gregory is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gregory who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a married woman with nine children. Violeta is 52 years old, residing in the Philippines. Violeta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more goods to sell. Violeta joined GDMPC at this year. In the future, Violeta wants to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Las Morenitas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama las morenitas ya que son señoras de piel morena y vive en una localidad pequeña.

   La señora quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama Norma  quien vive en unión libre con el señor Elí y con quien procreo  dos hijos que  aun están  a su  responsabilidad.

 Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: pollo, maíz, aceite hojas de guineo, chile  ancho , pasas, entre otros para la elaboración de tamales de mole, en donde lleva trabajando  un año y  cinco  meses en la que comenta que le va bien .

 Lo que ella desea es que con su pequeña actividad pueda seguir trabajando y con el préstamo   y sus ganancias trabajar más días a la semana.
texts.en:
This group is named “Las Morenitas” because the members are dark-skinned women who reside in a small locality. The woman we interviewed is called Norma. She lives with Eli and they have 2 children who are still their responsibility.

Norma is requesting a loan to invest in ingredients such as chicken, corn, cooking oil, banana leaves, broad chiles, and raisins, among other things, for making tamales with mole sauce. She has been doing this for 1 year and 5 months and it is going well, she says.

What Norma wants is for her small business to continue, and that with the loan and her earnings, she will be able to work more days in the week.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making tamales to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.es:
Gloria ha sido una persona que ha sufrido las consecuencias de la violencia, pues desde hace 7 años salió desplazada de su municipio natal y se debió instalar en su actual residencia. A pesar de todo esto, Gloria nunca ha desistido y siempre ha mantenido la lucha constante para salir adelante con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Para Gloria, sus 5 hijos son lo más importante, y es por ellos por los que todos los días trabaja fuertemente con el ánimo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y que en un futuro puedan acceder a una educación universitaria. 
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Gloria ha iniciado con un bajo capital su negocio de venta de papelería, y gracias a este ha podido obtener ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. En vísperas de la temporada escolar, Gloria requiere de surtir su negocio con una mayor mercancía para hacerlo atractivo para sus clientes, sin embargo, Gloria no posee el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía de papelería como son cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, cartulina, carpetas, entre otros productos, y poder así atender toda la demanda que se presenta en esta temporada.
Gloria espera que sus ventas aumenten considerablemente en esta temporada, y pueda así generar más ingresos para su hogar para mejorarles la calidad de vida a su esposo y sus 5 hijos, y también aspira a poder ahorrar lo suficiente como para brindarles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible, y en un futuro el que puedan acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Gloria has suffered the consequences of violence.  Seven years ago, she moved out of her native town and had to settle in her current residence.  In spite of all this, Gloria has never given up and has always maintained a constant struggle to get ahead with her husband and five children.  For Gloria, her five children are the most important, and it is for them that she works hard every day with the purpose of giving them a better quality of life and the opportunity to attend college in the future.  

With the purpose of generating income to sustain her home, Gloria started her stationery shop with a small amount of capital, and thanks to this business, she was able to earn income to contribute to the household expenses.  Just before the school season, Gloria must stock her business with more merchandise to make it attractive to her customers.  Gloria doesn’t have enough capital to make these purchases, however, and so she is seeking a loan that offers her the opportunity to purchase merchandise for her stationery shop such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, cardboard, folders, and other products.  This will enable her to meet the demand that occurs during this season.

Gloria hopes that her sales will increase considerably during this season, and that this will enable her to generate more household income and improve the quality of life for her husband and five children.  Also, she plans to save enough money in order to offer her children the best education possible so that they may attend college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stationery goods such as notebooks, folders, cardboard, pencils, erasers, and other items.

loans.name: Nelly Consuelo

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 66 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo siempre han dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Nelly no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho convertirse en una Profesora, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus nietos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Nelly trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, en épocas de verano vende un riquísimo Ceviche y en invierno vende salchipapas, salchipollo y otras frituras, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Nelly se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por los buenos precios que ofrece a sus clientes.
Nelly se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas, sillas, sombrillas y cañas Guayaquil, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder acondicionar y ampliar su negocio, así pues Nelly seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio restaurant.
texts.en:
Nelly, a 66-year-old woman, lives in the city of Chincha. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who with her husband has always dedicated all of her efforts to raising her children. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and because of the need for her to work, she has never been able to study Education as a career, but she very much would have like to have been a teacher. In the little free time that she has, she likes to play with her grandchildren and sometimes cook a delicious dish called Carapulcra con Sopa Seca to share with her family. 

By her own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Nelly owns a small business in which she sells food. In the summer months she sells a delicious Ceviche and in the winter she sells salchipapas, salchipollo and other fried goods. She works every day, from the early hours of the morning until late, usually working approximately ten hours. She really enjoys her work and believes that her business does well because her food tastes good and she offers it at a good price. 

Nelly feels very grateful to those who make loans through Kiva, since through their help she would be able to buy tables, chairs, shade umbrellas and cane rods, all of which would be very useful in order to cool and enlarge her business. This way, she would be able to continue working and putting forth the effort to achieve her dream of having her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, shade umbrellas, and cane rods.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 40-year-old married man. He has three children, 2 to 14 years in age. He describes himself as honest and credible. He operates a farming business where he grows khart to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a rural area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate transport facilities. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more khart bushes. This is his first loan application with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add more khart bushes to his farm.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Araceli is a very entrepreneurial woman. She is 42 years old and is married with 3 sons. She was born in the south of the state, Linares N.L., however she has 26 years living in Monterrey. She moved to this city because she had to study and also because she wanted to look for better opportunities. Araceli's business is selling clothing; whites (like towels and cloths of bed) and handmade products, which she sells in monthly installments between neighbors and friends. She has mini stores in popular markets but these are temporary because she has to move inside these markets from one place to another and she needs the loan to invest in materials and merchandise for her business. So her expectations in the short term are to establish her business in a fixed place inside these mini markets and also to teach how to make handmade products to her neighbors (and how to sell the material to do it as well). Christmas season is coming soon so she is very thrilled with her business idea.

SPANISH

Araceli es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella es originaria de una comunidad al sur del estado: Linares N. L., sin embargo tiene 26 años de haber emigrado a Monterrey, para poder estudiar y buscar mejores oportunidades. Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa, blancos y manualidades, los cuales vende en abonos entre vecinos y amistades, ha logrado tener puestos semi fijos en mercados y esta solicitando un crédito de $4,000 a 4 meses porque necesita invertir en la compra de mercancía y materiales para las manualidades. Sus expectativas son ver a corto plazo su negocio ya mas establecido, incluso dar clases de manualidades entre sus vecinos y vender material. Se avecina una buena temporada (Navideña), por lo que esta muy entusiasmada con la idea de poder invertir un poco mas en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase material and merchandise for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more machinery, expand and create more electrician outlets

loans.name: Salote

texts.en: Salote’s business is making and selling pork buns at her village. The market is too far for her, so she prefers to sell her products at home. Salote uses pork and flour for the pork buns. When the pork is short, she buys turkey tails as a substitute. This is one of the children’s and even old peoples' favorites. The pork bun costs one dollar, and customers choose between the fried and the steamed buns. Salote works six days of the week, including Sunday evenings. Salote plans to take her business to the flea market when she finds a rented spot.

loans.use: To purchase flour, turkey tail, soya-sauce, and pots

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
I have been selling second hand clothes for one year and I have done very well. I would now like to buy more merchandise so that I can sell more as my family and I live off this money. I would like a loan of $1,200 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Tengo 1 año con el negocio de venta de ropa usada y me va bien, solo que ahora me gustaría comprar más mercancía para poder tener más ventas ya que de ahí vivimos mi familia y yo”. Solicito $ 1.200.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell/Comprar más ropa para vender

loans.name: Alisahib

texts.en:
Mr. Alisahib is 52 and married with two children. He and his family live in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alisahib and his son (shown in the picture) run a family business. Alisahib sells beef in Saatli while his son takes care of their cows. However, the income from the sold beef is not enough to support their family.

That’s why Alisahib applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu is married with a child. He sells shoes in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. Saidu joined SMT in 2004 and has seen his business grow since that time.  He would like to continue expanding his business slowly by taking small loans, one at a time.  For this reason he is presently requesting a loan of $275.  At 27 years old, he believes that he needs to build a bright future for his family; therefore, he wants to start now.

loans.use: Build his shoe business slowly and steadily to better provide for his family

loans.name: Qarash

texts.en: A. Qarash is 26-yers-old young man who runs his business consisting of raising sheep. Qarash lives with his wife and two sons in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. He is internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He started his business in 2002 and for the first loan he borrowed from his friends he purchase two baby sheep. As they raised he paid back the debts and to the rest of money he purchased more animals.  Currently Qarash has a herd of ten sheep. The mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Most of traditional meals consist of mutton. As Qarash children grow up and prices are getting higher every year, the only one income is not enough to feed enough and cover family needs in the normal level. Nevember and December are high season months for weddings in Azerbaijan and meat at this are in high demand. Qarash decided to expand his business and increase number of sheep to 10.   The estimated cost for one sheep is 60 USD the reast 200 USD he will spend on fodder. For this purpose he applied for 800 USD with repayment term 15 month.

loans.use: Going to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Vazifa

texts.en: Ms. Vazifa is a 44-year-old woman. She is single and lives with her family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 1990 when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Vazifa purchases calves, breeds them, and sells them to the butcher, who works at the local big market. At the same time, the income is not enough to cover all of Vazifa’s family expenses. To increase her profit margin, Vazifa has to invest some money to make her small herd bigger. This summer, she applied for $800 to buy four calves. She hopes to expand her business eventually.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Zarmina

texts.en: Zarmina H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. She is engaged in clothing sales in Beylagan city bazaar. She rented a small booth there. She started her business ten years ago. She needs a loan in the amount of $1200 to purchase more kinds of goods and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Hugo A. is a father of one who works very hard to provide for his son and wife. He is a motorcycle mechanic and has been one since he was very young. His father was in the same line of work and taught the profession to his son. Hugo’s hope is that his son will continue with his education and go on to the university.

Hugo is asking for a loan today to buy more parts for his service shop. He will buy starters, crowns, pistons and chains, and this will help him meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To buy parts to fix motorcycles.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 20 years old and is a single woman. Asha sells soap and cloth, which she started doing in 2007. She works every day from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Lydia Cann

texts.en:
B. Lydia Cann sells sugar, rice, milk and others foodstuffs. She is married and has 6 dependents.  Demand for her goods has increased and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Sophea Bun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four members in the Rotaing Village will be bonded in a Village Bank, and Mrs. Sophea B. will serve as the Village Bank President. Mrs. Sophea B. is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She is a farmer, and her husband, Mr. Chantha Prum, is also a farmer in the local village.

Typically, Mrs. Sophea B. cultivates her crops twice a year. Her farming business has encountered numerous difficulties in recent months because the field on which she farms is infertile, not to mention the fact that many insects damage the vegetables she is able to grow. Moreover, just last year, Mrs. Sophea B.’s vegetables were ruined by floods during that year's rainy season, which was truly a crisis for her family from a financial standpoint. As such, and in order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sophea B. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers and pesticides (to kill insects) for her field.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides for the field in order to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou S. lives in Russey Keo with his wife and five children, and works as a fisherman. He typically makes US$1.50 each day and his wife, Chhub Kim Lang, works to collect recycling materials, making US$4 every day. The family is also supported by the work of one son who is in the construction business. Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year and it has affected food prices and the costs of other basic necessities. Ou has approached CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to purchase some recycling materials in bulk to resell. The family sees this as an investment and an opportunity that can increase the family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase recycling materials

loans.name: Cesarian Teodosia

texts.es:
Cesarían es una mujer muy trabajadora, instaló una pequeña tienda en su casa, negocio que siempre quiso tener, ahora su afán es poder mejorarlo y hacer de ese negocio uno de los más concurridos en su zona.Para ello tiene que trabajar muy alegremente porque lo que hace que las personas concurran a un lugar es sentirse bien, nos dice, por ello que en el trascurso de estos meses Cesarían no solo aprendió a sonreír, sino también a administrar su negocio para poder seguir creciendo.Desea incrementar su negocio con diversos productos que puedan satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, por ello solicita un préstamo de dinero que espera usted pueda brindarle.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Cesarian is a hard-working woman, who has set up a small shop in her home; this is the business she always wanted to have and is now eager to improve it and make her business one of the busiest in the area. In order to achieve this she must be extremely happy and friendly to ensure that the people who come to her store also feel good; she told us that over the past few months Cesarian not only learned to smile but also to administer her business to allow it to continue growing. She hopes to continue building her business with a variety of products that meet the needs of her customers; in order to accomplish this she is asking for a loan that she hopes you can give her.

loans.use: Increase her capital to implement her store

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en:
Dragana is a 31 year old woman from Srebrenica. She is married, and her husband works in a zinc factory. They have three children, and they are all attending primary school.

This is Dragana’s second loan, and she is asking for 1200 KM. She intends to use the money to buy fruit trees and prepare them for the winter. Dragana also plans to purchase plums to make an alcoholic beverage called "rakija," or plum brandy, to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruit trees and plums.

loans.name: Alzira Rosa

texts.pt:
Alzira Rosa Z. é natural de Maputo, casada maritalmente e mãe de 5 filhos com idades entre 18, 13, 12, 8 e 6 anos respectivamente, para alem dos seus filhos sustenta uma nora que vive com ela.

Alzira estudou até 9ªclasse e não continuou por ter estado doente, ela cresceu junto dos seu pais e para alem de estudar  aprendeu a costura onde diz que fazia roupas de crianças actividade que veio a parar quando se casou em 1989, neste momento vive numa casa própria.

Alzira vive basicamente de negocio onde aluga  um estabelecimento comercial a 3 anos, o qual  abre das 7:00 e fechas as 21:00h todos os dias tem uma empregada, aprendeu a exercer esta actividade através do seu sogro que é grande comerciante tendo vários estabelecimentos comerciais na cidade de Maputo.

O estabelecimento dispõe de vários produtos em destaque os da primeira necessidade e os que tem mais rendimentos são os refrigerantes e Cervejas no qual vende a media de cerveja 25,00mt e 10,00mt o refrigerante. Tem um rendimento diário que varia de 500,00mt a 1500,00mt e consegue poupar algum mensalmente.

Para Alzira este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, e já teve noutros bancos no valor de 5500,00mt valor que iniciou o negocio. Assim pretende com este valor aumentar os produtos existente para ter mais rendimentos. Constitui seu maior sonho construir seu próprio estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Alzira Rosa Z. is a native of Maputo, married, and mother of 5 children: 6, 8, 12, 13, and 18 years old. In addition to her children, she supports a daughter-in-law who lives with her.

Alzira grew up with her parents. She studied through 9th grade and then discontinued her studies because she fell ill. Besides going to school, she also learned how to sew. She used to make children’s clothes, an activity which she stopped when she got married in 1989. Now she lives in her own house.

Alzira has been living basically off a business, renting out a commercial space, for three years. Her store opens at 7:00am and closes at 9:00pm everyday. She employs one woman. She learned this business activity from her father-in-law, who is a major businessperson who has several commercial enterprises in the city of Maputo.

The store provides a variety of products, mostly basic groceries. The highest-margin products are sodas and beer, which she sells for an average of 25 meticais (MTn) per beer and 10MTn per soda. Her daily sales range from 500MTn to 1500MTn, and she manages to save some money each month.

This is Alzira’s first loan with Hluvuku (Kiva’s Field Partner) and with Kiva. Previously she took out loans from other banks in the amount of 5500MTn to start her business. Now she plans to use this loan to increase her product offerings in order to increase her profits. Her greatest dream is to build her own commercial space.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Madame A. Abla est née en 1977 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit auprès de son mari à Amégnran où elle exerce sa profession de coiffeuse. En plus de la coiffure, elle fait le petit commerce surtout le stockage de céréales. Pour cette saison, elle compte faire plus de stockage de céréales afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et plus rentabiliser son activité. C'est à cette fin qu'elle sollicite un crédit.
texts.en:
Abla A. was born in Lomé in 1977. Married and the mother of two children, she lives with her husband in Amégnran where she works as a hairdresser. In addition to fixing hair, she does a small trade in cereal grains. At this time, Able intends to increase her inventory of cereal grains to better meet customer demand and make her business show a profit. With these goals in mind, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking and selling cereal grains

loans.name: Bajo San Antonio Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO BAJO SAN ANTONIO ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA LUISA AYDEE, ELLA ES SOLTERA Y TIENE TRES HIJOS A SU CARGO LOS MISMOS SON D. CINCO, SIETE  Y DOCE AÑOS. LAS DEMÁS SOCIAS SON TAMBIÉN MADRES D. FAMILIA QUE SE DEDICAN AL TRAJO D. COSTURERIA, VENTA D. COSMÉTICOS, VENTA D. ABARROTES Y A LA COMPRA Y VENTA D. DIVERSOS PRODUCTOS PARA PODER MANTENER A SUS FAMILIAS. EL FINANCIAMIENTO OTORGADO POR LA FUNDACIÓN ESTA DESTINADO AL INCREMENTO D. CAPITAL D. TRABAJO Y A LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS PARA LA VENTA. ELLAS NO PODÍAN CONTAR CON FINANCIAMIENTO DEBIDO A LOS BAJOS INGRESOS QUE POSEEN PERO DEBIDO A LA DEDICACIÓN QUE TIENEN AL TRABAJO LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL LES DA UNA NUEVA POSIBILIDAD D. MEJORAR SU CALIDA D. VIDA.
texts.en:
The group "Bajo San Antonio" (Lower San Antonio) is represented by Mrs. Luisa Aydee. She is single and responsible for three children who are aged 5, 7, and 12 years of age. The other members are also mothers with families; their businesses incluD. sewing, selling cosmetics, selling groceries and buying/selling of various products to maintain their families. The financing requested by the group is destined for increasing capital of work and buying materials to sell. Individually they would not qualify for a loan due to their low incomes but due to the dedication they have to working with the Fundación Agrocapital, they have a new possibility to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Alambi

texts.en:
E. is married with five children and lives in Ntamulung, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. E. runs a small business in her house with her children. With this loan, she plans to buy more cassava, egusi, fowls and work more cassava farms.

This will be E.'s fifth loan from GHAPE; she has been a member since 2000. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to her location (right on the main road), the quality of her products, and her reasonable prices. She buys in bulk, which causes the price to be minimal, and her children help her to process the cassava and produce water fufu. She has a strong customer base and is confident that she will be able to increase her sales.

The part of the profits from this loan will be used for the school fees of E.’s children, and the other part will be used for medication and food for for the family. E. does not foresee a problem with her loan repayments as they are quite small repayments every month. She intends to start repayment in the fourth month after taking the loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buy and sell cassava, egusi, fowls and farming of cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 5 sheets of the "Ordinaria" lottery, 5 sheets of the "Chalupa" lottery, and 5 instant lottery ticket sheets.

loans.name: Oussèye

texts.fr: Oussèye B. agée de 32 ans est divorcée avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Némataba depuis 5 ans et demi.Son activité est le commerce de grained'arachide. Elle veut acheter des sacs de 100 kg, payer le transport pour ensuite revendre.Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance
texts.en:
Oussèye B., age 32, is divorced and has a child to support. She has been a member of the village council of Némataba for five and a half years. She does commerce in peanuts and wants to use this loan to buy 100-kg sacks, to pay for transport, and then offer them for retail sale. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts for resale

loans.name: Chizoba
