texts.en: Chizoba sells groceries, drinks and food. Chizoba is a LAPO client. She hopes for a loan of N50 000 ($350 USD) to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.She is 41 years old and is married with 4 children. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell

loans.name: Julia Cirila

texts.es:
Julia se crió en el cultivo de frutas, en particular de palta. A esto se dedicaban sus padres, y a esto se dedica ella ahora. Tiene una chacra donde cultiva principalmente palta, que significa que su negocio está estrechamente relacionado a la temporada de la palta. Cuando salen los frutos ella los lleva a Chosica para vender de ambulante.
También solía preparar comida para turistas que iban por esta zona, pero ya casi no hay más.
A sus 47 años ya casi no tiene gastos más que de ella misma y del hogar, como sus 4 hijos son ya mayores de edad, y solamente el más joven, de 20 años, sigue  estudiando. Junta sus ganancias a las de su esposo, que trabaja en construcción independientemente. 
Julia ya lleva 3 años con lo préstamos de EDAPROSPO, y sus planes para el futuro son de seguir creciendo en su negocio, más que nada por que los paltos plantados de nuevo se demoran unos 5 años antes de producir sus frutos.
texts.en:
Julia was raised growing fruit, particularly avocados. This is what her parents did, and, now, it is what she does. She has a small farm where her primary crop is avocados, which means that her business is intricately related to the avocado season. At harvest time she takes her fruit to Chosica to sell in the streets. She used to sell food to the tourists that visited her area, but now there are very few of them. At 47 years old her principal expenses are for herself and her home, since her four children are already grown and only the youngest, age 20, is still a student. Her income is joined by that of her husband, who is self-employed in construction. Julia has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for three years, and her plan for the future is to continue to develop her business, above all because newly planted avocados take five years before they begin to produce fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another small farm to be able to grow more avocados

loans.name: Alao

texts.en: Alao R. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He sells beef. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more beef to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra A. is 26 years old. She is a divorced mother with one child, a girl. Sandra is an entrepreneur, dynamic, and very dedicated to her work. She divorced some few months ago and the child’s father is not taking responsibility for the child, which means the family burdens rest on Sandra’s shoulders.

Sandra has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for over seven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts. She produces palm oil and supplies it to food vendors who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand becomes very high. Her major business area is the neighboring country Togo in West Africa. She sends gallons of palm oil to retail at Togo and, when she is returning, she buys clothing materials and retails them in her community.

Prices of raw materials are very high making it difficult for Sandra to achieve her target. And it is her dream to achieve her target through loan support. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, and containers to increase her efficiency by producing in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her child’s education.

Sandra belongs to a village bank called “Hannah Mma” which means “Hannah’s children”.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and containers

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: La señora Laura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Trabajadoras”, vive en el Jr. Mariscal Castilla  Nº 117, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02 hijos estudiantes que aun dependen de ella. Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su mamá emprendió un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicado en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará a un plazo de 06 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela. Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Ms. Laura is a member of the communal bank "Las Trabajoras." She lives in San Martin, in the Juanjui district, at 117 Jr. Mariscal Castilla. Laura is 37 years old and the mother of 2 children, both of whom are students. Motivated by the need to make a living, and by her mother, Laura began a small business selling groceries with her first loan of 300 soles. Her business has been successful since the beginning due to the quality of her products, her good prices, and the way she attends her clients. Currently she is continuing with the same business of selling groceries to her neighbors from the store in her home. With this loan of 1,500 soles (that will be paid off in 6 months), Laura will buy more products to stock her store. She'll buy things like: rice, sugar, supplies for personal hygiene, cleaning supplies, soft drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her clients happy. She is very happy to be able to do this work and receive this sort of help. Laura is also grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes Manuela Ramos will keep doing what it's doing and help many families and female entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is a member of the Immaculada Concepcion Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Pilcopata. She is 38 years old and is the single mother of six children. She used to live with her partner, but he left the family. Benigna works cutting lumber from her land; she then ships the wood to Cusco by truck, an eight-hour drive over bad roads. She has been selling lumber for the past three years. 

Benigna is requesting a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use for several different purposes. She plans to use 175 to 375 soles to pay workers to cut trees. She will hire one to two people for one week; she estimates that each person can cut 2,500 feet of wood in a week. She will use another part of her loan to pay for transporting the wood to the city of Cusco, and another part will be invested in a plot of farmland she also owns. 

Benigna has been a member of her village bank for several years now. Her goal for the future is to buy a plot of land closer to the city of Cusco, build a house there, and start another farm.

loans.use: Pay for field workers and lumber transport

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Mwasiti H. from Mwanza. She is married with one child who is 3 years old. Mwasiti has been running a shop business selling mobile-phone accessories since 2006. It is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania. This is probably attributable to the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people because there are few landlines and because mobile phones are relatively cheap here. 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, four days per week and is assisted by one employee. Mwasiti currently earns about $150 per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase more mobile-phone accessories. In the future, she plans to open another business. Mwasiti thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile-phone accessories

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis N., a 39-year-old businesswoman, trades in clothes. She buys clothing at wholesale prices and retails to her customers. Mavis hawks to sell her goods. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to expand her business.

Mavis is married with four children. All of her children are currently in school. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
T. Azimjon is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 7 years. He bakes traditional bread called “lepeshka” at home. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All the input materials such as flour, salt, and yeast must be purchased in the local market. Now due to high demand, Azimjon wants to increase the amount of bread he bakes so he is requesting a loan of 800 USD. The loan will be spent for purchasing flour and charcoal for baking the “lepeshka”. Azimjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you offer him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  flour wholesale for baking  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
Dieciocho mujeres deciden conformar la asociación “BOLIVIA” se reúne cada dos semanas en el centro focal Villa Exaltación, a la cabeza de Teodora S. trabajan de forma responsable en sus actividades internas. Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de celulares, fruta, ropa, productos de limpieza, comida,  y otros.
La asociación Bolivia  desea ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesita de capital para comprar mercadería, de este modo generar mayores ganancias para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
Eighteen women decided to create the association "BOLIVIA" which meets every second week in the hub of Villa Exaltación. The head woman, Teodora S., is responsible for the groups’ internal activities. The group runs a variety businesses, such as selling cell phones, fruit, clothing, cleaning products, food etc. The association Bolivia would like to increase their sales, and for this, they need capital to buy commodities. In this way, they will generate more profit for the well being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Edita Eliza

texts.es:
La señora EDITA ELIZA G. R., tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESÚS EN TI CONFIO
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
EDITA  se dedica a la fabricación y venta de calzado en el centro de Trujillo. 
Los zapatos los fabrica en  sociedad con su hermano, quien es zapatero y es quien le enseño este oficio.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertió en la compra de material como cuero, cuerina , plantillas, pegamento ,etc
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para la fabricación de  sus zapatos.
EDITA sueña con tener  en stand en el centro comercial de Trujillo y poder vender su calzado con mas frecuencia y menos desgaste fisico, ya que en la actualidad los vende en forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Sra. Edita Eliza G. R. is 35 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Jesús En Ti Confio”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 2 dependent children, ages 9 and 5.

Edita makes and sells footwear in central Trujillo. She makes shoes with the help of her brother, who is a shoemaker and taught her the trade. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase materials such as leather, suede, insoles, adhesives, etc.

She is requesting another loan of 300 soles to purchase more supplies for making shoes. Edita dreams of opening a stand in the central business district of Trujillo so that she can sell shoes more frequently with less physical effort. She currently sells her products door-to-door.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Ilem Group

texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Ilem borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 29,25,20 and 17 years old.

Lucia  has owned a Tailoring business  for 10 years. She works 11 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 80,000T Tanzanian shillings.

This is Lucia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lucia hopes to save money and expand her business.

Nelly, Joyce are also the member of the same borrower group, they also requested the loan amount of 200,000 and 150,000 respectively in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es: Baltazar V. Canton Urbina de 34 años de edad, reside en San Juan Opico en el departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Yanira de 6 años de edad y Jefferson de 10 meses. Baltazar posee una tienda, instalada en su casa, que se ubica en un pequeño cantón  donde no hay competencia de sus productos, el crédito que solicita Baltazar es para surtir su negocio, de esa manera aprovechara la demanda de su tienda y aumentaran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Baltazar V. Urbina Canton is 34 years old and lives in San Juan Opico, which is in the department of La Libertad. He has a wife and two children, Yanira (age 6) and Jefferson (age 10 months). Baltazar operates a grocery store out of his home. Since he lives in a small community, there are no other competitors for the products he sells.

The loan he is requesting will be used to restock his store. The additional capital will enable him to meet customer demand and increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

loans.name: Cariñositas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Las Cariñositas” están representados por la señora Mercedes y conformado por 15 miembros muy unido y activo, como lo demuestran en cada reunión, La presidenta tiene como actividad la venta de ropa en el mercado central y eñl resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, venta de ropa, bisutería, promotora de cosméticos refrescos, atención en salones de belleza, y a la construcción de viviendas una mayoría de las socias son madres de familia. La competencia hoy en día se ve más que en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido de sus clientes, además tratan de vender su producto a un menor precio minimizando sus costos y  generando una ganancia razonable para el sustento de sus familias. El destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería como ropa de la temporada, pagos de deudas, compra de insumos y materiales y la adquisición de herramientas de trabajo. El destino del crédito es para la compra de cosméticos en baratas, harina para hacer empanadas y al compra de materiales e insumos para sus negocios de comida, zapatos y ropa. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya tienen experiencia en grupos comunales gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la modalidad de trabajo y saben como administrar bien los fondos otorgados.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Germie

texts.en: Germie G. has a transportation business in Panglao, Bohol. She is 47 years old and has two children. Her eldest child is six years old. She wants to sustain her business for the education of her children. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of PHP 18,000. This loan will be used to maintain her vehicle.

loans.use: To maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a 40-year-old married woman with six children aged between 4 and 22 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a six-room house where she lives with seven people. Jalia takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. 

She incurs transportation costs to and from Owino market. She works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a shop selling second-hand clothes in Kisasi Kikulu zone. She sells both retail and wholesale. Jalia works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. 

She also owns a charcoal business and rental rooms.  Her major business challenges include thieves and ever-increasing prices of second-hand clothes. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.  She has been in this business for more than six years and with MCDT for 10 years. This is her 20th loan working with the same group. Jalia joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups to secure loans. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start selling wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
“Work hard to achieve success.” That's an inspiring quotation shared by Julieta L. of Barangay Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. After her high school education, she got married to Pablo L. and they are blessed with five children. They want all of their children to be successful in their chosen professions so that they will be employed someday.

The major source of their income is through farming. They till their parcel of land twice a year. They plant rice, corn and some vegetables. Julieta is also engaged in selling fruits and vegetables, using her bicycle to roam around the village, to earn additional income.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school expenditures, she wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10,000.00 to increase her vending capital in order to improve her small business. She believes that with her patience and sacrifices, she will be able to improve her small business and support the schooling of their children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vending business

loans.name: El Naranjal Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “El Naranjal” esta representado por la señora Norah y conformada por 15 miembros que van cusrando ya juntos su segundo cclo demostrando responsabilidad y ganas de sacar a delante sus pequeños negociso con la yuda economica que les brinda la institución, ellas se dedican a actividades como la venta de empanadas y refrescos, verduras frescas, comida tipica, ropa para niños, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y otros se dedican a actividades de transporte, sastrería y al empleo en diferentes empresas. El nivel competitivo en los rubros a los que se dedican las socias es elevado pero saben como salir adelante gracias a su entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para para la adquisisción de mercadería, insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos los cuales les servira para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias ya trabajaron con la fundacion y desean seguir creciendo junto a nuestra institución para buscar un futuro mejor para sus hijos y para su familia.
texts.en:
The El Naranjal Communal Bank is represented by Norah. It is comprised of 15 members who are in their second cycle together. They demonstrate responsibility and the desire to get their small businesses ahead with economic help offered by the institution. They work in activities like selling empanadas and soft drinks, fresh vegetables, typical food, children’s clothes, and groceries in neighborhood stores. Others work in transportation, tailoring, and as employees in different businesses. The level of competition in their fields is high, but the members know how to get ahead thanks to their enthusiasm and desire to succeed. The loan is for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and materials to increase their sales and their income. The income will serve to improve the quality of life for their families. As far as experience goes, the members have already worked with the foundation. They want to keep growing together with our institution to look for a better future for their children and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
La señora Casilda es casada, tiene dos hijos varones, estudiantes y comerciantes a la vez. Toda la familia se dedica en macate; es decir venta ambulante de mercaderías a crédito. 
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar un stock de mercaderías, en esta temporada ellos entregan en forma masiva los productos y después va cobrando a sus clientelas en forma semanal, quincenal y o mensual dependiendo de los ingresos de los mismos.
La señora Casilda tiene agradece con el apoyo de toda la familia y gracias a esos tiene casa propia y va incrementando sus ingresos que en el futuro le va a servir para tener una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Casilda is married. She has two adult sons who are students and businessmen at the same time. The whole family is dedicated in Macate. That is, they sell merchandise for credit on foot. The loan requested is to increase their stock of merchandise. In this season, they deliver their goods in bulk and later charge their customers on a weekly, biweekly, or monthly basis depending in their income. Casilda is thankful for the support of her family and thanks to them she has her own home and is increasing her income which, in the future, will allow her to have a more dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pans, coffee pots, baking sheets, and other items.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La Sra. Gladis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Chankas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 57 años y 04 hijos, que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, y es el orgullo, para seguir trabajando.

Gladis, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y generando  su propio capital, así de esta manera decidió implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos, con el que en la actualidad continua, pero ya siendo de ella misma y contando con un local propio muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que día a día van a su local.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo seguirá formando su propia red de representantes de la línea Avon.

Gladis, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Gladis, 57, is a member of the "Los Chankas" communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is divorced and has 4 children, one of whom is still dependent on her and is a student; he is her pride and joy and the reason to continue working. Gladis is a woman who has surpassed many difficulties that have arisen in her life; she feels happy to have accomplished this. Little by little she was able to set aside some savings and generate her own capital. She decided to use it to set up her own beauty supply sales business. She is still in this line of work but it is her own business now and she has her own, well-equipped locale in which to tend to her customers that visit her daily. This 1000 sol loan will be used to buy stock beauty items like: perfumes for ladies and gentlemen, creams, compact powders, lipsticks, nail polish. In addition, she will continue to establish her own team of Avon representatives. Gladis, with her maturity, is an example for many other women who are starting out in business who, with perseverance, manage to reach their goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business as well as helping other women who want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.en: J. Asomidin is a father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture for the past five years, cultivating potatoes, onions and carrots. He is also engaged in livestock and his children help him with the business. His daily efforts and the care of his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits. Asomidin has dreamed of extending his lands. He wants to obtain a loan to invest in his current land by purchasing seeds and fertilizer to earn greater profits and reach the goal he has set for himself. Asomidin thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with no violations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma N. is 46 years old, single and lives on the island of Binangonan, an attractive province of Rizal. Reaching older age, she is working hard on her own. She is grateful that there is an ASHI center in her village that offers her inspiration in life and group support to achieve her dreams.


In 2007, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap Inc.), a microfinance institution and KIVA field partner in the Philippines. Norma cooks and sells fried “itik” (small ducks). She has been in business for more than two years. She believes that her proposed loan of Php 20,000 will contribute to the sustained growth of her business. She will use all of the loan funds to pay for fresh “itik”, as well as inventory for her coco jam business.


Half of her dreams have been gradually achieved, but she is still dreaming about completing them. Norma is a positive and optimistic woman who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for fresh " itik" (small duck), as well as inventory for her coco jam business.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: José Gabriel tiene 58 años, es un hombre trabajador que ama su trabajo. El se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de soldadura hace mas de 31 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que para en ese tiempo tenía que mantener a sus 4 hijos, que actualmente trabajan de manera independiente, pues le fue de gran ayuda ya que él les proporciono estudio y todas las cosas necesarias. El solicita actualmente este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima para su taller. Su deseo es seguir acondicionando su vivienda que es lugar de su trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, and he's a hardworking man who loves his work. He has been offering welding services for more than 31 years. He started this business for himself because, at that time, he had 4 children to provide for. Today they all work independently, but he was of great help to them as he provided all the things they needed. He is requesting this current loan for business capital that will be used to buy raw materials for his workshop. His wish is to continue improving his home, which is also his work place.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Aura Aurora

texts.es:
La Señora Aura Aurora Mejia, es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, comarca La Rastra, ha tenido 2 créditos, es una excelente cliente, los ha pagado en tiempo y forma con sus abonos mensuales, solicita un crédito para mejorar su negocio, para compra de cosméticos, ropa para niños, jóvenes, tales como: camisas, pantalones y cosméticos.
Le ha servido mucho ya que gracias al crédito su familia ha salido adelante y vive dignamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Aura Aurora Mejia, from the city of San Francisco del Norte, La Rasta region, has had 2 loans. She is an excellent client and she paid her loans and repayments back on time. She is requesting a loan in order to improve her business to buy cosmetics, children’s and teen’s clothing like: shirts, pants. Thanks to the loan her family has moved forward and they live with dignity.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and young people, cosmetics

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère neuf (9) enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8ans et a eu 16 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine, elle achète les bêtes sur pied, les engraisse pour les revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. En sus, elle s'active au tour d'un petit commerce de balais. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is a 34-year-old lady who is married and mother to nine children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for 8 years and has had 16 successful loans. She fattens up cows and sheep, she buys the live animals and then fattens them up for 4 to 5 months for resale. In addition to this, she runs a small broom business. She plays her part in improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business of fattening animals for sale

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is the wife of T. S. and lives in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Shagufta is an uneducated lady because her parents were not in a position to provide her with a good education. She got married at the age of 18 and started her married life. She is very supportive lady. She always works for the betterment of her family. For this reason she owns & operates a handbag-selling business. She sells variety of handbags such as leather made & cloth made. She earns approximately Pak Rs. 6,000 every month. Her income allows her to pay the utilities. 

Her husband has a food business. He runs a food stand in the main market where he sells a famous dish named “Daal chawal” to his customers. He has been selling it for over 5 years. Their earnings help them to support the family. 

Shagufta is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase food items (rice, lentils, cooking oil and spices) in bulk for her husband’s food stand so he can earn a good profit and can expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase food items for food stand

loans.name: Horonya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Horonya de l’association  Benkadi est composé femmes mariées de la ville de Tènèni, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et se sont connues à travers le voisinage. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 7 enfants. 
Elles ont une expérience d’une année avec Soro Yiriwaso et exercent le commerce de condiments alimentaires  et la  restauration. 
Mata Koïta  qui est une des restauratrice du groupe compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, les ingrédients et le poisson  à des fins de restauration. 
Elle achète par jour 12 panier de poisson, 1kg d’oignon un panier de tomate et les autres petits condiments. 
Elle se ravitaille au grand marché de Tènèni et vend ses plats alimentaires à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Mata espère sur un bénéfice de 12 000FCFA pendant que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser 8 000 FCFA par mois. 
Ce bénéfice servira non seulement pour rembourser le prêt, venir en aide aux conjoints et réinvestir dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The group Horonya of the association Benkadi is composed of married women of the city of Tènèni, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members live in large traditional families, and they know one another through neighborhood ties.  They average 45 years of age and have at least seven children.  The group members have one year of experience with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and they do commerce in condiments and in food catering.  Mata Koïta, one of the restauranteurs in the group, plans on using her loan for buying fish and the ingredients for food catering purposes. Each day, she purchases twelve baskets of fish, 1 kg of onions, a basket of tomatoes, and sundry other condiments.  She resupplies herself at the big market of Tènèni. She sells her dishes to a diverse and varied customer base. Mata is hoping for a profit of 12,000 francs CFA, while the other group members plan on making 8,000 francs per month.  This profit will be used not only for repaying the loan but also for helping out their husbands and reinvesting in their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for food catering

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita D. is from Oroquieta City. She is 56 years old, widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Purita owns and operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing food services and food for daily meals to the local community. Purita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Purita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Purita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan she has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motorbike

loans.name: God’S Gift Group

texts.en:
Yah G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Gift. She is 36 years old, married and has four children who range from 20 to 8 years old. 

She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been selling beans, oil, pepper, and peanuts slippers, soft drinks, water and biscuits in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. She cares for one sibling.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more slippers, soft drinks, water and biscuits. She describes herself as respectful and hardworking.

Her dream is to grow her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: Buy more slippers, soft drinks, water and biscuits.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 24 years old. Jean is married. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling dried fish and shrimp in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma O. R.    es una señora de 37 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.
Con el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia ella buscó alternativas diferentes y desde hace poco más de un año inició un negocio,  una panadería , en la cual  ofrece diferentes tipos de pan y sobre todo repostería casera.  Dice que le ha ido muy bien ya que en su comunidad ha tenido mucha aceptación puesto que antes no había un lugar que brindara ese servicio.
En estos momentos lo que desea doña Norma   es solicitar un préstamo  por ¢623 000 (Seiscientos veinte tres mil colones) para mejorar las condiciones del local donde se elabora el pan. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más  ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida. 
Doña Norma  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y mantener  su negocio
texts.en:
Norma O. R. is a 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in a community named Santa Fe, in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community lies in a mountainous zone very close to our country's northern border. The area's leading economic activities are ranching and farming, especially staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. With the desire to improve her quality of life and that of her family, Norma was looking at various alternatives, and a little more than a year ago, she started a business: a bakery in which she offers different types of bread and especially homemade pastries. She says that the business has gone very well for her; she has enjoyed great acceptance in her community, since there had previously been no business providing this service. At this time, Norma would like to request a loan of 623,000 colones in order to improve the infrastructure of the place where she bakes her bread. With this, she hopes that her microenterprise will grow and generate more income to raise her standard of living. Norma is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe (Santa Fe Springs Communal Credit Company), one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she hopes that it will help her to grow on a personal level and allow her to maintain her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to improve her bakery

loans.name: Wanjohi

texts.en:
Wanjohi is a farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He has been farming for 18 years. His farm produces vegetables, milk, maize, beans, potatoes and eggs, which he sells to the local market. Wanjohi is happy about his farming activities since he solely depends on the income from farming to cater for the needs of his family.

Wanjohi recently completed his fifth loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that the extra income he will earn will enable him to invest in other income-generating activities to supplement his income. He does, however, face the challenge of poultry diseases and a poor market for his products.

Wanjohi is 37 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 9. Two of the children attend school. In the future, he hopes not only to keep the local breed of birds but to also keep the exotic breed.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng P., 45, is homemaker. She stays at home to tend to her daily routine. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a sport instructor at high school. Another source of family income is from her child who works as a requirement laborer. 

Sreng P.’s husband always faced difficulty traveling to work: he goes to work by taking a taxi which is very expensive. To help solve the problem, Sreng P. has decided to seek a loan in the amount of US$ 700 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, to be used to buy a second-hand motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring taxis.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa T. is from the village of Nabannagan, Lasam, Cagayan. She is 37 years old. Luisa is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegetable seeds such as beans in the local community. Luisa is just starting her business.

In 2010, Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Luisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds for sale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita M. is a married woman who lives in Zone 10, Bacuyangan, Hinobaan, Neg. oCC. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  rice retailing and a scrap recycling businesses. Her husband, Bonifacio M., who is 48 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have 14 children who are 5 to 24 years old. Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000. She intends to purchase unmilled rice grains to dry, process and resell so that she can continue to save up to send their children into school to finish their studies. Nenita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

Nenita is shown in the accompanying picture with the rice grains she is sun-drying before she sends it to the rice mill for processing.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque. Se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), con el cual brinda servicio de transporte en las ciudades de Olmos con sus principales caseríos. El negocio lebrinda algunos ingreso con los cuales sustenta la economía de su familia. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura.

Fernando desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vehículo ya que el continuo uso otorgado y el mal estado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Fernando es una persona bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para hacer progresar a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 32 year old father who lives with his family in the Insculas sector of the Olmos district; an agricultural zone belonging to the Lambayeque province.  It's located more than one hour and fourty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been providing cargo and passenger transportation on his motor-taxi for the past 2 years.  He provides his transportation service in 
the city of Olmos and its main establishments.  The business provies him with some income to economically sustain his household, he also works in agriculture.

Fernando wishes to make some improvements on his vehicle since the continous usage of it along with the poor condition of the roadways in the area have caused it to require urgent repair in order to gurantee proper function.  That is why he found it convenient to solicit Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1500 ($550) nuevos soles.

Fernando is a very responsible person with great will to get ahead.  His biggest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order for his family to progress.

loans.use: Reparation costs and maintenance for motor-taxi.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister Wasonga is a fifty-four-year-old modest lady from Corner Maji area of Manyatta estate, a low income estate within the city of Kisumu. She is married to Tom who is a driver and they have five children; Irine 23 years, Mercy 20 years, Ishmael 17 years, Beryl 10 years and Isaac who is five years old.

Wilkister operates a food kiosk at Corner Maji shopping center and has been doing this business for the last five years. Wilkister has been in KADET LTD for a long time as she is taking a 7th loan of KES 50,000. She is grateful that KADET LTD has brought her this far in terms of success in her business because she makes a monthly profit of KES 20,000. Wilkister will use the current loan to purchase food stock like meat, wheat flour, cooking oil and many more. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to one day own a stable food kiosk and she also aspires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Buy meat, wheat flour, cooking oil to add to stock.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in the historic city of Pakistan called Lahore. She lives there with her family in an area named R-A Bazar for over 12 years.  She is 38 years old, is married to S. J. and has three daughters. All of her daughters attend school to get an education. Her husband is involved in a rent a bike business. He gives his bikes to people on rent and charges them on an hourly basis.   

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another motorbike and use it for his business.   The additional bike will help his customers find a bike for their use, otherwise due to the limited numbers of bikes, he has been unable to fulfill the orders on time.  

Naseem is hopeful that this investment will bring more profits to her husband’s business and her family’s financial life will become easier.  She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.   

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy another motor bike for the rent-a-bike business.

loans.name: Emelecio

texts.es: Emelecio M. es una persona muy esforzada quien ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a su familia. Él vive junto a su esposa  y no posee hijos. Luis posee un molino el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación la cual esta ubicada en Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde las personas llegan a moler: maíz, frijoles, verduras y diferentes tipos de alimentos ya sea para elaborar algún tipo de masa o para hacer salsas. Emelecio solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar un molino más y de esta forma atender a más personas, ya que muchas veces no da abasto con el que ya posee. Él desea mucho mejorar su negocio, debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee para vivir de una forma digna.
texts.en:
Emelecio M. is a very determined person who has worked very hard to get his family ahead in life.  He lives with his wife and doesn't have any children.  Luis owns a mill which is located in his home, in Ciudad Arce, in La Libertad department.  People come to him to grind corn, beans, pulses and other different types of food, either to make some kind of dough or to make sauces.

Emelecio is requesting a loan so that he can buy another mill and thereby serve more people since often he can't serve enough customers with the one he already owns.  He would very much like to improve his business as it is the sole source of income he has for living a decent life.

loans.use: To buy a mill

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Alisalam

texts.en:
Alisalam A. is a married 32-year-old man. He lives with his family in Mahammadali village in the Imishli region. He is a father to one son and one daughter. In 2007 he started his own poultry business to support his large, six-person family. It is the only source of income for his family.

This is the first loan Alisalam received from Aqroinvest and KIVA. He used the 1000 AZN loan to buy more chickens. After repaying this loan Alisalam plans to take out another loan to build a new hen coop.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros, al lado de ellos y de su esposa Mireya de 25 años; juntos trabajan para salir adelante y así progresar. Desde hace 6 años este emprendedor joven se dedica a la fabricación de puertas, ventanas armarios, y todo lo que los clientes le pidan en el taller de metales que tiene su suegra en su casa, y en el cual él trabaja. A veces labora  en el mismo taller y otras veces, de acuerdo al pedido, se dirige a las casas o empresas a realizar la labor en metal, y esta muy satisfecho pues las ganancias son considerables, y con el tiempo ha aprendido bastante de su suegro, quien es especialista en el rubro metalúrgico. Como su esposa tiene 6 meses de embarazo, y esta a punto de ser padre, tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar su propio taller de fabricación metalúrgico, pues se quiere independizar de sus suegros. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Wilfredo tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de metal que necesita para terminar con un pedido que tiene pendiente, y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 24 years old and he lives in the house belonging to his in-laws. He lives together with is wife Mireya, 25, and they work together to make ends meet and to improve their situations. This young entrepreneurial man has, for the past 6 years, made doors and mirrors and whatever his clients request of him in his mother-in-law's blacksmith shop. He caters to private homes and to businesses to do blacksmithing for them, and he is very happy with the business because his earnings are considerable.  With time he has been able to learn a great deal from his father-in-law, an expert blacksmith.  His wife is 6 months pregnant and he is soon to be a new father. He has many plans for the future, including setting up his own blacksmith shop to become independent from his in-laws. This is the third loan he requests a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and his is committed to making his payments on time, especially because he doesn't want to cause any trouble for those individuals who made this loan possible. This will permit him to keep working and progressing in his plans. Wilfredo's plan is to invest the loan in the purchase of metals that he needs to complete a projet that remains incomplete.  He will improve his earnings with this help.

loans.use: To purchase metals.

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Артиков Юлдош проживает в районе Кубадиян. Ему 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Его дети взрослые. Они работают и живут самостоятельно. Сам Юлдош имеет среднее образование. Подрабатывает строительными работами по найму. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кроме того у него имеется столовая, где он работает помощником повара. Уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых принадлежностей и светомузыки. Он намерен расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Yuldosh A. lives in the Qubadiyon district. He is 45 years old, married with four grown children. His children work and live independently.Yuldosh has secondary education. He works part-time in construction work for hire where he has extensive experience. In addition, he works in a dining room as an assistant cook for over a year. He is asking for a loan for the purchase of necessary supplies, lights, and music. He intends to expand the activities of the dining room.

loans.use: Purchase of necessary supplies, lights, and music

loans.name: Jose Bitelio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su familia esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, ellos residen en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, el negocio comenzó por el apoyo de su padre, quien le enseño el cuidado que necesita la crianza de los cerdos, esto le ha permitido tener experiencia en su granja.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar cerdos, con este préstamo aumentara su número de cerdos en la granja de los cuales engordara para luego venderlos.
Esta compra le ayudara a ampliar el negocio, incrementándole la oportunidad de ganar más ingresos y ampliar la granja, mejorando así las condiciones de su negocio y la de su familia.
Sueña en ser una gran comerciante de cerdos, aportar para su familia todo lo necesario y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, aged 5 and 2, in San Rafael Oriente, in San Miguel department.  His business is raising pigs.  He started his business with the support of his father who taught him how to care for the pigs he would raise.  This gave him experience on his farm.

José is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs.  He will use the loan to increase the number of pigs on his farm which he will fatten and then sell.  This purchase will help him to expand his business and increase his opportunity to make more income.  This will improve his business and improve his family's living conditions.

José dreams of becoming a large-scale pig salesman, providing his family with everything they need and looking out for his children's well-being.

loans.use: To buy pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. sells smoked fish at Abbrem Agona near Abura in Cape Coast. Adjoa received a junior high education. She is divorced and has three children. Adjoa has been selling fish for three years and is responsible for the general welfare of the home. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build proper shade where she can sell.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Musyimi

texts.en:
Musyimi N., 45, is married to Monica, and they are blessed with two children. He has been in the business of making and selling ice cream for eight years and he earns a profit of KES 15,000 per month from this business.

N. has a very good credit history with KADET. He has applied for his fourth loan after paying the previous loans successfully. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy raw materials like sugar, milk powder, and food color.

He will use the additional income generated from the loan to educate his children. In the future he hopes to set up his own factory.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like sugar, milk powder and food color

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a member of the communal bank "Alondras" at FINCA Peru in Ayacucho. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children who are all studying. She has a clothing business and also sells vegetables in a local market. She is using her loan of 3,000 PEN to purchase clothing from Lima to sell in Ayacucho. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now and enjoys that it gives her more independence and allows her to save money. She would like to save enough money to buy land in Ayacucho.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia   es una clienta antigua de la institución y  ha mostrando buena voluntad de pago y un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se le hizo,   La clienta cuenta con su propio vehículo (minibús), que se encuentra inscrito en le sindicato mini sur de la ciudad de la Paz Para la subsistencia de la familia ellos trabajan de horas 6:00 am a 20:00 pm, el esposo es quien conduce el vehículo y la señora Virginia es la ayudante quien cobra los pasajes y administra los ingresos del día,  es sacrificado el esfuerzo que ellos realizan para tener mejores condiciones de vida,  el mayor sueño de la familia es llegar a tener un  patrimonio estable y que sus hijos lleguen a tener una carrera profesional, por lo que se esfuerzan en lograrlo día a día, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Virginia realizara el mantenimiento de su minibús, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. OJO: en la foto se encuentra junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Virginia is a long-standing client of our institution.  She has always shown a willingness to make her repayments and was kind and polite during her evaluation.  Our client owns her own vehicle (a minibus) and is a member of the Mini Sur drivers' union in the city of La Paz.  In order to provide for their family, Virginia and her husband work from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  Virginia's husband drives the vehicle and Virginia is his assistant.  She collects fares and manages the day's takings.  Their efforts require a lot of sacrifice but they carry out their work in order to attain better living conditions.  The family's biggest dream is to be in a stable financial situation and for their children to become professionals.  They work hard every day to achieve this.  Virginia will use her loan money to have some maintenance work carried out on the minibus.  Virginia is a very hard-workiing person.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

Note: Virginia appears in this photo together with her husband.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on her vehicle (changing the piston rings)

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina G. V. de diecinueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y con su hijo en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee un negocio de confitería en el Centro de San Salvador. Maximina es una joven emprendedora que está luchando por sacar a su familia adelante, ella es muy dedicada a su labor y siempre  recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa pues su venta de dulces lo amerita, su negocio es muy visitado pues ella posee mucha variedad y siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan, su demanda de producto la motivo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer su dulcería con caramelos, bombones, chocolates, chicles entre otros; de esta manera no defraudara la necesidad de su clientela y podrá seguir solventando las necesidades de su hogar y con confianza y esfuerzo lograra una mejor calidad de vida para su familia
texts.en: Maximina G. V. is 19 years old and lives with her life partner and her son in San Salvador department.  She owns a candy store in the center of San Salvador.  Maximina is an enterprising young woman who is striving to get her family ahead in life.  She is very committed to her work and always greets her customers with a smile.  Her business is very popular because she offers a lot of variety and always has what people need.  The demand for her products motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL which would allow her to stock her store with candy, chocolates, chewing gum, etc.  In this way, she won't disappoint her customers and will be able to continue covering her household needs.  With faith and effort, she will manage to achieve a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy candies, chocolates and chewing gum

loans.name: Nelly Norma

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer se reúne en el sitio Bajo de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, es un pequeño lugar rodeado de mucha vegetación, sus habitantes se dedican a diferentes actividades como comerciantes y empelados de fabricas.

La señora Nelly es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque se lleva muy bien con sus compañeras. Tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos, 5 de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y el menor tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella además de una nieta de 12 años que también está en colegio y es como su hija. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el cual tiene un negocio de fabricación y venta de ladrillos, el trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 junto a tres personas  a quienes les paga  un sueldo semanal, ellos se encargan de fabricar este producto para luego llevarlo en su carro a otras ciudades  a entregar en distintos lugares que requieren de los mismos.

Este crédito es para compara materia prima para la fabricación de los ladrillos como tierra negra, agua, cuerina y paja. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por el compañerismo que hay en el banco.
 
Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tienen les está dando muchos problemas.
texts.en:
The communal Bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) meets in a place called Bajo de Montecristi in the province of Manabí.  It is a small place surrounded by a lot of vegetation.  The residents make their livings in different activities, such as in business and as factory workers.

Señora Nelly is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because she gets along well with the other members.  She is 56 years old, is married, and together with her husband has 6 children.  5 of her children are grown.  The youngest is 17 years old and studies in high school.  Three of her children still live with her in addition to one 12-year old granddaughter, who is also in school and who is like a daughter to Nelly.  Señora Nelly's husband is a business man.

She is requesting the loan to help her husband, who has a business making and selling bricks.  He works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00am until 5:00pm with three other people to whom he pays a weekly salary.  They see to the making of the product which they later bring in their car to other cities, where they deliver the bricks to different places that need them.

This loan is for the purchase of raw materials for making bricks: black dirt, water, imitation leather and straw.  

Señora Nelly has been with the communal bank since its inception, and she likes it for the friendships she finds with the bank members.
 
Her dream is to purchase another car, since the one they have is giving them a lot of trouble.

loans.use: to purchase black dirt, soil, imitation leather and straw for making bricks.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria nació en la comunidad de Vilcabamba distrito de Caicay de la provincia del Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 47 años edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la comunidad de Vilcabamba. (La comunidad de Vilcabamba se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona ganadera y agrícola, esta comunidad está ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco).

Su actividad económica principal de Gregoria tiene una chacra donde siembra maíz, papas y habas, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales como por ejemplo vacas, chanchos, gallinas, conejos y cuyes. Su actividad económica complementaria es vender cerveza, gaseosas, chicha de jora, ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio donde expende sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Con el préstamo que Gregoria va recibir, ella invertirá en la compra de cerveza y maíz para hacer jora. 

Gregoria pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Gregoria was born in the Vilcabamba district of Caicay in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department.  She is 47 years old and has four children.  She lives in the Vilcabamba community.  Vilcabamba is known for its beautiful scenery, its livestock, and its farming.  This community is located 35 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Gregoria’s main business activity is her farm.  She grows corn, potatoes, and beans.  She also raises animals like cows, pigs, chickens, rabbits, and guinea pigs.  

Her additional business activity is selling beer, soft drinks, and “chicha de jora” (a corn-based Peruvian beverage).  She has a small restaurant at her house where she sells her products.  She has had this business for several years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

Gregoria will use the loan she will receive to buy beer and corn for making jora.

Gregoria belongs to the Mamacha del Carmen Communal Bank of the Arariwa Asociación.  The communal bank is in its third year, and it is going very well for them.

loans.use: to buy beer and corn for making jora.

loans.name: Durasan

texts.en:
Durasan is married and has four children.

Since 2006, he has owned a small business selling various home products including shampoo, soap, cleaning agents, office supplies, etc. Located in the central market and offering good prices, his store attracts many customers. 

Durasan is a very responsible and disciplined person. He is not alone in his business; his father actively helps him.

He is now requesting a loan of 1,300 AZN to purchase additional inventory, hoping to thereby increase sales and develop his business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sonia es una pequeña comerciante, que junto a su esposo trabajan en su casa de habitación, el negocio es una pulpería que inicio hace seis años y que  ha venido creciendo al incrementar su inventario con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en varios ciclos, también vende tortilla pues la demanda es mucha, logrando así la captación de sus clientes.
Pues como madre está contenta ya que puede trabajar y cuidar de sus hijos al mismo tiempo.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la inversión de compra de quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, productos de uso personal, como jabón de baño, cremas, cosméticos, shampoo, productos de limpieza. Productos que se venden mucho por ser necesario en nuestra higiene. Su objetivo es tener mejores resultados de ingresos ya que los tiene que pagar sus compromisos de pago de agua, luz, medicina, y seguir teniendo un buen comportamiento de pago en la institución.
texts.en:
Sonia is a small business owner. She works out of her house together with her husband. They own a small grocery store which they opened six years ago. They have been able to grow their business thanks to various cycles of AFODENIC funding which they used to increase their inventory. They also sell tortillas. There is a high demand for tortillas and this has allowed them to increase their number of customers. As a mother, Sonia is happy because she is able to work and take care of her children at the same time. 

She plans to use this new loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, and personal products like soap, lotion, cosmetics, shampoo and cleaning products. These products sell quickly because we need them for hygienic reasons. Sonia's goal is to increase her income as she has to pay the water bill and the electricity bill as well as pay for medicine and continue meeting her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase food and personal hygiene products in order to increase sales at her small grocery store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es casada, tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio Guarani, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familar y movilidad propia (moto y motocarga).
Ella se dedica a la venta de panificados  de elaboración propia. Desarrolla esta actividad hace como 4 años, posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el desarrollo de esta actividad y sus panificados son muy reconocidos por la excelente calidad de los mismos.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materia prima, para elaborar mayor cantidad de panificados y mejorar sus ingresos; agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado a través de la posibilidad de adquirir el crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia is married.  She is 45 years old and lives in Guarani neighborhood, in the city of Pilar.  She owns her own home and has the basic conditions she needs to carry out her business activities in the heart of her family.  She owns her own transport (a motorbike and a motorbike for carrying goods).

Lucia is in the baked goods business (she makes these herself).  She has been in this business for four years and has the infrastructure she needs to carry out this business activity.  Her baked goods are very well known for their excellent quality.

Lucia is requesting this loan to invest in buying raw materials to make a larger quantity of baked goods and improve her income.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have given her by allowing her to acquire this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making baked goods

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 44-year-old man, married with eight children between 2 to 19 years old. His wife is a farmer. Bernard owns a residential house and lives with 12 people in Karuguuza, Uganda. For 15 years, Bernard has been dealing in secondhand shoes and from it, he has been able to buy land for his family and build a home. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital but hopes to expand his business to a wholesale status. He is requesting for a loan to buy more secondhand shoes for selling..

loans.use: to buy secondhand shoes for sale.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías se dedica a la carpintería , el pidió el préstamo para   comprar mas material ,  ya que  casi no hace trabajos grandes solamente pequeños por falta de material.
Cuenta  con un local grande  pero lo que no tiene es suficiente material y cuando tiene trabajos grandes le pide a su hermano Ulises , también es carpintero y le presta material , pero a  Elías para  comprar material para poder ser mas independiente.
Sus clientes le dicen que les gustaría que compre mas material ya que ellos quisieren  trabajos pero como no tiene material no le encargan nada  de los que ellos les gustaría.
Elías tiene    treinta años de edad, estudio la secundaria  la termino es una buen carpintero  es casado con la señora Lucero y vive  con sus papás, le gustaría  comparar mas material, para hacer mas trabajos  y a si comprar una casa.
Tiene dos hijos  Adriana de  diez años edad y Luis de  2 años  de edad , por ellos quiere  mejorar su carpintería , para  que tengan una casa propia.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el préstamo que le han dado ya que  va comprar mas material para hacer mas  grande su inventario ya que estaba escaso.
texts.en:
Elías is a carpenter.  He requested a loan to buy more materials.  He hardly does any big jobs now; he only does small jobs because he needs materials.

He has a large place, but he does not have enough material.  When he has big jobs he asks his brother, Ulises, who is also a carpenter, to lend him material.  However, Elías wants to buy material so that he is able to be more independent.

His customers tell him that they would like for him to buy more material because they would like to have what he makes.  As he does not have material, they do not order the things they would like to.

Elías is 30 years old, and he finished high school.  He is a good carpenter.  He is married to Lucero, and they live with her parents.  He would like to buy more material to complete more jobs.  That way he will buy a house.
