He has two children.  Adriana is 10 years old, and Luis is 2 years old.  He wants to improve his carpenter’s shop for them so that they can have their own house.

He is grateful to the Fundación Realidad for the loan they have given him.  He will buy more material in order to increase his inventory because is it sparse.

loans.use: to buy carpentry material.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
At 43, Marcelo has been engaged in the rice farming business for 30 years. He is married and has three school-aged children. His wife is his one and only lifetime and business partner in farming and they work to ensure their essential needs.

Marcelo encountered hindrances in generating a large income in farming, such as typhoons, pests and droughts. However, he never loses hope. Instead, he optimistically finds solutions to overcome these problems.

He is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy hybrid seeds to grow in his farm. He will also use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

Marcelo is a hard-working father who does everything to sustain his family's needs and to continue sending his children to school. He believes that through his farming, his children will someday become professionals and have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds to grow in his farm and to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 25 years old and is married with one child who is in school. She raises livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past year and has sustained it with two previous loans from NWTF.

Vivian is requesting a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.es: Diomedes, de 32 años es un hombre ejemplar que junto a su esposa Elsa, trabajan y progresan para el futuro de sus 2 hijos, Ángelo de 12 años y Benjamin de 15 días de nacido. A los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Yanapuquio. La principal actividad de ellos es la agricultura, junto a su esposa, siembran en sus terrenos agrícolas “papa”; ya tienen 10 años dedicándose a ello, lo que más les gusta es poder verlos crecer fuertes y nutritivos, ya que sus ganancias depende mucho de la calidad de sus cosechas. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Diomedes; como buen trabajador, él cría una variedad de ovejas, a los que alimenta para luego vender su carme en el mercado central de su ciudad, ahí también aprovecha el viaje de más de 2 horas; para vender su cosecha de papa. Además de tener el apoyo de los 2 burros que posee, los que le ayudan a cargar los sacos de papa en las largas jornadas de caminata.  Ahora con el apoyo de su banco comunal, está pensando abrir una pequeña tienda de ropa en una de las principales localidades de su ciudad; asimismo ya está juntando dinero para poder mejorar su casa. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Zona semillero de Yanapuquio” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde gusta de las reuniones que constantemente realiza con su banco comunal, allí puede intercambiar experiencias. Además agradece el apoyo que recibe de parte de todos ustedes. Diomedes de obtener el pequeño préstamo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un burro, al que piensa llamar “chato”, cuyo precio oscila entre 300 nuevos soles y el resto de dinero lo invertirá en la compra de varias cabezas de ganado ovino.
texts.en: Diomedes, 32, is a model family man.  He and his wife, Elsa, are a team, working hard to make a better life for their 2 children: Angelo, 12, and Benjamin, just 15 days old.  They live in a house they own in a rural part of Yanapuquio.  Most people in the area make their living from farming.  Diomedes and his wife grow potatoes on a farm they have operated for 10 years.  Seeing his plants grow strong and healthy is what he likes best about farming because his earnings depend on the quality of his crop.  But Diomedes does more than just grow potatoes.  He also raises sheep and fattens them for a market in the city.  The market is 2 hours away but he uses the trip to sell his potato crop, as well.  He owns 2 burros that he uses to carry the heavy bags of potatoes he collects.  He's thinking now of opening a store, with help from his community bank, to sell clothing in a shop in the town.  For now, though, he's trying to get enough money together to improve his house.  Diomedes belongs to the "Zona semillero de Yanapuquio" community bank and this is his fifth MFP loan.  He likes bank meetings because they're opportunities to trade experiences.  He adds that he's grateful for all of the support that he's received from all of you in the past.  Diomedes will use part of this loan to buy a burro (who he plans to name "Chato"), which should cost around 300 new soles, and the rest to buy several head of sheep.

loans.use: to buy farm animals for his farming business.

loans.name: Gladys  Ruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORIMANCACHA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys Ruth; ella tiene 65 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones, la socia tiene varias habitaciones en su casa y alquila a estudiantes y a personas en general, la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar e implementar los cuartos D. alquiler. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pintura y accesorios para arreglar los cuartos que alquila. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "QORIMANCACHA" which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Gladys Ruth is 65, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her room rental business.  She has several rooms in her house that she rents to students and people in general.  Through her business she has been able to support her children.  Now she wants to expand and fix up the rental rooms.  She is requesting a loan to buy paint and accessories to renovate the rental rooms.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy paint and accessories to renovate the rooms she rents.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 40 years old, married and has three children to sustain. To generate income, he devotes his full time to his farming business. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders in the village. He usually earns about P20,000. 

He needs to improve his crop production in order to earn consistent profits for the college education of his children. He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings in his half-hectare plot of land. With the help of this loan he would improve his yield. 

In the future, Solomon wants to see all his children well educated and owning a degree, and to have a good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers who help transplant rice seedlings

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business selling beans and groundnuts in Jigomoni branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income to pay for her child to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 56 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforma su compañera de viada y sus hijas. Para tomas lo más importante es su familia la cual es su principal inspiración para luchar día a día por un futuro mejor. Él es un hombre increíble ya que a pesar de su edad  no se cansa de trabajar. Tomas se dedica a realizar viajes tanto de personas como de materiales. Tiene muchos clientes fijos y cada día son más las personas que solicitan su servicio. Para él lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que ofrece, razón por la cual siempre está pendiente de tener su vehículo en buenas condiciones. Últimamente ha notado un deterioro de su vehículo ya que uso es constante y necesita mantenimiento. Debido a lo anterior ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el mantenimiento del vehículo que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Espera tener resultados positivos de esta decisión y seguir brindando el buen servicio tal y como hasta el momento lo ha hecho. De esta manera confía mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Tomas is 56 years old. He lives in his own house together with his family. It is composed of his life partner and his daughters. For Tomas the more important thing is his family. They are his principal source of inspiration to keep struggling day after day for a better future. He is an incredible man who, despite his age, is a tireless worker. Tomas is a transportation driver for both passengers and for cargo. He has many steady clients and each day there are more people who request his services. The most important thing for him is for his clients to be satisfied with the service he offers. This is the reason why he is always careful to have his vehicle in a good state of repair. Lately he has noticed the deterioration of his vehicle, especially because it is in constant use, and it requires maintenance. For the reason previously mentioned he has decided to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). He will invest it in the maintenance repairs of his vehicle, which is his primary working tool. He hopes to attain positive results from this decision and to keep providing good services, as he has to date. He trusts he will be able to improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Quince Mas Uno Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Quince más Uno”, lo conforman17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, artesanía, comercio, corte y confección, peluquería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Independencia, ciudad de Santiago. 
Mónica integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en cuclillas, ubicada en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, usando lentes de sol. Ella se dedica a bordar ropa, desde hace 1 año y medio.
Su trabajo lo denomina “bordado con sentimiento”, ya que escribe poemas, nombres, dedicatorias en diferentes prendas, según lo requiera cada cliente. Algunos de estos productos son mantas y poleras.
Sin embargo comenta que la demanda de sus productos y/o servicios es relativa, por lo que no resulta conveniente tener solo ese negocio, de esta manera incorporó a sus servicios la creación y hechura de logos corporativos en empresas, ya que estos se realizan al por mayor y resulta más conveniente económicamente.  
Mónica realiza publicidad de su trabajo mediante un Blog que tiene en internet, además de dar datos a sus conocidos y amigos. 
Sus materiales los compra en las comunas de Independencia y Estación Central. 
Con el crédito comprará poleras, telas de polar y toallas para bordar.
Sus metas son expandir su negocio y prosperar con su negocio. 
Mónica vive junto a sus dos hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son que sus hijos puedan concretar sus proyectos, su hija anhela estudiar odontología en una Universidad Estatal. Por lo tanto Mónica se esfuerza a diario para generar nuevos y mejores ingresos, para también brindarles a sus hijos un mejor bienestar económico. 
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida del crédito entregado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal al cual participa está muy afiatado y sus anhelos son similares de construir proyectos en grande y poder concretarlos. 
Independencia es una de las 34 comunas que componen la ciudad de Santiago (capital de Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional de la ciudad. Su eje principal es la Av. Independencia, por la cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta de entrada por el norte, a la ciudad de Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena de Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Quince más Uno” (Fifteen plus One).   It has 17 members who are in a variety of businesses.  Among them are crafts making, commerce, dressmaking, barber shop, among others.  They all live in the city of Santiago’s Independencia Commune.

Mónica is a member of the communal bank and she’s squatting in the photo, first from left to right and wearing sunglasses.  She has been working embroidering clothes for the last year and a half.

Her business is called “Bordado con Sentimiento” (Embroidery with Feeling) because she writes poems, names and dedications on various articles of clothing according to the customer’s wishes.  Some of these products are t-shirts and blankets.

However, she comments that demand for her products and/or services is irregular so it’s not a good idea to only have this single business.  Therefore, she added to her services creating and making corporate logos for firms since these are produced at wholesale and are economically more convenient for her. Mónica publicizes her work through a blog she has on the Internet as well as providing her data to acquaintances and friends.  She buys her supplies in the Independencia and Estación Central Communes. This loan is to buy t-shirts, thermal fabric and towels to embroider.  Her goal is to expand the business and to make progress with it.

Mónica lives with her two children who are 18 and 13 years old.  Her dreams on a family level is that her children are able to make their projects reality.  Her daughter hopes to go to dental school at a state university so Mónica strives daily to generate new and better income to provide her children with the best possible economic wellbeing.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business and generate higher profits.  She comments that the group in the communal bank she participates in is very strong and they share similar goals of building projects on a large scale and to be able to make them happen.

Independencia is one of the 34 communes that make up the city of Santiago (Capital of Chile) and is located in the center-north sector.  It arose at the end of the 19th-century as a traditional part of the city.  Its main axis is Independencia Avenue which used to be the ancient Road of the Inca which was the northern gate of the city of Santiago.  Because of its extensive indigenous population the Chilean Indigenous Cultural Center is found in Independencia.  It also has important historical buildings among which are six historical Chilean monuments.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, thermal fabric and towels to embroider.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 44-year-old married Lebanese man who lives with his wife and three children. His children are still attending school. He is the main income provider of the family. Ibrahim is doing his best to satisfy his family's needs. He has been working as a glazier for the past 21 years and opened his own shop three years ago. Today, he’s requesting to borrow 1,200 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new glass supplies and mirrors. He really believes that this Kiva loan will increase his productivity by a large percentage. In the future, he plans to enlarge his business operation.

loans.use: To purchase new glass supplies and mirrors

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Anar jive v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet dvux prekasnix detey , odin ix kotorix xodit v shkolu. Anar 33 qoda. Za svoi 33 qoda on nauchilsya mnogomu, on rabotal v raznix mestax, on ochen trudolubiviy chelovek, qotov rabotat na luboy rabote glavnoye soderjat svoyu semyu. Uje 6 let kak on otkril svayo kafe gde sam je i rabotayet. Seychas on nujdayetstya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye stoli i stulya tak kak v techenii 6 let yego mebel isportilas uje. Chtobi nachat etot bizness yemu pomog yego dyadya kotoriy uje imel svayo kafe.
texts.en: Anar lives with his family in the Baku region.  He is married and has two beautiful children, one of whom attends a school.  Anar is 33 years old. He had learned a lot over his 33 years and worked in different places.  He is a very hardworking person, who is ready to do any work as long as he can support his family.  Anar opened his own cafe, where he also works, six years ago.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy new tables and chairs because his furniture got worn over the last six years.  Anar's uncle, who also had his own cafe, helped him to start this business.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Tuinuane Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tuinuane Women Group in Western Kenya! Timothy is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Timothy is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Timothy had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest one bag of maize on 3/4 acre of land. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Timothy and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Timothy will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tuinuane Women group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr:
Anta est une jeune marchande de fruits  âgée de 24 ans. Elle a quitté tôt les bancs pour se lancer dans le petit commerce il y a de cela 10 ans.
Elle se met à un arrêt de car pour vendre des oranges, des mandarines et d’autres fruits de la période.
Malgré son jeune âge Anta participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Elle est ambitieuse car elle veut devenir une grande commerçante dans ce domaine.
texts.en: Anta is a young fruit vendor, 24 years of age. She dropped out of school early in order to go into small business. This was 10 years ago. She switched gears in order to sell oranges, tangerines and other seasonal fruits. In spite of her young age, Anta contributes to the family budget. She is ambitious and would like to become a big vendor in this field.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale

loans.name: Jun Remy

texts.en:
Jun Remy is 38 years old and lives in Lalao, San Juan, Siquijor. Jun Remy is married with one infant child.

To earn a living, Jun Remy sells fresh caught fish from fishermen and delivers them to the market every day.  Each month he earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fresh caught fish from fishermen and deliver them to the market.

Jun Remy has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, he dreams of having enough savings to be used for the purposes of renovating his house.

loans.use: to buy fresh caught fish from fishermen and deliver them to the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sacs of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Ronie has a shop that sells coconuts & bananas. He has had this business for 3 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy coconuts &n bananas for sale.
Ronie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ronie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for sale

loans.name: Fredy Raul

texts.es:
Fredy es un hombre de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Fredy no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Fredy trabaja como obrero de campo en un vivero de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Fredy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de la vivienda donde vive, pues desea hacer el tarrajeo y pintado de su vivienda, de esta manera Fredy brindara mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Fredy is a 36-year-old man living in the city of Chincha with his wife and the small son they love. He is their principal reason for living. Fredy is a very likable, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to advancing his family. Unfortunately, for lack of economic resources, and due to the necessity to work to cover his expenses, Fredy was unable to study for a professional career. But he would have liked very much to have done so. In his free time Fredy likes to watch television and occasionally cook a rich 'Carapulcra' [a Peruvian creole dish] with Dry Soup to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with much effort and dedication, Fredy works as a laborer in a plant nursery in his city. Every day he labors from the early hours of the morning for up to 10 hours a day. Fredy is happy with his work and believes that it's going well due to his good effort and because of his friendly treatment of everyone.

Fredy is very grateful for Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, he is able to make improvements to the house where he lives. He now wishes to plaster and paint his home. In this manner, Fredy will offer better security and wellbeing to his family. He intends to continue working and pressing ahead in order to achieve his grand dream of providing a proper home.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home, including plastering and painting.

loans.name: Siminkor

texts.en:
K. is a married woman aged 49 years and has 4 children. She is a dedicated group member of Osotua women Group a community based organization. She keeps her savings with the group and all members of the group are encouraged to save as a means of accumulating capital.

K. has been in business for over 20 years, she runs a small retail shop in Kepiro Trading centre and the major items sold include among others Sugar, salt, match boxes, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and vegetables. Her daily sales are in the range of $50 to $ 90. Because of having limited funds, she stocks after every two days thus, transport expenses are high and this reduces her profit margin. With a loan of $400, she will stock all the necessary items at least twice a month. She will also stock other items that are not in her shop at present which are frequently asked such as pishori rice. This means that her shop will be a one-stop shopping centre in a rural setting. She will be guaranteed of increased sales and high profit margin as well.

loans.use: She would like to buy 2 boxes of soap, a bag of sugar, 100 ropes and other household items for the shop.

loans.name: Soltan

texts.en: Soltan S. lives in the city of Agsu and owns a ironworks shop where, for the past 10 years,he has made gas and wood burning furnaces for homes and offices. He is 47 years old. Soltan is married and has two children. With this loan he hopes to purchase more materials and to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for his business

loans.name: Leumele

texts.en: Leumele is very creative and she specializes in making handicrafts and to sell.  The competition selling handicrafts is sometimes very high, so she has started selling cooked eggs as an alternative business for additional income.  Leumele earns ST$420 (approx. USD$160) fortnightly, which helps a lot in supporting her children, family and church activities. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more materials for her businesses and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy eggs, and supplies for handicrafts

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio V. is from Carapeguá, he is 38, married and father to a newborn baby. When he was 12 years old he was taught his father's craft, and he is now a blacksmith who works mostly making the grills and ironwork for windows.

After years of apprenticeship and his father's passing away, Eladio took charge of the small business. He did it well, and even worked on developing the tools so as to be able to work the iron better and improve the quality of the products.

He needs a credit to invest in purchasing steel and iron sheetswholesale, and a new blowtorch, so as to improve the quality of his work and thus increase his income. Eladio says that he does all he can to give his son all that he needs and for him to grow up healthy and with all the opportunities possible.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Maite Barragán

Eladio V. es de Carapeguá, casado con 38 años y un hijo recién nacido. Desde los 12 años aprendió el oficio del padre que también fue herrero con fuerte orientación hacia la fabricación de rejas de hierro para ventanales.

Después de años de aprendizaje y el fallecimiento de su padre, Eladio tomo el desafío de seguir con la microempresa. Lo hizo de manera correcta incluso mejorando en herramientas de manera a mejorar la calidad de los productos y la comodidad en la producción.

Hoy día necesita un crédito para invertir en chapas de acero, hierros al por mayor y un soplete nuevo de manera a abaratar sus costos y conseguir un mejoramiento en el acabado de sus trabajos, que le generarán un aumento en sus ingresos . Eladio dice que extrema sus esfuerzos por llegar a darle todo lo necesario para que su hijo crezca sano y con posibilidades de ser educado y desarrollarse como persona.

loans.use: purchasing steel and iron sheets wholesale and a new blowtorch

loans.name: Enma Lili

texts.en:
My name is Enma Lili and I have a small business selling produce in a city market. I have been in business for several years, and the income my business generates allows me to help cover my family's living expenses and my children's education. My children attend high school and help me in their free time. The most important thing is that I can take care of my children while continuing to run my produce stall.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Enma Lili, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de verduras en el mercardo municipal de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares, gracias a este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de educación de mis hijos, actualmente ellos estan cursando la secundaria, los que me colaboraran en el negocio en su tiempo libre y lo mas importante es que puedo atender a mis hijos y el negocio.

loans.use: To purchase white onions, potatoes, tomatos, pineapple, sweet potatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, sweet chilis,  plantains, and yucca.

loans.name: Assissatou

texts.en: Assissatou E. is a 51-year-old disabled woman. She works with her daughters in the Treichville market in the south of Abidjan. Assissatou is a widowed woman and has 5 children. Her husband died some months ago, and she is now the sole resource provider for her family and takes care of her children alone. So, three of her children were then obliged to stop their studies in secondary school in order to help their mother in the market. Assissatou is a cosmetic products seller. She sells various fashion products and wants to replenish her store for the coming celebration period of the end of the year and Christmas. Assissatou has been in the AE&I microcredit program since September 2005 and has been a very good performer since then.

loans.use: Assissatou Essou will use the loan to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Gulboy

texts.ru:
Gulboy A. is 52 years old, he has a higher education and is an agricultural economist, he is married and has 3 children. Gulboy owns a farm where he grows a variety of products: wheat, corn, peas, etc. He is the director. At the start of the planting season he plans to plant 11 acres of wheat. He already has the seeds. He plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and petrol to work the land, as they are currently much cheaper then they will be in high season.

Gulboy will sell his harvest to local residents at a lower price then is available in the market. The local residents will use the wheat to make flour at the mills and then use it to bake bread for personal use. This will help them to save money. Gulboy plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Акрамов Гулбой, возраст – 52 года, образование высшее, по специальности – экономист в области сельского хозяйства, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Гулбой имеет собственное дехканско-фермерское хозяйство, которое занимается в основном посевом и выращиванием сельхозкультур разных видов таких как: пшеница, кукуруза, горох и др. Он занимает должность директора. В связи с началом посевного он планирует посеять на 11 га земли пшеницу. Семена пшеницы у него имеются. На полученный кредит Гулбой хочет приобрести удобрения и горюче-смазочные материалы для обработки земли, так как в настоящее время цена на них намного ниже, чем будет в сезон. Полученный урожай он будет продавать местным жителям по более низкой цене чем на базаре, из первых рук. Большее население данного района приобретают пшеницу, а затем на мельницах получают муку, из которой в дальнейшем изготовляют хлеб для личного пользования. Себистоимость муки производимой таким образом ниже цены на мешок привозной муки, что положительно отражается на семейном бюджете в сельской местности. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizier and petrol

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: “I live in a 2-room house in Vehari with my five children and my husband. I am grateful that all my children are in school and getting a reasonable education. While my nuclear family and I are ok, I would like to help out my brother so he can establish himself. He sells plastic toys and whistles to children in Vehari and wants to buy some in bulk. For this purpose he requires a loan. If you could help us, I would be grateful.”

loans.use: Purchase plastic toys and whistles for re-sale

loans.name: Nery Carmen

texts.es:
Nery Carmen T. Perez is the mother of two girls (ages 3 and 1 respectively). This woman's business is selling clothing and she tells us that she married at a very young age and had no experience with this type of work, as she previously helped her mother do housework. She established her business when her husband was unable to meet their household expenses, due to the fact that that his income was too low, and this way, the two of them began working hard to support their two beloved daughters.

Mrs. Nery has workded with CEPRODEL for 4 years now, and is very happy with the loans which have already been provided. They have helped her meet the needs of her business and her customers. To date, she has had 20 loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Nery Carmen T. P. es madre de dos niñas en edades de tres y un año, el negocio de esta señora es la venta de ropa y según cuenta, se casó muy joven y en ese momento no tenía ninguna idea en lo que respecta al negocio de venta de ropa ya que anteriormente ella le ayudaba a su mamá en los quehaceres de la casa. El negocio de la venta de ropa lo comienza cuando su esposo no logra cubrir los gastos del hogar por recibir bajos ingresos, de esta manera entre ambos comienzan a trabajar fuertemente por llevar el sustento a sus dos amadas hijas.

Doña Nery trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que le han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 20 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale in her business. (Compra de ropa)

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por El Progress, Group 2

texts.en:
Dilcia is a young and vivacious woman who lives with her husband and three children (ages: 11, 6, 5) in a small community in Puerto Plata. She works a lot, but when she is not working she loves watching tv and drinking soda. This is her second loan. With her first loan she set up a small juice stand in her community. She sells several different types of juice including passion fruit, orange, pineapple, and apple.

Dilcia's first loan allowed her to make about $2000 RD Pesos (about $60 USD) more every month than she did before. She hopes to continue improving her juice stand and also wants to carry a larger variety of juices. She will buy a blender to make the polular “baditas” drinks that combine fruit, ice, and milk.

She wants to thank everyone who is supporting her loan, and who has taken the time to read about her life and her business. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and on behalf of Dilcia, we thank you for your support!

loans.use: tp purchase a blender, milk, ice and fruit

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru:
Karima Kaharova lives in the town of Quargan-Tube. She is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has secondary education. By profession, she is a pastry-cook. She owns a small business - she bakes pastries at home and sells them in large quantities to distributors, who in turn sell her products in markets. In addition, people place custom orders and she bakes for them, as these types of products are in high demand. In small towns and villages, people often organize celebrations and fully serve the guests. For this reason, they often buy baked products. This helps them to save money and time. Currently, Karima has one oven, which is not enough. Lack of the second oven becomes a bottleneck and prevents her from producing more.

She decided to purchase a large oven, and for that reason, is asking for a loan. The credit will help her increase the volume of production and sales. Karima will be able to collect earnings earlier than before. Even a small extra amount of income will help her family improve their standard of living since she is the sole provider for her family. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кахорова Карима жительница города Курган-тюбе. 48 лет , замужем и имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По профессии кондитер. Занимается частным предпринимательством. Выпекает на дому булочки и сдает под реализацию на рынки.Кроме того она выпекает булочки на заказ , так как эта продукция пользуется спросом у населения. В сельской местности население часто проводят мероприятия и накрывают столы , поэтому им необходимо покупать выпечку. Это помогает им сэкономить время и деньги .Сейчас у клиентки есть одна печка и ее ей не хватает , потому что это замедляет ход работы. Теперь она решила приобрести большую печь , путем получения кредита. Это поможет клиентке увеличить объем выпекаемой продукции . тем самым увеличивая реализацию. Это поможет Кариме получить доход немного больше чем раньше , даже небольшой доход поможет ее семье жить лучше. Так как она является единственным кормильцем семьи. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Shaydulo

texts.ru:
Shaydulo G. lives in the Khuroson area. He is 52 years old, married with 6 children. He has a community college degree. His business is raising & selling calves. This is the sole income of his family. He buys young calves at the market, feeds them for about 40-45 days to fatten them up and then re-sells them at the same market. He has been doing this for over 10 years and through this business has made a living for his family. At the moment Shaydulo would like to buy his next calf, but he does not have enough money. He has requested a loan which he plans to pay back in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Гулаев Шайдуло Ходжаназарович проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 52 года, женат ,имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Клиент занимается животноводством. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Шайдуло покупает на рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их 40-45 дней. Затем продает их на том же рынке. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 10 лет. Этот бизнес позволяет ему содержать его боьшую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить очередного бычка. Для чего ему не хватает своих денег. Шайдуло решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Mrs. Pramila M. lives in Baghdol, Lalitpur, a town where many people run small businesses such as grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops and so on. Mrs. M. lives with her husband, Bijay M., and one daughter. Bijay is an army officer, and her daughter is in school in the 12th grade.

Two years ago, Mrs. M. opened a beauty parlor. Before doing this, she trained for six months at an institute in a nearby city.

She is seeking a loan of $150 to buy equipment for her salon. She wants to increase her income so she can provide a better education for daughter.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Robinah Nandyose's Group

texts.en:
Robinah is the leader of 4 members. She is 32 years old and single with 3 children. Her children are 9, 15, and 17 years old and all attend school. The community she lives and works in is urban and is a slum within a low-lying area that floods in the rainy season.

Robinah has been operating a hotel and selling food for the past 7 years. The market for her business is fair, and her main challenge is paying the high rent while also ensuring she has enough money to pay her children’s school fees.

Robinah plans on using this loan to pay her children’s school fees and invest more into her business. She has successfully paid back 7 loans and in doing so has been able to feed her family and educate her children. In addition, she has been able to buy a plot of land where she hopes to one day fulfill her dream of building a house.

loans.use: To further invest in her business

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.en:
Sohibjon C. is 26 years old. He has been married for about two years. His wife is a teacher in the local school. Currently, Sohibjon does not work within his profession, but tries to feed his family by running a retail store. Sohibjon has been running his business for about 3 years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of housewares. His business is the family's main source of income.

As a rule, Sohibjon travels to the neighboring town of Khujand 2-3 times a month to purchase his goods. Sohibjon is trying to have a wide range of goods with good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income.

Today, Sohibjon is requesting 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000) for a term of 12 months. This is the second time that he has asked for a loan through IMON. It will be used to buy more housewares in order to increase the range of his inventory. Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro-entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, Sohibjon is qualified to receive such a loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new housewares to expand the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Zouloholou

texts.fr: M. Zouloholou, célibataire sans enfant est née le 30/05/1984 à Lomé. Elle est coiffeuse et n’a plus une autre activité rémunératrice de revenu. Elle sollicite un appui financier pour s’équiper en matériel et en produits cosmétiques   pour développer son salon de coiffure afin d’exercer convenablement son activité.
texts.en:
Zouloholou M. is single without children and was born in Lomé on May 30th, 1984. She is a hairdresser and does not have another source of income. She is requesting financial support to buy equipment and cosmetic products to improve her hair salon so that she can run her business well.

Translated from French by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work equipment and cosmetic products

loans.name: Ni Putu Susiyani

texts.id: Putu Susiyani seorang ibu rumah tangga yang punya kegemaran memelihara babi dirumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp 2.000.000,- Susiyani membeli 2 ekor babi induk, setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan, 1 ekor induk mempunyai anak 6 ekor , dan induk yang satunya 7 ekor. Anak babi dipelihara selama 2 bulan dan laku terjual Rp. 200.000,- per ekor. Susiyani memberi makan babinya dua kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Selain memberi dedak, Susiyani juga memberikan daun-daunan seperti daun pisang, daun talas, batang pisang. Sebelum diberi makan babinya dimandikan dulu dan kandangnya dibersihkan sampai bersih. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebanyak Rp.80.00,- perekor, setelah dikurangi biaya pakan. Sekarang Susiyani sudah memelihara babi penggemukan sebanyak 6 ekor dan 2 ekor  induk babi yang masih produktif. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dipakai untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga dan juga kebutuhan 1 orang anaknya yang masih berumur 4 tahun yang belum bersekolah. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari diharapkan dapat menambah beberapa ekor babi lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan ternaknya.
texts.en:
Putu Susiyani is a housewife who also raise pigs at home. Her husband is a farmer. They have a four year old kid. With initial capital of IDR 2 millions (around USD 215) she bought 2 breeding pigs, which after 6 months, they had 13 piglets in total. After 2 months, she can sell the piglets for IDR 200 thousand (around USD 22)/ piglet. She can earn a profit of IDR 80 thousand (around USD 9)/ piglet after deducting all the cost.

She hopes to get loan money to enable her to buy more breeding pigs and to add capital for buy pig foods.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding pigs and pig foods (Membeli anak babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mme Adjo A. est née en 1973 à Adangbé  dans la Préfecture du Zio au sud du Togo. Elle mariée à un agriculteur avec lequel ils ont eu trois (03) enfants. Pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région.
Pour augmenter son rendement agricole et ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Ms. Adjo A. was born in 1973 in Adangbé (Zio Prefecture) in the south of Togo. She is married to a grower, and together they have three children. To help her husband address family expenses, she got started in agriculture, notably growing corn, a highly promising sector in the region. To increase her harvest and her income, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizers and to expand her arable terrain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and to expand her arable land

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: El señor Juan de la cruz C. tiene la edad de 54 años habita en los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa ellos tiene  una pulpería la cual la señora la atiende  a su cargo tiene un hijos ya que los demás están casados y viven por cuenta propia, los sueños de don Juan es mejorar su finca para obtener mejor rendimiento en productividad y de esa manera comprar mas tierras y heredar a sus hijos. Este señor tiene 30 años trabajando como agricultor la dificultad mayor ha sido que no le han brindado financiamiento y las plagas han hechos de que sus cultivos no produzcan lo suficiente  por lo cual no ha tenido un resultado sastifactorio para los cultivos.
texts.en:
Señor Juan de la cruz C. is 54 years of age. He lives by the rivers located in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his wife. He has a store which his wife tends. They have one child in their care, since the others are married and live on their own. Juan's dream is to improve his farm to obtain better performance in productivity and in that way to buy more lands for his children to inherit. This man has worked as a farmer for 30 years. The greatest difficulty has been that he has not had financing and plagues have affected his crops so they do not produce enough, which has lead to an unsatifactory result from his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer and herbicide for his crops.

loans.name: Lisseth Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Lissette P. es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega dedicándose a su actividad de producción de miel ya que ella se ha dedicado a la actividad apícola en este municipio.

Por ser una dama muy inteligente ha logrado salir adelante manteniendo a su familia y brindándole las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Hoy en día ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de cajas donde lleva a cabo esta actividad. Es por este motivo que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando la aprobación de un crédito para así comprar dichas cajas y seguir produciendo la miel de las abejas en su municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Lissette P. is originally from the city of Chinandega, and dedicates herself to honey production as she is a beekeeper in this municipality. Because she is a very smart woman, she has managed to get her family ahead and provide for all their necessities. Today, she is asking for a loan to buy cases to carry out her beekeeping activities. She approached Ceprodel hoping to be approved for a loan to buy the cases and continue producing honey from bees in El Viejo in the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases for her beekeeping business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 60 años, es madre de 7 hijos que ya son independientes, viviendo en la actualidad con su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, además de golosinas y bebidas, esto desde hace 10 años atrás en su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar un buen trato a sus clientes y ver crecer cada día más su negocio. Y debido a que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada y concurrida tiene buenas ventas cada día. Lo difícil es enfrentar los cambios climatológicos, ya que por temporada de lluvias no vende mucho. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su negocio, también quiere implementarse de más productos y posteriormente mejorar algunas infraestructuras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old and has 7 children who are all independent. She lives with her partner, who supports her a great deal. She has been selling basic need items, candy and beverages for a living in her own home for 10 years. What she likes about her job is providing excellent customer service and watching her business grow more and more each day. Because her business is located in a bustling area, her daily sales are good. The difficult thing for her is dealing with changes in the weather because during the rainy season, sales dwindle. This is her first loan with MFP. With this loan, she will have her business space expanded, restock her shop with more products and later make home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase amount of goods

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Don Santiago C. V. cuenta con 56 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos vive en el cantón Chuisacmaljá del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Lleva  cinco años dedicado al Comercio en la compra y venta de zapatos el cual es la fuente de sus ingresos para poder sostener a  su familia, debido al incremento de sus ventas acudió a la asociación ASDIR por un préstamo y así poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes de la misma manera aumentar su capital y surtir su negocio, aprovechando la ganancia que le generaran las ventas para poder prosperar y así cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Santiago C. V. is 56 years old. He's married and has 2 children. He lives in the town of Chuisacmalja in the state of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He's been buying and selling shoes for the past 5 years. This job is the main source of income for his family. Due to an increase in sales, he decided to get a loan through ASDIR. He will use this loan to purchase more inventory and to meet his clients' high demands. He hopes to make a good profit and to remain successful so that he can take care of the neccessities of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Sharifjon

texts.en:
Sharifjon M. is the father of four adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in business through the purchase of animals to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Sharifjon is asking for a  loan of $800 USD for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase animals for breeding and sales

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia P. G. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”,  vive en el Jr. Triunfo Nº 1112, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada,  tiene 58 años y es madre de 05 hijos.
Ella se inicio sola, con un capital de S/. 500.00, por iniciativa propia, su primer negocio fue vendiendo menú. Tiene 07 años trabajando con el Banco. 

Actualmente, cambio de negocio, y hace tres meses, se dedica a la venta de frutas, ubicada en su propia casa. Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06  meses,  invirtirá comprando frutas como mangos, manzanas, uvas en cajas, parte d su dinero lo invertirá en la siembra de cacao, cultivo al que también se dedica. 

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien tomas sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera. 

Silvia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Silvia P. G. is a member of the Tesoro Escondido (Hidden Treasure) Village Bank. She lives in the Juanjui District in the Department of San Martín. She is 58, married, and has 5 children. She started out by herself with a loan of 500 soles, and on her own initiative opened her first business, selling set-menu meals. She has been working with the Village Bank for 7 years. For the past three months she has had a new business, and now makes her living selling fruits from her house. She plans to use her loan of 3,000 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy fruits, including mangos, apples, and crates of grapes. She'll invest part of her money in growing cacao, which she also does for a living. Nowadays Sylvia feels more independent and secure because she makes her own decisions regarding her business and its earnings. She would like to express her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businessperson and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mangos, apples, and grapes, and to grow cacao.

loans.name: Florence Atieno

texts.en:
Florence Atieno O. is a 30-year-old mother of four children ages 16, 12, 8 and 6. They are all in school. Florence is married to a mason and they live in Nyamasaria slum. She sells vegetables, small fish and soap out of a small kiosk that is at the doorstep of her home.

Florence buys her goods from the Kibuye market and transports them back to Nyamasaria. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to expand her business. She tells us that most people ask for cooking oil, sugar and flour but she only has vegetables right now. She hopes her children become learned people. Furthermore, she is requesting this loan and hopes one day to get some business management lessons as she is eager to pay back the loan and expand.

loans.use: purchasing staple foods for re-sale

loans.name: Llanilda Purita

texts.es:
LLANILDA PURITA M. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio Nº 441, a 1 cuadra de la Casa del Pescador, en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, tiene 30 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como transportista y tienen 2 hijas, aún menores de edad. Se desempeña como microempresaria en el rubro transportes, porque posee 2 motokars.

Ella tiene 2 años y 2 meses trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar ropa exclusiva, pero luego de venderla al contado y a plazos fijos, invirtió su capital en dar la primera cuota de su primer motokar, y hoy en día ya posee un segundo motokar. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, podrá comprar repuestos y realizar el adecuado mantenimiento de sus vehículos.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque sin tanto trámite logró obtener  un crédito financiero y empezar su vida como microempresaria, lo cual la  motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Llanilda Purita M. D. is 30 years-old, has two young daughters, and lives with her husband (who works as a moto-taxi driver) at their home on Jr. 7 de Junio # 441, one block away from the Casa del Pescador in the Yarina Concha district. She is a member of Banco Comunal "Madres Coraje" and she owns and operates two moto-taxis. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years and 2 months and received her first loan in the amount of 300 Nuevos Soles. With that loan, she was able to purchase and then re-sell high quality clothes. With those profits, she paid the initial installment on her first moto-taxi (today, she owns two of them). With this new loan for 1000 Nuevos Soles, she will be able to purchase spare parts and properly maintain her two moto-taxis. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos, because she was able to obtain credit and start her business without unneeded paperwork and red-tape (this also helps motivate her to make her loan re-payments on time).

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and to properly maintain her moto-taxis

loans.name: Cenaida

texts.es:
Cenaida es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Cenaida es conviviente tiene 39 años  cuatro hijos de 20, 16 9 y 1 año, los tres últimos están estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Cenaida empezó vendiendo productos de belleza por catalogo, y a la vez trabaja limpiando  casa, también   vende ropa por pedido. 
Cenaida necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de una maquina de coser. 
Desde que esta  en Finca aprendió como administra el negocio y ser solidaria con los demás.
El sueño de Cenaida es tener un taller de costura  y tener un carro.
texts.en:
Cenaida is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras community bank. Cenaida, 39, is in a common law marriage. She has four children ages 20, 16, 9, and 1. The last three attend the state school. Cenaida started selling beauty products by catalog. She also works cleaning houses and selling clothes by request. Cenaida needs a loan for 1,600 PEN to buy a sewing machine. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to run her business and be supportive of others. Cenaida’s dream is to have a sewing shop and a car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora Raquel R. tiene 31 años de edad, habitante del sector Xilua en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo posee su pequeño negocio en el cual lo trabaja a diario es taxista, tiene dos hijos ambos los tiene estudiando. El labor de una madre es brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos siendo unos de los principales planes la mejora de su vivienda para que sus hijos tenga un techo en donde vivir.Doña Raquel se desempeña como ejecutivo de ventas desde hace dos años de experiencia, gracias a Dios no le ha faltado el trabajo lo cual le permite ofrecerles a sus hijos poco a poco un mejor nivel de vida. El plan personal y profesional es establecer su propio negocio, una pulpería muy bien surtida trabajando por su propia cuenta y a la misma vez dedicando unos minutos más a su familial el préstamo que solicitad en Afodenic lo requiere para mejoras en los cuartos más en estos tiempos de lluvias y construir un porche lo cual para desarrollar este proyecto necesita la compra de materiales tales como: cemento, láminas, perlines, hiero y zinc. Para tener una casa digna para su familia

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer cuarto

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tea, biscuits, cooking oil, and eggs

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is married with a child who is currently in school. She is 48 years old. She loves trading and trades in used dressing bags and purses. She wants to use the loan to include the sale of ladies’ shoes and slippers. She hawks and treks to other nearby towns to sell her goods. She has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to expand her business. Theresa hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy ladies shoes and slippers

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 1 est un groupe  de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 22 ans, au moins 7 enfants et ont comme activité la  culture  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 1  de Toura  Nabitokan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35.000 à 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 1 is a group of married women from the village of Toura Nabitokan, town of SAN, SEGOU region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families.They have an average age of 22, at least 7 children and their business is the cultivation of peanuts. Anxious in making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of BENKADI 1 group of Toura Nabitokan decided to join the loan program Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. After having repaid correctly the preceding loan, they are on their second rural loan. This loan will be used to buy sufficient quantities of peanuts seeds, small materials and inputs for cultivation mainly at the big market of Kamparana. After the farming season, the harvests are stored for some time for them to gain value before being sold out at the big market of Kamparana and in surrounding markets by retail (often in bulk), for cash, to customers from the big towns. Members of group BENKADI 1 each intend to make, after the sale of their crops, a profit of 25.000 to 35.000 FCFA which will be used to repay interest on the loan and current family expenses.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: El Fresno De La Soledad Group

texts.es:
La jovencita María Guadalupe vive en una pequeña localidad indígena Mazahua denominada la Soledad de Francisco Serrato en Zitacuaro, Estado de Michoacán,  ella decidió unirse al grupo de crédito el Fresno porque esta formado con personas de su misma comunidad a las cuales ella conoce y respeta mucho, la principal inversión de la mayor parte de los integrantes de este  grupo es en el cultivo de huertos de aguacate Hass donde se desea cultivar nuevas plantas y renovar o nutrir las ya establecidas para que den más fruto y de mejor calidad. 
Guadalupe tiene 19 años, es una chica alegre que apesar de su corta edad tiene muchos sueños y metas, estudio la secundaría  y ya no tuvo la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios por la lejanía de la preparatoria y por el gasto que acudir a algun centro de estudios de educación media superior implicaba para sus padres. 
Desde hace varios años surgió en ella la inquietud de poner un negocio que le permita obtener ingresos económicos.  Su mayor deseo es poner un puesto de comida rápida en la zona  industrial de la Ciudad de Zitacuaro. Ella ha pensado que este lugar es adecuado para emprender su actividad económica porque  trabajo un año ahí  y percibió que los trabajadores buscan lugares cercanos por el poco tiempo con el que cuentan para comer ya que no es suficiente para que se trasladen al centro de Zitacuaro o a sus casas a ingerir sus alimentos.  

Ella tiene pensado utilizar el crédito para comprar una mesa, una sombrilla, platos, vasos, un comal, materia prima  y todo lo necesario para iniciar este negocio de comida. Guadalupe visualiza un negocio rentable, que ofrezca comida limpia, sabrosa y económica a sus comensales que serán principalmente los trabajadores de la zona de fabricas. Además ella desea apoyar a sus padres económicamente para que sus hermanos más pequeños tengan la opción de estudiar y para que su familia mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe Sánchez García. Maria Guadalupe is a young woman who lives in a small indigenous Mazahuan town named the Soledad de Francisco Serrato in Zitacuaro, State of Michoacan. She decided to join the Fresno credit group because this group was formed with people from her own community which she knew and respected very much. The main investment of the majority of the members in this group is the cultivation of Hass avocado orchards where they want to cultivate new plants and renew or nourish those already established so that they yield more and better quality fruit. Guadalupe is 19 years old, is a happy girl that in spite of her young age has many dreams and goals. She studied in High School but now does not have the opportunity to continue her studies because of the distance to the school and the expense incurred by her parents of going to an institution of higher learning. It has been several years since she developed an interest in starting a business that would permit her to obtain income. Her main desire is to start a fast food restaurant in the industrial zone of the city of Zitacuaro. She thinks that this is the right place to undertake her business activity because she has worked there for a year and noticed that the workers in the area look for places to eat nearby because they do not have enough time to go to the center of Zitacuaro or to their homes to eat. She has thought of using the credit to buy a table, a parasol, plates, glasses, a cast iron pan for grilling, raw materials and all that is necessary to begin this fast food business. Guadalupe visualizes a profitable business that offers clean, flavorful and economical food to her diners who will be mainly workers in the manufacturing zone. Additionally, she wants to support her parents economically so that her younger brothers have the option to study and so that her family improves their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Un puesto de comida y se invertira en pequeños huertos de aguacate

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora EUFEMIA B. P., tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal JESÚS EN TI CONFIO
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
EUFEMIA se dedica a la crianza de animales como patos, pollos, gallinas para luego realizar actividades como: polladas, patadas, frejoladas, etc
Los fines de semana se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de  golosinas en el terminal terrestre de la salida a Lima.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos como: galletas, jugos, gaseosas, cigarrillo, caramelos, etc para vender ambulatoriamente en el terminal terrestre de la salida a Lima
Este crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de más animales menores para criar y organizar sus actividades.  La mitad del préstamo lo piensa invertir en otro negocio que lo rrealiza en sociedad con un familiar (fabricación de ladrillos).
EUFEMIA sueña con tener éxito en la fabricación y venta de los ladrillos ya que eso la ayudaría a obtener mayor ganancia de dinero. Más adelante piensa dedicarse solo a ello.
texts.en:
Sra. Eufemia B. P. is 58 years old. She lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Jesús En Ti Confio”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has 5 adult children.

Eufemia raises animals such as ducks, chickens, and Cornish hens. She later prepares the birds using different methods such roasting, baking, in stews, etc. On the weekends, she is a traveling candy vendor at the bus terminal and sells to passengers headed to Lima. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy products such as cookies, juices, sodas, cigarettes, caramels, and other products that she could sell at the bus terminal.

She is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase additional small animals for breeding. Half of her loan will be used to enter a partnership that will invest in a relative’s brick business.

Eufemia hopes to have success with manufacturing and selling bricks because she will be able to earn more money. Later, she intends to devote all of her time into that business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional animals for breeding & invest in a brick business

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara sells foodstuffs at Oba Markets. She is 45 years old and married with 7 children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs such as okra, melons, peppers, etc. She thanks you for supporting  the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: Lesbia del Socorro Hernández Manzanares tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Lesbia tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. Doña Lesbia se dedica a la actividad económica como es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda por lo que inicio por cuenta propia ya que anteriormente no trabajaba y necesitaba cubrir los gastos de su casa y así decide dedicarse a este negocio. Es por eso que el propósito de Lesbia es comprar lo suficiente para abastecer la demanda. Y es así como solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así movilizarse hasta las diferentes comarcas ya que es aquí donde es favorable la compra de los cerdos. Los sueños de Lesbia son de establecer un restaurante.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame  Maïmouna  Koné est âgée  de 33 ans et  vit avec son mari et ses 2 enfants dans le quartier Sécoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne pour des raisons sociales (car ses parents voyaient en l’école une porte de déperdition sociale), elle fréquenta plutôt l’école coranique qu’elle abandonna en classe de 3ème année fondamentale (système d’enseignement Malien). 
Elle commença  alors à mener les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des produits importés de la Côte d’ivoire (bananes plantains, atièkè  maniocs etc. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle commença à évoluer seule en opta pour le commerce de l’habillement, de pagnes wax et  de bazins (blanc, teinté, cousu et brodé). Elle mène cette activité depuis 14 ans et  jouit d’une grande réputation dans son quartier et dans beaucoup de structures publiques et privées. 
Dans le souci de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est  à son 1er prêt individuel, après l’obtention de 5 prêts solidaires tous correctement  remboursés. 
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 40 mètres de bazin à Bamako (capitale du Mali) qui sera découpé en pièces, teint, cousu et brodé avant d’être  revendu au comptant et  à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA, qui servira à augmenter son fonds de commerce et de prendre certaines charges familiales.

loans.use: Achat de  bazins blancs.

loans.name: Brigie

texts.en: Brigie P. is from the village of Labo. She is 31 years old, is married, and has school-aged children. Brigie owns and operates a "carinderia” (eatery) business, serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Brigie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Brigie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mr. Saroeun C. is a villager in Prey Chheu Teal Village in Takeo province. He is a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it by purchasing two more piglets and pig food for breeding. He hopes to increase income and improve the family's standard of living with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Neang You, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Saroeun C. is a father of three children who are all attending the local school. His wife appears on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two more piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Badam

texts.en:
Badam is a 60-year-old widow who lives by herself in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. She lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and operates a dairy and flour retail business in her town. She began her business in 2006 by selling her products door-to-door. Her business was successful enough to allow her to rent a stall at a local market where she now sells her products. This business is her only income and she plans to continue working for as long as she is physically able. Badam says, “I do not want to trouble my children to take care of me. I am still strong enough to take care of myself and run my business.” She is requesting a 250,000 tugrug (~170 USD) loan to purchase dairy and flour in order to expand her business.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase dairy and flour

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
La Sra.Aida, madre de 3 niños y separada hace un año, trabaja vendiendo Ropa Americana, principalmente zapatos desde hace 5 años en la Rotonda del Plan 3000 zona bastante populosa de la ciudad de Santa CRuz. Vive en una casa en Anticrético, antes de que se  separara de su esposo lograron reunir la suma de $us 5000 con lo que arrendaron esa vivienda, actualmente mantiene contacto con su esposo gracias a sus hijos, por eso el padre no está eludiendo su responsabilidad de padre de familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo en el cuidado de sus hermanos pequeños mientras ella vende su mercadería todos los días. Pertenece a una asociación llamada “Amanecer”.

El sueño que tiene la señora es el de poder comprar la casa donde vive actualmente, para lo cual esta trabajando fuerte y duro, cliente nueva en nuestra institución que llego por referencia de otra clienta.

La venta de ropa americana, es una actuvudad muy importante en Bolivia, principalmente su comercialización se realiza en ferias locales como la feria 16 de Julio en la ciudad de La Paz o la feria de los cachivaches en Santa Cruz, lugares en los que encuentras ropa 10 centavos de dólar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aida is the mother of 3 children, and separated from her husband a year ago. She has worked for the past 5 years selling American clothing, mainly shoes, in the Rotunda del Plan 3000, a heavily populated area in the city of Santa Cruz. She lives in a house in Anticrético. Before separating from her husband, they managed to save $5,000 US to rent that house. She currently maintains conctact with her husband, and thanks to their children, their father is not neglecting his responsibilities as the father of the family. She counts on her son to watch after his younger siblings while she sells her merchandise every day. She belongs to a group called 'Amanecer' ('Sunrise').

Her dream is to be able to buy the house where they are currently living; for this reason she is working long and hard. She is a new client in our institution and was referred by another client.

American clothing sales is a very important business in Bolivia, and mainly done in local markets like the 16 de Julio market in the city of La Paz, or the flea market in the city of Santa Cruz, places where one can buy clothing for 10 cents on the dollar.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in an established business

loans.name: Maria Valeria

texts.es:
La señora Maria Valeria C. M. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 9 hijos.  
Posee una venta cerca del mercado municipal de granos básicos,  entre ellos esta el frijol (producto que más vende), pepita, maicillo y maíz.
Ella se encuentra feliz con la ayuda que FAPE le ha dado,  su negocio ha crecido y con el mantiene a sus 5 hijos menores de edad,  los otros 4 hijos ya estan casados y no le pueden ayudar a ella.  También tiene crianza de pollos y marranos en su casa.   Vende en el mercado municipal los días jueves y domingos, en las fiestas pratronales y no depende de otros ingresos para vivir.
Su sueño es tener un local en el mercado municipal de San M.,  ya que ella vende en la calle de San Martín (cerca del mercado municipal).
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Valeria C. M. is 54 years old. She is married with nine children. She has a stall near the municipal market with basic grains, among them beans (the product she sells most), pumpkin seeds, millet and corn. She is very happy with the help FAPE has given her.
