Her business has grown, and with it she supports her five youngest children. The other four children are married, and they are unable to help her. She also raises chickens and pigs at home. She sells them at the municipal market Thursdays, Sundays and festival days for patron saints. She does not rely on other revenue to make her living. Her dream is to have a premises in the San M. municipal market, as she now sells in San M. Street (near the municipal market).

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of beans and sale of corn

loans.name: Badar

texts.en:
Badar is the son of M. G.. He is a married man with six children, and he lives in district 1 of Kabul in Afghanistan. His children are students and go to school. 

Badar requested an individual loan of 50,000 AFN for his general store business. He wants to expand and develop his business in order to provide for his family.  

He is very happy with this loan in Afghanistan that can help him support his family and his business. He would like to thank the Kiva process.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children. She opened a tailoring business to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for her children's schooling. She has been involved in this occupation for the past thirty years. Her target, in addition to helping her husband, is to continue their children’s education until the get to university and to provide a good life situation to them.

Today, Faten is requesting $1,200 to buy additional textiles with different colors and qualities to present a variety of products to her clientele.

loans.use: To buy additional textiles

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: V. Pascaline est née vers 1960 à Abomey, une ville historique du Bénin, mais elle vit au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capital économique du Bénin, depuis 10 ans.  Pascaline est mariée à GBEKAN Martial,un cuisinier. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pascaline n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour supporter les charges familiales, Pascaline vend des tenues et divers produits dans sa boutique et de façon ambulante.  Pascaline exerce cette activité depuis 20 ans et s’approvisionne à Lomé, au Togo (pays a coté de Bénin). Pascaline a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé – ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter plus des tenues et divers.
texts.en:
V. Pascaline was born 1960 Abomey, a historic city of Benin.  But she has been living in the Fidjrossè district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for ten years.  She is married to GBEKAN Martial, a cook.  The couple have four children, all in school, and three of them are in their care. Pascaline lives together with her husband and children, and the couple jointly support the family.   Pascaline never attended school.  To cover family expenses, she sells outfits and a variety of goods in her shop and by going door-to-door.  She has been in this business for twenty years and gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo (a country bordering Benin).   She has already obtained loans from ALIDé -- these loans have been repaid. She is requesting another loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and buying more outfits and other goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying outfits

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina B. is from the village of Brgy.Lactawan,Solano,Neuva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Adelina is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried fish and vegetables in the community. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is a 42-year-old woman who remained strong despite so many challenges she went through being poor. She has ventured into several kinds of livelihood activities to have her own income to augment her husband’s small and sporadic income being a hired farm laborer. However, because of the large amount of expenses her family incurs, especially her 10 children whose age range is from two to 23 years old, her income would not be enough to cover everything, including the sustainability of her small business. Despite that, Jocelyn wouldn’t want to stop dreaming and hoping that their lives would change someday. Therefore, she joined ASHI, the first Kiva field partner in the Philippines, in order to request a loan, which will be used to start her own business. Having the opportunity that ASHI is giving her (especially access to loans), she is optimistic that she will be able to have a source of capital to finance the needs of her hog/pig fattening business. Her fattened animals will be sold either slaughtered or alive to people around their village or to meat vendors in the public market. 

For Jocelyn, there is no reason to give up the fight against poverty because her children are innocent about dealing with it; thus, she and her husband have to do it for them. As much as possible, she really wants to offer them a life that is enjoyable and worth living for.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou F. est âgée de 5Oans, elle est mariée et mère de 3enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOLLAR depuis 8ans et y a eu de très bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 16 fois de suite. Elle est vendeuse de charbon de bois et de légumes. Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou F. is 50 years old and is married with three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank NGOLLAR for 8 years and has had 16 very successful consecutive loans. She sells wood charcoal and vegetables. She provides financial support to improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her business selling wood charcoal and vegetables

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Mrs. Chou S., 25, is a married woman who lives in a district of Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She is a good mother who takes care of a school-aged child. Chou S. is a professional teacher in primary school. Besides her work, she does housework and cooks. Her husband buys and sells fish but has a problem with delivering fish to the market because he doesn’t own a vehicle. So Chou S. is applying for a loan to purchase an old motorcycle for her husband to use to deliver fish.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorcycle.

loans.name: Allah Kan Dèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Allah Kan Dèmè est composé de cinq femmes toutes mariées dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, 6 enfants et habitent  toutes  à Sakoïba (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association  traditionnelle d’entraide  des femmes du village. 
Les membres du groupe achètent et revendent essentiellement du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois et des céréales telles l’arachide.
 Le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les a motivé à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après six prêts tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire et Madame Maïmouna C. qui est un des membres évoluant dans l’alimentaire compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7sacs d’arachide en gousse. Elle s’approvisionne à Sakoïba et dans les villages environnants. Elle décortique son arachide, le trie,  le grille et le débarrasse de sa pluche. Elle revend à domicile et à la foire de  Ségou au comptant et à  crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes transformatrices d’arachide en pâte. 
Madame Maïmouna espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser son prêt, contribuer à  certaines dépenses familiales et participer aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes, funérailles).  
Son ambition est de pérenniser son petit commerce et aider son ménage à acheter des animaux de traits.
texts.en:
The Allah Kan Dèmè group is comprised of five women, all married in polygamous families. They are 46 years old on average and have six children, all of them living in Sakoïba (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through family and marriage ties, as well as belonging to the same traditional women's aid association in the village. The group members buy and sell mostly firewood, charcoal, and grains such as peanuts. The need to increase their working capital motivated them to work with Soro Yiriwaso. After six fully repaid loans, they are on their seventh group loan. Mrs. Maïmouna C., one of the group members working with food, plans to use her loan to buy seven bags of unshelled peanuts. She gets her supplies in Sakoïba and surrounding villages. She shells the peanuts, sorts them, grills them and peels them. She sells them from home and at the Ségou market, for cash and on credit, generally to women who transform the peanuts into paste. Mrs. Maïmouna hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay back her loan, contribute to certain family expenditures, and participate in social events (marriages, baptisms, funerals). Her goal is to maintain her small business and help her family buy draft animals.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe G. is from the village of Magalalag, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 39 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Maria Fe owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. Her earned income from the business is being utilized as rolling capital in her business and for her family’s daily needs. Maria Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Maria Fe is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Able And Dependable God Group

texts.en:
Joshua D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Able And Dependable God. He is 45 years old, married and has two children who range from 18 to 30 years old. He is a university dropout due to financial constraints. 

For 4 years, he has been selling slippers, soap, candles, matches and mosquito spray on Carey Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
He says customers get attracted to his business because he talks to them in a friendly manner.

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more stock. He describes himself as a peaceful and quiet person.
 
His goal is to expand his business and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more slippers, soap, candles, matches and mosquito spray.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou S. est un commerçant  qui exerce l’activité  de vente de tissus depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est âgé  de 42 ans, marie et père  de 2 enfants. Il est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis mars 2006. Il a choisi son activité  par expérience. Il sollicite un crédit  de 250 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de tissu s destines à accroitre son stock pour atteindre son objectif qui est de satisfaire   la demande de sa clientèle. L’accroissement  de ses bénéfices  à travers ce financement pourra lui permettre d’atteindre une certaine autonomie financière  et par conséquent  d’améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Aliou S. is an entrepreneur who has been selling fabrics for over ten years. He is 42 years old, married and the father of two children. He has been a member of U-IMCEC since March 2006. He has chosen this line of business because he was familiar with it. He is seeking a loan of 250,000 West African francs in order to increase his stock of fabrics, with the goal of satisfying his customers’ needs. Increasing his income thanks to this loan could allow him to reach a certain financial independence and thus improve the life conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his working capital

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela L. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 20 years old. Pamela is single. To make a living, Pamela runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Pamela has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Pamela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pamela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Pamela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LIZABETH MARIELA, TIENE 49 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA, TIENE UN HIJO D. 24 AÑOS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "MUJERES EN ACCIÓN", INTEGRADO POR 8 PERSONAS. SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE 6 AÑOS INICIÓ EL NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA D. GOLOSINAS, UNA AMIGA LE DEJÓ EL LUGAR DOND. AHORA ELLA SE UBICA CON SU CARRETA, QUE LO COMPRÓ JUNTANDO SUS GANANCIAS ASI COMO TAMBIÉN ADQUIRIÓ UNA PEQUEÑA VITRINA PARA EXHIBIR LOS PRODUCTOS D. VENTA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA PODIDO ARREGLAR SU CASA Y SOBRETODO AUMENTAR SU STOCK D. GOLOSINAS LO QUE LE PERMITE TENER MAYOR INGRESOS Y MAS CLIENTES.
SU META MAS CERCANA ES AMBIENTAR UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA PARA IMPLEMENTAR UNA BODEGA, ASÍ YA NO TENDRÍA QUE SALIR A VENDER A LAS CALLES Y EVITARÍA PASAR FRÍO EN ÉPOCAS D. INVIERNO E INSOLACIÓN EN ÉPOCA D. VERANO.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. GOLOSINAS Y GASEOSAS PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Lizabeth Mariela is 49 years old, married, and has a 24-year-old son. She is part of the "Mujeres en Acción" [Women in Action] group, which has 8 members. Her fellow group members elected her as the head of the group. For 6 years, Lizabeth has worked selling candy. A friend found her a place to park her mobile sales stand, which she purchased with her earnings. She also bought a small glass display case in order to show off her products. With her earnings, Lizabeth has been able to make improvements to her home, but principally she has been able to increase her stock of candies, which in turn has allowed her to gain more customers and make better profits. Lizabeth's current goal is to remodel part of her house to start a small grocery store. This will mean she does not have to sell in the street and will avoid being cold in the winter and getting too much sun in the summer. She will use this loan to buy candy and soft drinks for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy for her store

loans.name: Ivet María

texts.es:
Doña Ivet María R. D., es soltera tiene dos hijos es de profesión contador público habita junto a su familia en el barrio Guadalupe, desde hace treinta y ocho años,  trabaja en alcaldía Chinandega desempeñándose como secretaria desde hace 21 años,
Doña Ivet María R. D., tiene nueve años de trabajar con créditos en CEPRODEL, de los cuales ha adquirido seis créditos cancelando cinco créditos en tiempo y forma demostrando responsabilidad, doña Ivet dice sentirse agradecida con el apoyo que le hemos brindado de darle los créditos en el momento preciso  por que ha podido reparar poco a poco su vivienda y resolver problemas de índole personal .
texts.en:
Ivet María R. D. is single and has two children. She is an accountant by profession and lives in the Guadalupe neighborhood, along with her family. She’s been working for the Chinandera city hall for a total of 38 years and has spent the past 21 years working as a secretary. Ivet has been working with CEPRODEL loans for the past nine years and has received six prior loans, five of which she has repaid responsibly. Ivet is grateful for the support we have given her with these loans at the time she needed them to repair her house little by little and solve some insolvency problems.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira K. is forty two and married. She has three children: her elder daughter is nineteen, her elder son is sixteen and her younger daughter is twelve. Her elder daughter studies at the institution of higher education and her son and younger daughter go to school. Her husband is carpenter. Elmira sells honey. It was suggested by her aunt that she start selling honey in order to increase her income. Twenty years ago, Elmira bought honey and all necessary business supplies for 8,000 KGS and she earns about $195 monthly. She applied for a loan to buy a 200 liter kettle for the honey-making process. With the profits from selling honey, she plans to give her son a higher education and buy furniture for her house.

Group members:

Marvarhan K. is the treasurer of the group. She is forty two and a widow. She has four children: her daughters are fifteen, thirteen and six and her son is ten years old. Her elder daughters and her son go to school and her youngest daughter is at home. Five years ago, Marvarhan received a loan from the micro-finance company “FINCA” in the amount of 5,000 KGS and bought honey. Then she resold that honey at a higher price. Now she gets about $175 monthly from selling honey. In order to increase her turnover she is applying for a loan because she doesn’t have enough funds. 

Sonaiym C. is forty-seven and married. She has four children: her daughters are twenty-three, twenty-one, and eighteen and her son is fourteen. Her elder daughter is a recent graduate and now is in search of employment opportunities. Her second and third daughters study at an institution of higher education, and her son goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver. Nineteen years ago, Sonaiym was selling clothes when her friend suggested she switch to selling convenience goods. She bought some convenience goods for 30,000 KGS and started selling them. Now, she makes about $320 monthly. She has been able to buy an area already planted in a crop and to give her children an opportunity to study at the institution of higher education on the profits from her business. She is applying for a loan in order to get necessary funds for increasing the assortment of goods she sells. In the future, she plans to expand her business and buy a shop for her convenience goods. 

Aizada A. is twenty-two and married. She has two sons: the elder is one year old and her younger son is eight months. Her husband is a computer administrator in a computer club. Aizada sells convenience goods at the local market or from home. In 2009, her neighbor offered her the chance to help in selling convenience goods, and then start selling on her own. She started with a purchase of goods for 25,000 KGS. Now she gets about $195 a month as an income from selling convenience goods. She is planning to increase the assortment but she doesn’t have sufficient funds; therefore, she is applying for a loan. In the future, she is planning to build a shop near her house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy a 200 liter kettle for the honey making process

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy M. is 39 years old and is married with four school-aged children. He is from the village of Kanitoan in the municipality of Initao, Misamis Oriental province, in the northern Mindanao islands. Roy provides habal-habal, or motorcycle transportation services to local community members. He has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010 Roy joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan, his first from HSPFI, of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena L. is from the town of Panglao. She is 46 years old. Ma. Elena is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 2. To make a living, Ma. Elena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Ma. Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Elena is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer D. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 34 years old. Jennifer is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer provides recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2004, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

loans.name: Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya B, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Hardworking and cooperative N. Aisha has been running a general-merchandise retail shop from Kibalinga trading center in Mubende, where she sells basic items for home use. She has been operating this business for over 10 years. She started this business in a bid to be able to educate her children, and it currently earns her 600,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. The mother of eight children confirms that she has had problems restocking her business, as the stock available is not satisfying customers' demand.

She uses loans to help her buy more goods to resell at a profit, with the hope of earning more income, catering for her family's needs, and thus improving her standard of living. This time round, she wants to clear her children's school dues. She belongs to Kibalinga Kyosimba onanya group with other members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: Paying her children's school fees

loans.name: Mary Adjoa

texts.en: Mary Adjoa A. is into the sale of plastic bowls in Abrafoa near Abura. She travels around her locality to sell the bowls. She is married and takes care of six dependants. Her husband is a blacksmith. She assists her husband in providing for the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic bowls to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is a 50-year-old farmer. She owns and manages a small rice field and sells her harvest to rice traders so she can to raise money for her two daughters. She wanted to expand her enterprise. She thinks that by receiving a loan from CEVI, she will be able to double the size of her yield. She will use the loan to purchase the farm supplies she needs, such as fertilizers.

She works all day to ensure productivity in her farm. She will use the additional income from her business to pay for school supplies and other fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a young man, aged 24 years, married to Tabitha who is expecting their first born. He has been in the pig-keeping business for the last year managing to earn a monthly income of Ksh 8,000. The fact that he successfully repaid his previous two loans from Kadet is a clear indication that he is doing well.

He plans to use the loan to purchase six piglets amounting to 10,000/= and the rest 10, 000 will be used to buy animal feeds. He plans to use the expected profits to uplift the living standards of his family and give proper care to his family. He dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer in pig-keeping.

loans.use: Purchase pigs worth Kshs 10,000

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.es: La Sra. Norma Aracely, es una persona que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, y este ya es su tercer renovación y con estos créditos ella se ha estado ayudando y apoyando a su familia económicamente, esta es una manera de ayudar al sosten de su familia, ya que su esposo en la fabrica donde trabaja gana poco y su papa es pensionado, por lo que ella necesita el dinero para comprar ropa usada y revender, a ella le gusta este negocio porque ya ha hecho muchos clientes que la buscan y le piden ropa sobre todo para los niños que son los que utilizan mas, la Sra. Norma piensa que si sigue así el negocio pronto se vera remunerada y podrá ganar mas para invertir mas y estar un poco mas desahogada con los gastos.
texts.en: Norma Aracely sells used clothing and this is her third loan cycle. These loans have helped her to financially support her family. She is able to provide for her family, especially important because her husband's wages at the factory are humble and her father is retired. She requires the funds to purchase used clothing for resale. She enjoys the business because she has a large client base that looks to her and place orders for clothing, especially children's clothing which is in highest demand. Norma believes that if her business continues at the same pace she will be able to see greater profits which she will invest in the back into the business and to be less taxed with her expenses.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
"Rose is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures, a general store and a frozen products business. Her husband Tirzo, who is 39 years old, works as a company driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 7 to 10 years old.

Rose joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rose has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 15000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 25000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock for sale, so she can continue to save for future family expenses. Rose is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock for sale

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena, de 56 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con sus cuatro hijos de 23, 27, 30 y 33 años de edad, ella es madre soltera, pero sus hijos todos trabajan y le ayudan dándole un aporte mensual para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
El negocio lo inicio doña María Elena, por el apoyo de uno de sus hijos, ya que este trabaja en tiendas grandes y le facilita instalar una en su casa para que su madre trabaje en ella. El horario de atención es de 7:00am a 6:00pm, por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio, con esta inversión contara con un inventario fuerte disponiendo de varios productos necesarios para los hogares de los clientes, esto le permitirá atender la demanda de la mejor manera y satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela.
Uno de sus sueños es tener una tienda amplia, aumentar su clientela, mejorando la condición de vida tanto de sus hijos como la de ella.
texts.en: Doña María Elena, who is 56, lives in El Transito department in San Miguel, with her four children, aged 23, 27, 30, and 33. She is a single mother, but her children all work and help her by giving her a monthly allowance to cover the household expenses. María Elena started the business with the support of one of her children. Since he works in big stores, he helped build one in the house so his mother could work at home. The business is open from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. For the moment, she is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise to build up the business. With this investment she will have a strong inventory made up of various household necessities for her customers, allowing her to better meet the requests and satisfy the needs of her clientele. One of her dreams is to have a larger store and increase her clientele, thus improving quality of life for her children and herself.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to strengthen the business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth de 33 años de edad, labora como conserje para el CETA INATEC  desde hace 9 años,  es una mujer trabajadora, servicial pero sobre todo bien humilde es bien querida por sus vecinos y compañeros de   trabajo, su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos.                                                              

Solicita su decimo credito  para comprar materiales de construccion y construir una habitacion y asi gozar de mejores condiciones en el hogar, agradece a Kiva por el apoyo brindado en el credito anterior ya que fue posible repellar la pared de la habitacion que tiene actualmente.                                                                                                       
Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su linda familia permanezca unida y bien con Dios, que no les haga falta lo basico en el hogar .
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 33, has been employed as a Caretaker for CETA INATEC for nine years.  She’s a hard working, helpful but above all, quite humble, woman who is very well liked by her neighbors and coworkers.  Her life partner works as a Bricklayer and together they share family expenses and acquired obligations.

She is asking for her 10th loan to buy building materials and supplies to build a bedroom to have better living conditions in her home.  She is grateful to Kiva for the support provided in the previous loan since it made it possible for her to seal the wall in the bedroom she currently has.

Her greatest dream in life is that her lovely family stays together and on good terms with God; that their home lacks none of the basics.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 61, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Bora is a farmer, earning an income of about $1.30 per day. Her husband is a retired policeman, earning an income of about $1.43 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $77 on food and $20 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay the children’s school fees. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay the children's school fees

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses. She has a small restaurant and makes and sells ice cream. She lives in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. Marissa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard, Marissa is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 14,000. Marissa is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could increase the volume of food that she cooks every day as well as widen the variety of food choices for the people who eat at her small restaurant. She also wants to use part of the money she is borrowing to increase the volume of the ice cream that she sells.

This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marissa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for the food she offers in the restaurant

loans.name: Cuatro Caminos Group

texts.es:
Santos Olegaria S. M. D. H., es una persona casada, tiene 43 años D. edad, tuvo la oportunidad D. cursar 6 años D. educacion primaria, tiene 7 hijos, 4 estan estudiando, se dedica a la preparacion y venta D. comida,tiene ya 10 años D. experiencia con el negocio que realiza, inició cocinando en las fiesta, donD. se dió cuenta que tiene demanda, y ahora tiene un puesto D. venta D. comida. 

DeciD. orgnizar un grupo para solicitar un prestamo que servira como capital D. trabajo, el prestamo servira para compra D. insumos, como: vegetales, frutas, carnes, etc. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas: tienda, comedor, tejeduría, sastrería y crianza D. animales. Esperan mejorar su negocio con el préstamo que esta haciendo a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Santos Olegaria S. M. D. H. is 43 years old and married. She took the opportunity to complete her sixth graD. education. Santos has seven children, four of whom are in school. She has a business of preparing and selling food. Already she has acquired ten years of experience. Santos started out cooking for parties, which helped her discover that there was demand. Now she has her own food stand.

Santos decided to organize a group so that she could request a loan to use as operating capital. The money will enable her to buy supplies such as vegetables, fruits, meats, and other products. The other members of this group engage in different productive businesses such as stores, diners, weaving shops, tailoring shops, and livestock farms. They hope to improve their businesses with this loan from Asociación ASDIR.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, reside en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, tiene 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, también semilla de marañón, ella vive con su esposo y tres hijos. El negocio lo inicio desde joven sin un horario establecido.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa y semilla de marañón, esta compra le ayudara a mantenerse en el negocio y brindar a los clientes la mercadería necesaria.
Su aspiración es montar un negocio estable, atender un buen número de clientes y estar en buenas condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
36 year-old Teresa lives in Santa Elena, in Usulután department, with her husband and three children.  She sells clothes and beauty products, and also cashew nuts.  She started the business when she was young and doesn't work fixed hours.

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy clothes and cashew nuts.  This purchase will help her to keep her business running and provide her customers with the merchandise they need.

Teresa's aspiration is to have a stable business, to serve a good number of customers and to live in good conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cashew nuts

loans.name: Nuestro Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Bartola lives in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo. Bartola and her group of 10 members are taking loans for their businesses. This group is named Nuevo Progreso 1 & 2 (New Progress).

Bartola requires a loan to buy blankets, bedding sets and tablecloths. She runs a little store in her house where she sells clothes and decoration items like curtains, bedding sets, etc. 

This is Bartola´s first loan with Esperanza International. She will take a step toward improving her business by investing this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over 5 months.  Years ago she was doing business but she stopped to take care of her family; now her 5 children are grown and she can work again to help improve their lives. Her most difficult challenges are to work for the wellness of her family and to improve their kind of living.

She says that her favorite thing is to attend to the church.  Bartola and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy blankets, bedding sets and tablecloths to increase her sales.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Ccorao - Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Cecilia, la socia tiene 29 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 2 años de edad; la socia desea el préstamo para poder implementar su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda en el pueblo y desea comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, harinas, leche entre otros productos para implementar su tienda, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is known as “ SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO”. This bank is located in Poblado de Ccorao - Pisac, situated in the Calca Province, in the Department of Cusco.

The member is 29 year old Cecilia, who lives with her partner and has 2 children aged 12 and 2. She requires the loan in order to be able to establish her little grocery store. She has a shop in the village and wishes to buy rice, oil, sugar, flours and milk among other produce to establish her shop. She requires the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise. 

Cecilia is thankful and wishes to express that she will comply with the repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc, tiene 30 años es madre soltera con una hija de 15 años de edad. Rosa se dedica la venta de periódicos y revista en la plaza Mayor de Ayacucho y a la siembra de papa, arvejas, maíz en el anexo de Casaorcco. Solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de revistas, semillas, fertilizantes para la siembra de papa para la campaña pequeña. 
Esta en FINCA Perú desde el año 2005, le gusta por el acceso a los créditos y sobre todo puede ahorrar. Ahora está ahorrando para la construcción de su casa y la educación superior de su hija.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Imasumacc”.  She is 30 years old and a single mother of a 15-year-old daughter.  Rosa sells newspapers and magazines in the town square in Ayacucho.  She also grows potatoes, peas, and corn in the annex of Casaorcco.  Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of magazines, seeds, and fertilizers for growing potatoes during the short season.    

She has been with FINCA Peru since 2005.  Rosa enjoys having access to loans and always being able to save.  Now she is saving toward the construction of her house and her daughter’s higher education.

loans.use: to purchase magazines for her news stand and seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Liceth Paola

texts.es: Liceth vive en el barrio Simón Bolívar,  un lugar que tradicionalmente escenario de los desfiles más populares y carnavaleros de la ciudad de Barranquilla y también donde estuvo ubicado el primer aeropuerto de esta ciudad. Liceth es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, familia con la que sueña construir un futuro de prosperidad y por la cual trabaja día a día. La experiencia de negocio la tomó Liceth de su madre,  quien le enseñó y le dejó este negocio para que ella se dedicara a la venta de prendas de plata con la que empezó y a la cual le ha agregado otras mercancías como bolsos, calzado y artículos a través de catalogas, en los que escoge preferiblemente las mejores ofertas, con tal de ofrecerle a sus clientes lo mejor;  en su negocio también ofrece el servicio de alquiler de sillas el cual se hace mas frecuente los fines de semana y por las noches . Este es su prime financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará mercancía variada como electrodomésticos menores, cubrelechos y cosméticos que tiene encargados y ella hará de esta inversión un éxito, pues ya tiene seleccionados a sus mejores clientes para responderles con los pedidos que estos han realizado. Su principal meta es lograr la ampliación y sostenibilidad  de su negocio que repercuta en su propia estabilidad económica  y en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Liceth lives in the Simón Bolívar neighborhood, a place where the most popular carnaval parades of Baranquilla traditionally take  place.  It is also where the city's first airport is located. Liceth is a married woman who has a two year old son. She dreams of building a prosperous future and that is why she works every day. Liceth learned about business from her mother, who taught her and left her the business so that she could sell silver jewelry. She started with this and added more merchandise such as purses, shoes and catalog items. She chooses the best deals in order to offer her customers the best. She also rents chairs, mostly on weekends and evenings. This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy varied merchandise, such as small appliances, bedspreads and cosmetics she has on order. She will make this investment a success. She already has her best customers picked out to fill the the orders they have made.  Her main goal is to grow and sustain her business which will positively affect her financial stability and her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise, such as small appliances, bedspreads and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura Tienen la edad de 22 años, estudio solo la preparatoria y esta casad con hernan el cual trabaja de agricultor, ella esta embarazada y vive con su esposo en el estado de Oaxaca en una comunidad llamada Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar hubicada en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingeni azucarero Don Pablo Machado.

Rosaura nos platica que hace un poco mas de tres años decidio iniciar a trabajar ya que de esa manera ganaba mas y cuando se caso continuo con su venta ya que junto a su esposo quiere contruir un patrimonio para sus hijos. ella vende zapatos por catalogo, casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella primero lleva a mostrar sus catalagos con sus clientes, levanta un pedido y se surte de zapatos los cuales despues entrega y recibe su pago por sus productos. ella es una persona muy entusiasta y  amiguera lo cual le ayuda a vender mas zapatos. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Zapatos y catalogos para realizar sus ventas. rosaura espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere a que desea ahorrar para preparar la llegada de su bebe
texts.en:
Rosaura is 22 years old and has a preparatory school education. She is married to Hernan, who is a farmer. Rosaura is pregnant and lives with her husband in the community of Tetela in the State of Oaxaca. This community is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is only 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Rosaura says that she decided to start working a little more than three years ago so that she could earn more income. When she got married, Rosaura continued with her sales business since she and her husband want to build up an inheritance for their children. She sells shoes through catalogs and travels from house to house in order to visit friends and neighbors in her community. Rosaura arrives at their homes to show them the catalogs. She takes their orders and then requests the shoes. Rosaura collects payment after the merchandise has been delivered. She is an enthusiastic and friendly person, which helps her sell more shoes. Rosaura needs this loan to invest in the purchase of shoes and catalogs so that she can make sales. She hopes that this investment will help her business prosper because she wants to save up money before the arrival of her baby.

loans.use: to acquire shoes and catalogs so that she can generate sales.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 36 years old, married with 7 children ages 14-2 years old.  He is living in a semi permanent house in Karuguuza Uganda.

Godfrey is the soul bread winner of his family and his dream is to educate his children.  For 2 years Godfrey has been operating a local gin business and from this small business he has been able to buy land and a motorcycle.  He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations in the market and his business desire is to become the leading supplier.  Godfrey needs a loan to buy more local gin to sell.

loans.use: To buy local gin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Saadi

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married and has three children.

Saadi has had a workshop since 2000 for blacksmithing and welding. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1800 loan to buy a welding machine and to purchase additional inventory. He is aiming to earn more profit to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine and to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 42 year old, cleans a restaurant for $4 a day. In the past she sold pillows and mats in another province, but she changed her job to work in this restaurant, a better job than the other.

Sokhom is a single mother with two children. One is working in a factory making $3 per day and the other is a veterinary practitioner making $5 a day. Every month Sokhom has to spend $75 on food, $5 electricity, $40 on transportation and $40 on other expenses.

Sokhom is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy veterinarian medications for her son so he might treat animals in the village. In the future, Sokhom wants to send her son to study veterinary medicine further so that he can have a good career.

loans.use: to buy veterinarian medications for her son to use in his practice.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, D. 54 años, está casada con Feliciano, con quien tiene 9 hijos. Pero solo vive con 4 D. ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Bellavista. Como buena madre, se dedica en cuerpo y alma; al cuidado y desarrollo D. sus hijos. Los cuales estudian educación superior en la capital del país; proporcionándoles un dinero mensualmente. Dinero que lo obtiene gracias al arduo trabajo que realiza en su tienda D. abarrotes, donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad; a los pobladores D. su localidad. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra D. papa, alverja y maíz, en sus terrenos propios, ubicados en la zona alta D. Huandunga, donD. tiene regadillo a disposición. Según menciona en sus 16 años D. experiencia, tiene gran éxito vendiendo a los comerciantes mayoristas del mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma. Asimismo, se dedica a la crianza D. animales como: carneros, vacas y toros. Los cuales le ayudan a labrar la tierra, como también a incursionar en la venta D. carne, a los vecinos y carniceros que la visitan constantemente. Ahora se concentra en el trabajo duro; pues su objetivo es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor D. Muruhuay” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el apoyo que le brindan en este momento. Razón por lo cual promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas. Carmen D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. 2 bolsas D. semilla D. alverja que muy pronto sembrará, además D. un torito pequeño.
texts.en: Carmen is 54 years old and she is married with Feliciano. They have 9 children together but only 4 still live with them. They have a house of their own located in the community of Bellavista. As a good mother she invests her body and soul in the care and development of her children. They are enrolled in post-secondary education in the capital city of the country and she provides them with a monthly allowance. She earns money through arduous work on her grocery store, where she sells basic consumer goods to the population of her locality. She also cultivates potatoes, peas, and corn. Her farmland is located in the mountainous region of Huandunga and she has irrigation at her disposal. She mentions that in her 16 years of experience she has seen great success in selling to the wholesalers in the wholesalers' market in the city of Tarma. She also raises livestock such as rams, cows, and bulls. These assist her in working the land but she also uses them to sell as meat to her neighbors and the butchers who visit her constantly. She concentrates on working hard to meet her objective of supporting her children in their studies. She is a member of the communal bank "Senor D. Muruhay" and it is her sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is thankful for the support provided and she promises to make her loan payments on time. Carmen, on receiving your support, will invest the funds she requests in the purchase of 2 sacks of pea seeds for the fast approaching sowing season, and she will also buy a calf.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El señor Sergio es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable con su familia. Hace 8 años el adquirió una vivienda de interés social, pero la barda del patio de atrás esta muy baja que por consecuencia puede tener problemas con su vecinos por algún desacuerdo, como Sergio es una persona muy tranquila quiere omitirse este tipo de situaciones para no darle a sus 3 hijos un mal ejemplo. Sergio trabaja como supervisor de una maquiladora y su esposa realiza trabajos de limpieza en general en casas particulares para ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar su proyecto por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar block, arena, cemento, varilla y pagar a la persona que le hará el trabajo para que su proyecto quede realizado.
texts.en:
Sergio is a very hard-working man who meets his family responsibilities.  Eight years ago he acquired a house through a government housing program.  However, the wall round the rear yard is very low which means that he could have problems with his neighbors over some disagreement.  As Sergio is a very peaceful person, he would like to avoid this type of situation in order to avoid setting a bad example to his three children.

Sergio works as a foreman in a cross-border assembly plant and his wife carries out general cleaning work in private houses in order to provide their children with  a better quality of life.  Right now, Sergio doesn't have the money he needs to carry out his project and so he is requesting a loan to buy blocks, sand, cement and rods, and to pay the person who will carry out the work, so that his project is completed.

loans.use: to finish building a wall round their rear yard

loans.name: Dushan

texts.ru: Душан житель района А. Джоми. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У него пятеро детей. Душан имеет среднее образование. У себя дома он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Dushan is a resident of the A. Jomi region. He is 48 years old. He is married. His wife is a homemaker. They have five children. Dushan has secondary education. He does animal husbandry from his home. He breeds large horned cattle for future resale. He is asking for a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She has managed a business raising hogs for 24 years. Her husband works as a farmer in the village where they are living. They work hard to help each other to attain their goal of providing a good quality of life for their children. She believes that one way of doing this is to provide for their needs and to be able to send their children to school. Visitacion believes that education is the key to success. 


Now, she is requesting a 6,000 PHP a loan to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. She looks forward to the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with 2 children. She is 31 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao. Elizabeth has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns 4,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase stock for her general store. Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 46 años, es una mujer sencilla y con ganas de progresar con su trabajo, ella esta casada y es madre de una hija de 16 años, quien es estudiante. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Blanca y su espsoso trabajan día a día para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. El trabajo que realiza es la venta de comida, desde muy temprano prepara el alimento que luego ya por la noche lo expenderá a su público. Tiene 10 años vendiendo en la vereda de su casa, ahí sus fieles clientes llegan a consumir sus deliciosos platillos. 
Paralelamente a ello se dedica a coleccionar artículo en desuso (chatarra), que desde muy temprano se dispone a recorres la calles de la ciudad en su moto en busca de chatarra, para luego llevarlos a grandes almacenes para venderlos, percibiendo ingresos extras. Tiene un año recién realizando esta actividad, y hasta el momento lo esta yendo muy bien. manifiesta que este estilo de actividad le gusta ya puede administrar su tiempo sin descuidar de su familia. Este será el octavo crédito con MFP, le esta yendo bien en su grupo y espera poder seguir así, ya que se caracteriza por se una cliente puntual y muy responsable. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que esperará recibir de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará una balanza grande especial para la venta de chatarra.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 46, is a simple woman who wants to make progress in her work. She is married and the mother of a 16-year-old daughter who is a student. They live together in their own home. Blanca and her husband work every day in order to provide a better quality of life for their daughter. Her work involves selling food. She begins very early preparing the dishes that she will sell at night to the public. Blanca has been selling for 10 years on the sidewalk near her house. Her loyal customers come to eat her delicious dishes.

At the same time, she collects junk items. From the early morning hours, she travels through the streets of the city on her motorcycle in search of scrap metal that she will take to the large warehouses to sell in order to earn extra money. Blanca started this business a year ago and has done very well so far. She says that she likes this type of work because she can manage her time without neglecting her family.

This will be her eighth loan with MFP. Blanca gets along well with her group and hopes that she can continue. She is known for being a punctual client who is very responsible. Blanca is very grateful for the support she hopes to receive from everyone. The amount she requested will be used to buy a special large scale that is used for selling scrap metal.

loans.use: to buy a large scale for her scrap metal business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials like fleece and wool.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Selling both food and daily-use products is the primary source of income upon which Maria Theresa and her family rely. She makes only about P3,000 each month from her business. She sells sardines, soap, shampoo, sugar, milk and coffee. She has been operating this business for almost three years. Income generated from the business went to school fees and allowances of her four children. 

She is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy soft dinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell in her store. These additional items would help increase sales capacity.

In the future, she aims for a better quality of life for her family, especially financing the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft dinks, canned goods, and noodles to sell in her store

loans.name: Mukunduzi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mukunduzi B Group in Western Kenya! Grace is the facilitator of the Mukunduzi B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Grace takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and improve in the production rate to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest one bag of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Grace and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Grace will educate her children and pay back her One Acre Fund loan.

In 2012, the members of Mukunduzi B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Grace with her group members and the field officer who is standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Wekelekha Shg B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wekelekha SHG B Group in Western Kenya! Jane is the facilitator of the Wekelekha SHG B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jane takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jane will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wekelekha SHG B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sokhieng

texts.en:
Sokhieng (pictured with her young son and daughter), age 38, is a rice and lotus farmer. She also runs a tailoring business when she is free from farming. Her husband, Hourn, age 37, is a security guard. They have been married since 2004 and have two young children - one son and one daughter. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sokhieng is asking for her first loan of $400 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice and lotus farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her rice and lotus farm

loans.name: Izigire Group

texts.fr:
Sylvie est une commerçante âgée de 35ans qui habite à Rutoki . Elle fait le commerce de boutique (savons, sucre, sel, riz, fanta, etc) depuis 3 ans. Elle a commencé cette activité alors qu’elle faisait l’agriculture. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 3e année primaire. Elle est mariée à Joseph et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3 étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’articles pour sa boutique (savons, sucre, sel, riz, fanta, etc).

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Izigire».
texts.en:
Sylvie is a 35-year-old shopkeeper who lives in Rutoki. She has been selling in her shop (soaps, sugar, salt, rice, Fanta, etc.) for three years. She started this business while she was farming. She studied up to the third year of primary school. She is married to Joseph and they have five children together of whom three go to school.

The loan that she obtains will allow her to increase her capital to buy many things for her shop (soaps, sugar, salt, rice, Fanta, etc.).

She is a member of the Izigire community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy many things for her shop (soaps, sugar, salt, rice, Fanta, etc.).

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Kinuman, Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Rebecca is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Rebecca raises crops, primarily planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rebecca has been in her business for 11 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 9,400 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Frank John

texts.es:
Frank tiene 30 años de edad vive en la ciudad de mala, ubicada al sur de nuestra capital, como buen peruano le gusta mucho nuestra comida, pero el platillo que le gusta más es el riquísimo Arroz con pollo, el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, debido a que sus padres no contaban con los medios económicos suficientes pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Administración de Empresas.

Frank trabaja de sol a sol como decimos en Perú, el se dedica a su negocio de venta de abarrotes, pero también a la venta de productos de ferretería, el es una persona mil oficios y es que si es un trabajo honrado porque no realizarlo, trabaja alrededor de 13 horas diarias sin parar, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios está a su lado y es el único que lo guía por el buen camino y también porque atiende a los clientes de manera amable.

Frank está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda el tener mayores  podrá tener mayores ingresos para mejorar  su calidad de vida y darle lo mejor a su hijo, así como también seguir ahorrando para poder  seguir creciendo y para cumplir su gran sueño:” Crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Frank is 30 years old. He lives in the city of Mala, located to the south of our capital. Like a good Peruvian he very much likes our food, but the dish he enjoys the most is the rich rice with chicken. He only studied until the 5th grade of elementary school since his parents didn’t have enough money, but he very much would have liked to study Business Administration. 

Frank work from sun-up to sun-down, as we say in Peru. He works in his business selling groceries, but he also sells hardware. He is a jack of all trades, and if it’s honest work why not do it? He works 13 hours non-stop. He believes that things are going well with his business because God is on his side, and only God can lead him on the right path. Also, Frank tends to his customers in a friendly way. 

Frank is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since that to their help he will be able to have more income to improve his quality of life and give the best to his son. Also, he can continue saving in order to keep growing and be able to achieve his greatest dream: “Grow as a small business.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries)

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and lives in Polao, Tangub City. She is separated with three children. 

To earn a living, Pacita has a sari-sari (variety) store business. She earns about PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work. Pacita has requested a loan for her existing business.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Pacita would like to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Dimitrina

texts.en:
Dimitrina is a 23-year old Roma woman from Sliven, Bulgaria. She and her husband own a small hairstyling salon and barbershop in the Roma ghetto. Dimitrina learned the trade working in a beauty salon in the center of Sliven, in a shop owned by and catering to the ethnic Bulgarians. Two years ago, she took her education back to her neighborhood and started this salon. She expanded her small house outward into the street to create the space for the salon. It has been a success; together, Dimitrina and her husband generate $10 - $15 per day. With their income, Dimitrina and her husband support their one daughter and Dimitrina’s mother.

With this loan, Dimitrina will purchase a hot water boiler and sink, where she will be able to wash her clients’ hair before cutting or styling. She thinks she will be able to charge an extra Leva (~$0.65) for this service and will able to pay back the loan without a problem over 18 months. In addition, she is going to purchase a small inventory of low-cost hair care products she will attempt to sell to her clients to generate additional revenue.

The Roma, commonly known as gypsies, are a severely marginalized social group in Bulgaria and throughout the Balkans.

loans.use: Capital expenditure (hot water boiler, sink), working capital (retail inventory)

loans.name: Rahil

texts.en: Rahil M. owns a cell phone store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Rahil wants to invest in newer products for his store in order to attract more business.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory to attract more customers.

loans.name: Gafa

texts.en:
With 12 people in her family, Gafa decided to join SPBD to earn a living to accommodate the growing number. She runs an ice-cake and ice-pop business, which caters to young children and adults.

The ice-cake and ice-pops are mixed with cordial, sweetener and flavoring to give a good taste. She earns 50 tala a day, seven days a week. She earns a profit of 75-100 tala ($25-35) a week.

loans.use: To purchase plastic cups, sugar, cordial and pay electric bills

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria Antonia is a very creative, hard-working, honest and easy-going woman. She is a widow and mother of three children who are all married. She really enjoys making crafts and took numerous courses on the subject. In order to maintain an activity and to put into practice her skills and to use her creativity she decided to start a business selling crafts. This business enables her to have a profit which helps suport the cost of living and part the cost of her apartment, and from time to time she helps out her youngest son with payments for his professional career. She began by seling pastries and then crafts and then specific orders from her home. A friend suggested she also give them to her to sell and in this way sales spread between families and friends and she accumuluated clients as the time passed.

Maris Antonia is asking for a loan of US $825 in order to purchase raw materials and thus enable her to take more specific orders from clients to satisfy their desires which also leads to more overall demand for the same products from other clients. She is offering to pay the loan back in six months. She is very appreciative of your support which will enable her to continue with her business and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, Kiva Volunteer.

María Antonia es una persona creativa, trabajadora, honesta y sencilla, ella es una mujer viuda y tiene tres hijos todos casados, ella tiene un gusto por las manualidades y a tomado varios cursos sobre el tema, fue así como para mantenerse activa y poner en práctica sus habilidades y desarrollar su creatividad decidió poner su negocio de venta de manualidades, el cual le permite un ingreso que le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y en parte los de su hogar, a la vez que ayuda a su hijo menor con los pagos de su carrera profesional. Ella empezó haciendo postres y luego paso a las manualidades y arreglos para su casa, y un familiar le sugirió que también los hiciera para vender y así empezó vendiendo entre familiares y amigos y luego se hizo de clientes con el paso del tiempo.

María Antonia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 825 para comprar materia prima y poder elaborar más arreglos para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y tener mayor demanda de los mismos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 40 years old, and has four children. She works making blouses, which she takes to nearby cities known for their tourism (San Cristobal, Comitan). She belongs to a collective called Santa Barbara 5, along with Hortensia M. Hernandez and Romelia Vazquez Vazquez who are also artisans. She would use her loan to purchase additional supplies for her business, such as material, thread, sewing needles, and scissors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGARITA tiene 40 años, cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica a confeccionar y bordar blusas de manta, sus productos los lleva a vender a las ciudades mas cercanas y visitadas por los turistas (San Cristóbal, Comitán). Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Santa Bárbara 5 junto con doña Hortensia Méndez Hernández (artesana) y doña Romelia Vázquez Vázquez (artesana). Con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de su materia prima (telas, hilos, agujas y tijeras) para aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Kokou Bobo

texts.fr:
Mr G. Kokou Bobo is a young man of 25 years old, living in the village of Momé-Hounkpati. Very committed, he launched himself in business at an early age and today runs his own general foodstore. The revenue he gets from his business allow him to meet the needs of his family. However, he is lacking business capital and at times must resort to moneylenders or loansharks. To escape from the oppression, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to revitalize his shop and satisfy the needs of his clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur G. Kokou Bobo est un jeune de 25 ans résidant dans le village de Momé-Hounkpati. Très dévoué, il s’est très tôt lancé dans le commerce et aujourd’hui il gère sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale. Les revenus tirés lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Cependant, les fonds de commerce lui manquent et il est obligé de faire parfois recours aux usuriers. Pour sortir de ce joug, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ravitailler sa boutique et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Stocking of store

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina (her husband is pictured) was born in 1948. She is the mother of three children. Valentina is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs. Ten years ago her family started their cattle-breeding business. Now they need a loan of $600 to buy one calf to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy one calf

loans.name: Maria Antonia's Group

texts.en:
Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria are members of the community bank “Retoño”. Maria and Candelaria have been members for eight years, and Zenaida for eight months. In that time they have learned to be responsible, punctual and to save. They have also learned values such as self-esteem and solidarity.

Zenaida is 24 years old and has one 18-month-old daughter. Zenaida runs a business selling construction products. Her husband started the business, but Zenaida has been running it for two years. Before that she raised pigs.
