Maria is 51 years old. She has five children, one of whom lives with her. Maria owns a small restaurant that specializes in meat dishes. She started this business 25 years ago, and it has continued to grow little by little. Candelaria is 26 years old, and has one eight-year-old son. She started a “hospedaje”, or boarding house, eight years ago. Now, with help from the community bank she runs two and is hoping to open a small salon with her new loan.

Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria need loans of 400, 800, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wood, soft drinks, juices, and opening a salon.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria are saving to buy another piece of land, invest in a daughter’s coffee growing business, and to pay for the education of their children. Their dreams are to continue working, continue developing their businesses, and that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria need loans of 400, 800, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wood, soft drinks, juices, and opening a salon.

loans.name: Nila Violeta

texts.es:
Mrs. Nila Violeta Z. C. lives in the district of Agallpampa in Otuzco province in the city of La Libertad, Peru. She is 39 years old and studied through the fourth year of secondary school. She has four dependent children.

Nila has a small grocery store in her home. She has a very good clientele because all the cars that travel to the outlying provinces outside La Libertad stop in Agallpampa at a police control and the passengers take advantage of the stop to do their shopping.

Nila is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesús Nazareno” (Jesus the Nazarene) from which she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $100 U.S.). With that loan she purchased bread, soft drinks, and snacks to sell in her small shop.

With a loan of S/.1,000.00 (approximately $350 U.S.) that she will repay in 6 months, Nila will purchase a box of soft drinks, a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, a box of tuna and a package of noodles.

Nila’s dream is to expand her store, to purchase wood to resell, and to purchase a vehicle for transport.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nila Violeta Z. C. vive en el distrito de Agallpampa provincia de Otuzco del departamento La Libertad – Perú. Tiene 39 años de edad, estudio hasta el cuarto año de secundaria y tiene 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella. La señora Nila tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio y tiene también muy buena clientela debido a que todos los carros que van a la mayoría de provincias de la sierra de La Libertad paran en Agallpampa para un control policial y los pasajeros aprovechan para realizar compras. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús Nazareno” en el que obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró pan, gaseosas y abarrotes para ofrecer en su pequeño negocio. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 que cancelará en 6 meses comprará una caja de gaseosas, un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, una caja de atún y un paquete de fideos. El sueño de la señora Nila es ampliar más su tienda, comprar madera para volver a vender así también un vehículo para transportarse.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, rice, sugar and other products

loans.name: Thi Hang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hằng, 48 years old, married with two school age children, one still in school, is a cadre in her village. Besides her community activities, she raises pigs. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng to buy feed for pigs. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Trần Thị Tình applies for a loan to invest in her business.
  • Lê Thị Thảo applies for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. She is also a veterinarian.
  • Nguyễn Thị Toàn applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs and buys scrap metal.
  • Lê Thị Nhung applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • Lê Thị Huê applies for a loan to buy a sewing machine.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hằng, 48 tuổi là cán bộ phụ nữ thôn, chị có chồng và hai con trai hiện nay 1 cậu đi làm và một còn đi học. Ngoài công việc trong chi hội phụ nữ thôn, chị còn tham gia chăn nuôi lợn ở nhà. Lần này chị vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua cám chăn nuôi lợn. Chị còn muốn tham gia lâu dài với chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị Trần Thị Tình vay 2006000 để thêm vốn bán hàng lân đạm tại nhà cho bà con trong thôn làm nông nghiệp. Chị Lê Thị Thảo vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn, chị là một bác sĩ thú y tại thôn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Toàn vay 2006000 đồng để chị mua cám chăn nuôi lợn và một phần chị thêm vốn để đi chợ sắt hàng ngày. Chị Lê Thị Nhung vay 1534000 đồng để chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Chị Lê Thị Huê vay 2006000 đồng để thêm vốn mua máy may mặc (chị làm thợ may tại nhà).

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. prepares food for sale. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and she plans to increase production.

She is asking for $325 to buy food supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and food for her catering business.

loans.name: Lochin

texts.en: A. Lochin is 38 years old. He is married with four children. Lochin is a farmer. He is growing crops like tomatos, cucumbers, onions, potatos, wheat and others. He has been working the land for ten years. His wife, who is pictured in the photo, and elder son help him with the business. Each year Lochin is grows crops sufficient for family consumption and for selling. Generating stable income, Lochin is able to support his large family. Today he requests $350 for the term of 8 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing the seeds and mineral fertilizer. After gathering his yield he wants to sell it all to the locals with the lowest prices in the market. Lochin thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate with the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim L., 36, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and two young children. She works as a farmer, together with her husband, Dul Saren, and they are able to make $4 US each day. Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year and it has affected food prices and the costs of other basic necessities. Farming has also been very difficult, because of inconsistent weather patterns. Sim L. has asked for a loan of $1000 US to purchase rice seed, vegetables, and fertilizer. These purchases will allow her to increase her production and increase her daily income. It will also allow her family to improve its standard of living through an increased income.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, vegetables, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shamsuddin

texts.ru:
Shamsuddin M. lives in Jaloliddini Rumy. He is married and has five children. To support his children, he works in agriculture. He grows watermelons and other melons. Now he must buy seeds and fertilizer. To do this, he plans to take out a loan for 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Малаев Шамсуддин проживаетв районе Джалолиддини Руми.Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Для того , чтобы прокормить детей занимается земледелием.Сажает арбузы и дыни. Сейчас необходимо купить семена и удобрения для обработки. Для этого планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sonate

texts.fr: Née le 04/06/1984 à Lomé, K.  Sonate  est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est couturière et à plusieurs apprenties. Dans ses efforts pour agrandir son atelier, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’équiper en matériel et en outils de travail afin de d’optimiser la productivité de son atelier.
texts.en:
Born 6/4/84 in Lomé, Sonate K. is single with no children. She is a seamstress and has several apprentices. In her efforts to grow her dress shop, she is seeking this loan to equip herself with equipment and tools in order to optimize the productivity of her shop.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy work equipment and tools

loans.name: Aisha's Allah Karim Group

texts.en:
Aisha, 30, is the divorced mother of two children aged 11 and 2 years old. A clothes seller since 2000, she works daily from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

Aisha now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling clothes, khanga, vegetables, and baby clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more clothing to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice M. sells groceries like Milo, milk and other things at Yamoransa Junction near Cape Coast. Eunice has received a junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children and her husband is a commercial driver. Eunice has been selling groceries since 2004. She is responsible for paying the utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to add clothing, fabric and footwear to the groceries she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband build a family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to include clothing, fabric and footwear to the groceries she sells.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jonathan, de 34 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos que están estudiando, vive junto a su conviviente quien lo apoya mucho. Su dedicación al transporte de pasajeros la realiza desde hace 2 años, a razón de ser propietario de un motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conocer a  muchas personas con quien comparte ideas y sobre todo dar un trato amable a sus clientes. Le es muy rentable, ya que el mismo se encarga de administrar sus ganancias. Lo difícil es la competencia, ya que existe mucha demanda en este tipo de transporte, y a veces tiene que dedicarse a trabajar temporalmente en otros oficios, como albañil o carpintero. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es un cliente puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a reparar su vehículo de trabajo y así trabajar tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Jonathan, who is 34 years old, is a father to two children who are in school. He lives together with his partner who supports him a lot. He began his job as a taxi driver two years ago when he became owner of a motortaxi (3 wheeled motorcycle). What he likes about his job is getting to know many people who share ideas him and, above all else, providing friendly treatment to his customers. This is very profitable since he is also in charge of managing his earnings. The competition is difficult since there is a lot of demand for this type of transportation and sometimes he has to dedicate himself to working seasonally in other jobs such as masonry or carpentry. This is his seventh loan with MFP and he is a customer who is punctual with his repayments. With the money he is requesting, he will repair his vehicle so that he may work without worry.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car.

loans.name: Rosa Susana

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal San Juan,  es casada tiene 51 años tres hijos de 24, 20, y 16 el mayor trabajo y los dos últimos estudian. 
La historia de Rosa empezó cuando ella estaba estudiando en el colegio La Inmaculada allí  estudio repostería y aprendió hacer dulces como alfajores  los cuales  salían a vender a los salones hasta que un buen día el administrador del colegio le dice  para poner un cafetín y ella acepto,  empezó a trabajar con su mama, después que acaba de estudiar en el colegio Rosa decidió especializarse en repostería, aprendió hacer tortas de matrimonio, quince años, bocaditos  pastelería fina. Rosa tiene 20 años trabajando en el cafetín del que era su colegio

Rosa solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de mercadería para surtir su cafetería
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como se lleva un negocio, y esta muy contenta.
El sueño de Rosa es tener su propio local y poner una restaurante  dulcería
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the San Juan Community Bank. She is aged 51, married with three children aged 24, 20 and 16. The eldest works and the younger two are still studying. Rosa's story began when she was studying at La Inmaculada college. There she studied baking and learnt how to make such as "alfajores" (caramel-filled cookies) which she sold in the bars until one good day the College administrator asked her to set-up a cafeteria and she accepted. She began to work with her mother, and after she had finished studying in college Rosa decided to specialise in confectionery: she learnt how to make cakes for weddings and quinceañeros, and other fine pastries. Rosa has worked for 20 years in the cafeteria of her old college: Rosa is asking for a loan of 2000 soles in order to buy merchandise to stock up her cafeteria. Since she has joined with Finca she has learnt how to run a business, and she is very happy. Rosa's dream is to have her own premises and set-up her own cafe and cake shop.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her cafeteria

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
EL Sr. Roger González O. tiene 46 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 46 años  de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Andrea Valladares ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios secundarios. 

EL Sr. González es propietario de una pulpería por más de 8 años y este negocio ha sido el que le ha permitido sustentar el estudio y alimentación de sus hijos, el tiene  como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que lo prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas), siendo este negocio su único ingreso.

Cabe destacar que los productos que el oferta no han  disminuido  su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. EL Sr. González necesita comprar: 4 quintal de arroz americanos a $ 58.00 dólares el quintal, 4 quintales de azúcar a  $ 30.00 dólares el quintal, 3 bidones de aceite a $ 28.00 dólares el bidón, 6 cajas de Jabón para  lavar ropa a $ 15.00 dólares cada  caja, 3 cajillas de huevos a $ 30.00 dólares cada  cajilla y 4 quintales de frijoles a $ 56.00 dólares el  quintal, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger González O. is 46 years old, originally from Bluefields and is married to Mrs. Andrea Valladares. They have 2 dependent children who are in secondary school. Mr. González has owned a convenience store for more than 8 years and this business has allowed him to pay for his childrens´ food and education. His customers are the residents of his neighborhood and they prefer his business because of the variety of products he has (basic grains, juices, soups, carbonated drinks, natural soft drinks among other things). This is his only souce of income. The demand for the products he offers has not decreased and consumption is high. Mr. González needs to buy: 400 kg. of rice at $58.00 per hundredweight, 400 kg. of sugar at $30,00 per hundredweight, 3 drums of oil at $28.00 per drum, 3 boxes of laundry soap at $15.00 per box, 3 boxes of eggs at $30.00 per box and 400 kg. of beans at $56.00 per hundredweight. With this investment he will be able to increase his earnings and meet the demands of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 400 kg. of rice, 400 kg. of sugar, 3 drums of oil, 6 boxes of soap, 3 boxes of eggs, 400 kg. of beans

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de six femmes, toutes mariées et ayant en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers monogames dans le quartier Rails ko de Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali).
Les membres  du groupe se sont connues dans l’association traditionnelle Parissain qui veut dire  en dialecte Bobo. Elles font  plusieurs activités génératrices de revenu  telles que la vente du riz, la fabrication des boissons locales non alcoolisées et la transformation des légumes (oignon tomate). Leur bonne organisation et leur dévouement dans les activités leurs ont valu un appui de l’US AID avec l’octroi des séchoirs et une machine de collage de sachets.
Dans le but d’améliorer leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’approcher Soro  Yiriwaso qu’elles ont connu à travers l’Assemblée Générale des Artisans de Markala. Après avoir bien remboursés les  prêts précédents elles sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire, qui sera utilisé pour acheter 6 sacs de sucre, 2 sacs de gingembre, 1 sac d’oseille de Guinée, 2 douzaines de flacon d’essence (menthe), 10 douzaines de sachets plastiques et 32 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent hebdomadairement au marché de Diamarabougou pour les ingrédients des  boissons locales ; les pagnes wax sont achetés au grand marché de Ségou. Elles revendent en détail, au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Diamarabougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et   de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38.000FCA  qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. Leur ambition est  d’acheter un congélateur.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of six women, all married, and averaging 32 years of age and 4 children. They live in monogamous households in the Railsko neighborhood in Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). The members of the group got acquainted through the traditional association Parissain. They run various money-making businesses, such as selling rice, making local non-alcoholic beverages, and vegetables transformation (onions, tomatoes). Their good organization and their devotion to their businesses got them help from US AID, which provided them with dryers and a machine to glue sachets.

To improve their businesses, they decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, which they got to know through the General Assembly of the Artisans of Markala. After having repaid the former loans without problems, they are now seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). They will use it to buy 6 sacks of sugar, 2 sacks of ginger, 1 sacks of roselle, 24 flasks of mint essence, 120 plastic bags, and 32 pieces of wax pagnes (colorful African cloth). They get their weekly supplies of ingredients for the local beverages at the Diamarabougou market, the wax pagnes are purchased at the Ségou grand market. They retail for cash or on credit, at home and at the market in Diamarabougou to a clientele comprising men and women. They hope to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 38'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to help with the family expenses. They ambition to purchase a freezer.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare local beverages, and to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: La señora Magdalena vive con su hija, porque su esposo trabaja en los Estados Unidos y les manda dinero para cubrir los gastos familiares , pero en la escuela de su hija le acaban de requerir unos útiles escolares y ese es el motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito, así su pequeña tendrá un mayor aprovechamiento.
texts.en:
Magdalena lives with her daughter because her husband works in the United States, sending them money to cover household expenses. Her daughter's school requires school supplies, so she is applying for this loan. The loan will give her child better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane W.  is a pharmacist, a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs the business at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. The business items are purchased from the wholesale pharmacy shops at Kariakoo business city center. She has been in the business for four years. Her plan is to run a wholesale pharmacy shop but funds are the limiting factor. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To buy more business stock

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es: Zarela tiene 40 años, es madre de 4 hijos, vive junto a su esposo quien la apoya en lo posible. La casa que habitan es propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de comida (caldo de gallina) en un espacio que acondicionaron sus hijos fuera de su casa para su negocio. Este platillo, solo lo vende por las mañanas, ya que es muy demandado a tempranas horas, porque es reconstituyente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degusten de su buena sazón y darles una buena atención es muy importante para Zarela, de eso dependerá que regresen o no a su negocio. Lo más difícil es no contar con un local apropiado, pero a pesar de eso, le es rentable, porque se encuentra ubicada una buena zona. Con MFP ya tiene 8 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos sus compañeros son unidos y responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mesas, sillas y materiales de cocina necesarios para su negocio.
texts.en:
Zarela is 40 years old and a mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband who is supportive of her. The house that they live in is theirs. For four years she has been selling food (chicken soup) in a space that her children set up for her outside of their house. She only sells her dish in the morning because it is in high demand during the early hours of the day because of its restorative properties. The thing she likes most about her work is that many people savor the good flavor of her food. Giving her customers a good product is very important for Zarela, since this determines whether customers return to her business. The most difficult part is that she is not located in the most convenient location. However, her business is profitable because she is located in a good area. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she likes to work with her communal bank because her colleagues are united and responsible with their payments. With the money from the loan she will purchase tables, seats, and kitchen supplies for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie L. is 33 years old and married; she lives with her husband and two children. She works hard on improving her family's housing conditions, using the capital she makes from her sari-sari store, which she started through the financial assistance of Paglaum MPC. She has repeatedly shown us her strength and leadership in her lending group and in her role as a center officer. Now she is applying for her fourth loan cycle in the amount of P14,000.00 to supplement her housing loan.

She hopes that someday she can own a thriving sari-sari store, through her own efforts and through financing from Kiva.

loans.use: To improve her family's housing conditions.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 20 años, tiene un bebé de 10 meses de nacido, vive en una casa arrendada. Debido a sus necesidades económicas y a sus deseos de salir adelante, emprendió su propio negocio, y con las ganancias de su trabajo agrícola en su pueblo compró mercadería para instalar una tienda en la ciudad. Resultado de su constancia y trabajo de 6 meses ha adquirido clientela regular, la cual le permite tener un ingreso estable sin descuidar la atención de su bebé. Lo difícil es darse tiempo para comprar los productos para surtir su bodega, ya los fines de semana tiene que comprar las frutas y verduras, porque los otros productos se los traen hasta su tienda. Guillermina tiene grandes deseos de mejorar y surtir su negocio con mayor cantidad de mercadería para dar una mejor atención. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de trabajar con su banco comunal, y ser muy responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la comprar una balanza electrónica para dar un mejor servicio y peso más exacto de los productos que vende a granel.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 20 years old, has a baby of 10 months, and lives in a rented house. Because of her financial needs and her desire to get ahead, she began her own business. With the earnings from her agricultural work in her town she bought merchandise to set up a store in the city. As a result of her consistent work over six months she has acquired regular clients which allows her to have a stable income while still being able to care for her baby. The difficult thing is to find time to buy the products to supply her shop, since on the weekends she needs to buy the fruits and vegetables. The other products are brought to her at her store. Guillermina has a great desire to improve and supply her business with a larger quantity of merchandise to provide better service. This is the first time that she will have a loan with MFP and she is very excited to work with her community bank and to be very responsible in her repayments. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of an electronic scale to provide better service and more exact weight of the products she sells in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an electronic scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase some grains such as maize and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Isabel Juana

texts.es: Doña Isabel es originaria de la comunidad de Nimapa del municipio de Totonicapán  su actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de playeras, ella actualmete cuenta con su pequeño taller con cinco operarias y su principal mercado son los municipios de San Cristobal, San Francisco el Alto y la ciudad Capital, hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de tela, y conos para surtir su mercaderia, con el objetivo de buscar otros mercados para mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is originally from the community of Nimapa in the town of Totonicapán. Her principal activity is making and selling shirts. She presently works from her little shop with five sewing machines and her main markets are the towns of San Critsobal, San Francisco el Alto, and the city Capital. Today she needs a loan to purchase fabric and cones to increase her merchandise, with the aim of finding new markets to improve her lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Kaswa South Nakalwago Lydia Group

texts.en: N. Lydia is a married woman of 42 years leading Kaswa south group. She is blessed with seven children. Four of them are going to school. She deals with farm produce like sweet potatoes, maize, rice, etc and she has been in her business for fifteen years. She says produce mostly is seasonal but at least now she handles. She is using the loan to purchase farm produce in bigger volume like rice, sweet potatoes, cassava, maize, etc for sale. Her stock is improving and her future hope is to enlarge her business so she will be able to stock even in times of scarcity and to obtain a shop aside her business.

loans.use: To purchasing farm produce in bigger volume

loans.name: Nancy Gladys

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Nancy es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene una botica llamada Unión Gómez, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo, además Nancy vende material quirúrgico a pedido.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas.
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una cadena de farmacias.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Solution cooperative bank. Nancy is married, 40 years old, and has 3 children. She has a boutique called “Gómez Union” in a rented location, an activity she carries out with the help of her son. Nancy also sells medical supplies on order. Nancy needs a loan of 1,800 Peruvian soles, which she will use to invest in the purchase of medicines. Nancy’s dreams are for her children to become professionals, and to own a chain of pharmacies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Processing seafood

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old. She is married to Jogie, a house carpenter who sometimes also works as a farm laborer. They are blessed with two children, Gregorio, age 9, and Janice, age 5. Both of the children are enrolled in a public school in their village. The family resides in Barangay South, Caronsi Peñablanca, Cagayan.

Jane sells cooked foods by going house-to-house around their village. To continue her business, she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 9,000 to use as additional capital to supply her customers with food snacks. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman for the future of her two children. She believes that her vending business will somehow pave the way to a progressive living.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, Collpani, se reunen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal Rubi y estan en el ciclo 8, liderizadas por su presidenta Isabel I., elaboran su reglamento interno.
Ellas tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de comida, carne, libros, yutes, cosméticos y tienda de barrio. Necesitan el préstamo para comprar insumos y mercadería que les  permita generar mayores ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus familias. Es el caso de Wendy C. de 24 años,  vende carne en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, y requiere comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
The Rubi Communal Bank meets in one of the Pro Mujer community centers, Collpani, every two weeks. They are in their eighth cycle. Led by their president, Isabel I., they make their own rules. They have their own businesses like selling food, meat, books, jute, and cosmetics. Some also have grocery stores. They need a loan to buy supplies and merchandise, which will allow them to generate greater income and be able to cover their families’ basic needs. That is the case for Wendy C. who is 24. She sells meat at different fairs in the city of El Alto. She needs to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es de ocupación comerciante ambulante de golosinas (dulces) por las mañanas y por las tardes trabaja como enfermera, no tiene hijos, la casa donde vive es propia, la construcción es de ladrillo y esta ubicada en la villa Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería  (golosinas), de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en sus distintos puntos de venta de la Ciudad de El Alto.

Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, los créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Elizabeth.

loans.use: compra de dulces al por mayor para su reventa al por menor .

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 34 years-old, married to Phyllis Gathoniand and they have three school going children. Simon has run his barber shop for two years. He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. With it, Simon plans to buy a new battery charger, since he uses power from a battery to power the machines he uses.

One day, Simon hopes to open more barber shops around town to increase his level of income and improve his standard of living.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering her clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a battery charger.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Mrs. Sareth C. lives in Angkonh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Long Neang, is a cow breeder.  Since this business is going well he wants to expand it so his wife decide to ask for a loan to buy two more cows for breeding. Mrs. Sareth C. has six children, four of whom are employed in different positions and the others are studying. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy two more cows for breeding.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im P., 45, is married and lives with her five children and her husband in the Takeo province. She and her husband are silk weavers who are able to earn approximately US$5 of profit every day. Currently, Im P. is asking for a loan of US$500 which she needs to purchase more silk. (Im P. is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Exito Group

texts.es: El grupo “Éxito” esta representado por la señora Rilca y conformado por 10 miembros muy trabajadores y con ganas de salir adelante como lo han ido demostrando en sus anteriores ciclos, en este momento el grupo se encuentra ingresando a su quinto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos. La gran mayoría de las socias s e dedican a la venta de comida como pollo y platos especiales tradicionales, el resto de las socias se dedican a al venta de CDs y al servicio de filmaciones a domicilio para acontecimientos especiales, y también a al venta de material escolar y la carpintería.   La competencia en estos rubros es grande pero las socias se han ganado su reputación por los años de experiencia vendiendo comida ya que la gente ya conoce y saben la calidad de sus productos. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería nueva y para la compra de herramientas de trabajo que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas rápido para obtener una mejor ganancia para el mejor sustento de sus familias. Los anteriores créditos fueron bien administrados y se ha podido ver el progreso en sus tiendas, negocios y principalmente en sus hogares ya que se ve una mejoría en la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Éxito” group is represented by Rilca and made up of 10 very hard-working members who want to get ahead, as they have demonstrated in past cycles. At this moment, the group is in its fifth cycle having demonstrated responsibility, honesty and fulfillment of their repayment plans. The majority of the members are in the business of preparing meals for sale like chicken and special traditional dishes. The rest of them sell CDs, provide in-home photography and videography services for special occasions, and some sell school and carpentry supplies. All of these lines of work have heavy competition but the members have established solid reputations over the years selling dishes that people recognize and with the high quality of their ingredients. The financing will be used to buy new supplies and work tools so that their work can be done faster and profits may be higher for the better well-being of their families. Their previous loans have been well administered and they have made progress in their stores and businesses and, mainly, in their homes since they all have seen an improvement in the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: La Manzana Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Manzana está integrado por Rosario Ruiz Velázquez de 54 años. Está señora durante doce años a trabajado arduamente en la venta de verduras en el Mercado de Masaya con lo cual se ayudado. En este año las ventas estuvieron regular pero tiene la esperanza que el próximo año sea mejor.

Mientras su compañera Catalina P. de 60 años empezó a ganarse la vida desde muy joven haciendo comidas tradicionales como el nacatamal (a base de maíz y carne de cerdo), las enchiladas y la sopa de mondongo.  

 Rolando P. es el menor del grupo en edad y experiencia. Este joven de 22 años hace dos años empezó a vender granos básicos para poder continuar con sus estudios en electrónica y su meta es desempeñar lo que estudio.
texts.en:
The “La Manzana” (“Apple”) group includes Rosario Ruiz Velázquez, 54 years old. For twelve years she has worked arduously selling vegetables in the Masaya Market. This year, her sales were only satisfactory, but she hopes they will be better in the coming year.

Meanwhile, her friend Catalina P., 60 years old, began making her living at a young age by selling traditional foods like “nacatamales” (cornmeal buns filled with pork), enchiladas, and tripe soup.

Rolando P. is the youngest member of the group. He is 22 years old and two years ago began to sell staple grains to help him continue his studies in electronics. His goal is to complete his studies and work in that field.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Duk S., 54, is married and lives with her two children in Dangkao, Cambodia.

S. is involved in the business of selling groceries at her home in the village and she is able to earn an income of US$3.75 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been engaged in this business since 2004. Her husband is a skillful carpenter, earning an income of US$5 per day.

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each others to ensure a good standard of living for the family and they are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more groceries to stock her store. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada, está casada y tiene 60 años, vive en el Distrito de  Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. La Socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” y presenta estudios Superiores de Pedagogía.   Tiene 04 hijos, 01 que aun estudia y depende de ella.

Ada, es una mujer trabajadora, que se siente capaz de cumplir sus  sueños. Desde hace 8 años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, y productos de belleza,  siempre contando con el apoyo de su esposo. 
Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, compró: leche en cajas, huevos en jabas, papel higiénico en paquetes, gaseosas en diferentes sabores y tamaños. Y parte del dinero lo invirtió en productos de belleza.

Con este crédito de S/ 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas,  y productos de belleza como: colonias, talcos, para niños, damas y caballeros, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Adita, como le dicen de cariño, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, su sueño es tener un Minimarket bien surtido. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ada is 60 years old and married. She lives in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, in the Department of San Martín. She is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank and has university training in the field of education. She has 4 children, one of whom is still studying and dependent on her. Ada is a hard-working woman who feels that she is capable of achieving her dreams. For the past 8 years, she has sold groceries and beauty products, with her husband's constant help and support. With her first loan, for 300 Peruvian new soles, she purchased cases of milk, cartons of eggs, packages of toilet tissue, and soft drinks in various sizes and flavors. She also invested some of the funds in beauty products. With the current loan for 2,500 soles, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk, and cases of tinned fish of a variety of brands; beauty products for men, women and children, such as colognes and talcum powder; and housecleaning and personal hygiene products, in order to continue satisfying her customers and providing them with better service. "Adita," as those close to her call her, sees herself today as a very fulfilled woman. Her dream is to operate a well-stocked mini-market. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for helping her start her business, and for also helping many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, canned foods, cleaning and hygiene products, and beauty products

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita L. is a resident of Ginoong Sanay, Binangonan, Rizal. She is 60 years old and married. She is seen as strong and determined to improve their status of living. She is a caring mother of two. Both of her children are of minor age and need her support.


Currently, Carmelita and her husband are busy with their fishing business just to earn the means of living every day. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center.


She applied for a new loan to PHP 30,000 to have additional working capital for her fishing business. Specifically, the loan fund will be used to pay for a motor boat (Bangka). Carmelita is a very good member of ASHI. She performs well in her business; when she has enough capital, she adds more business in order to gain more income. 


She hopes that through her loans from ASHI in partnership with KIVA, someday she will be able to save money for her future because the couple is getting older now. Along with her dream of a successful business, she hopes to see her children graduate from college and find a stable job.

loans.use: To pay for a motor boat.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina C., 60, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Prudencio C., who is retired, they are blessed with four children who are living their lives independently. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling newspapers for seven years.

Catalina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than ten years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow from CCT’s cooperative seven times. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed as additional capital for her business. Her business makes a profit of PHP 15,000 per month.

With your help, she would now like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be a source of additional capital for her expanding business and will be used to buy additional newspapers for her newspaper selling business.

She dreams that her business will grow large enough to supply the needs of her family.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional newspapers for her newspaper selling business

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en:
Maria Concepcion D. C. is from the village of Caggay, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old and single.To make a living, Maria Concepcion runs a food stall near the school. She is relatively new to this business.

In 2009, Maria Concepcion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Concepcion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI and is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maria Concepcion from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca y que se encuentra ubicada a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de paños (tejido decorativo hecho a base de hilos y tejido artesanalmente) desde hace ocho años. Con esta actividad se ha estado agenciando de recursos económicos  y ha podido incursionar también en el negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Con mucho esfuerzo ha podido conseguir una clientela fija que siempre le hace pedidos. Adicionalmente ha empezado a comprar productos para tener un sotck permanente que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Carmen siente que su negocio es importante para su familia ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador eventual no son suficientes para sostener la economía familiar. Por ello desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos cosméticos y con la compra de un mostrador, para lograr su objetivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Carmen es una mujer creativa, laboriosa y que da todo de si para salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 29-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three, minor children in Santa Rosa, a community that depends primarily on fishing, located twenty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 8 years she has woven paños (decorative weavings made from thread that is woven as a craft). This activity has been providing income for her and has allowed her to make inroads into catalogue cosmetics sales. With much effort, she has managed to secure a regular customer base that always places orders with her. In addition, she has started to buy products in order to have permanent stock available for her customers. Carmen believes that her business is important to her family because her husband’s earnings as a temporary worker are insufficient to support the family. She, therefore, would like to enlarge her business buying more cosmetics and a display counter. To reach this goal, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan. Carmen is a creative, hard-working woman who gives 100% of herself in order to get ahead. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has demonstrated responsibility with respect to repayment of her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and a display counter.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert A. O. is a farmer who lives in the town of Nambale, which is located in the Busia district. He makes a living selling his produce in the local market, a business he started in 2005 after being laid off from a job in Mumias town. Robert is 25 years old, married and blessed with three children. He has applied for a loan of KShs. 10,000 to expand his farm. His goal is to increase his income and ability to run a successful and sustainable business.

loans.use: to expand his farming business

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry R. F., tiene la edad de 29 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Henry también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Henry R. F. is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children, ages 6 and 2, who are his top priority. This loan will be used to maintain his farm, specifically for the purchase of compost and fertilizer for his coffee crop. He wants to provide proper maintenance to his coffee crop in order to achieve the best quality and the highest possible price when it is time to harvest. This is his first loan and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don Henry has worked several years in agriculture. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater financial stability. Henry also wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers for his coffee crop

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda U. is from the city of Divisoria Santiago. She is 31 years old. Freda is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Freda manages a direct selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cosmetics and apparel products. Freda has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Freda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Freda is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Freda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia L. is currently in the business of selling various foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs like rice and beans.  Nadia is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs like rice and beans

loans.name: Peter Omondi

texts.en:
Peter O.,33  years old, is from Nyalenda town in Kisumu city and is married to Benter Akoth. They have three children: Bridget, 8 years old, Cambeline, 6 years old, and Scoria, 4 years old. 

Peter owns a motorcycle which he uses in his business to transport people from Nyalenda to Kisumu town. He normally has good business during rush hours, i.e., in the morning when people are going to work and in the evening when people are going back home. This is the first loan that he is applying from Kadet Ltd after being introduced by a friend who is a client here and has benefited greatly by the loans offered. He wants to buy some spare parts for his motorcycle to enable him to operate it well.

His main desire is to own a rickshaw in the future.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
A new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Amelita is grateful for access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. With the support of our Kiva partner, Amelita is hopeful that her businesses endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life.

Amelita is a married woman with one child, and lives in the province of Rizal with her husband. She is seen as strong and determined to improve their status of living. She is a caring mother of her only child, Bryan.

To supply additional income for her family, Amelita would like to receive a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional working capital for her sari-sari (variety) store and RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) business. With the loan, she will increase the inventory of foodstuffs for her store and buy more clothes to sell. She believes that offering a wider inventory in her business will attract loyal customers in the neighborhood and attract a steady flow of patrons every day.

Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is her hope to see her child graduate from college and find a stable job.

loans.use: To increate the inventory of foodstuffs for her store and to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta tiene 51 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el caserío San Eloy, una zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia D. Piura, se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas, las cuales son vendidas en algunas procesadoras del lugar que manufacturan este producto para exportarlo a diversos países del exterior. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. chicha D. jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara en base a un tipo especial D. harina D. maíz), Esta bebida es bastante consumida en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores del lugar la consumen antes D. iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor.

Jacinta ofrece esta bebida acompañada D. diversos platos denominados 'piqueos' los dias sabado, domingo y lunes. El negocio goza D. buena acogida gracias al buen trato que ella brinda a sus clientes. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza en ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos económicos D. su familia.

Jacinta desea adquirir mas insumos para seguir elaborando esta bebida e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr sus metas.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y respetuosa, su mas granD. anhelo es seguir trabajando para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer honesta y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 51 years old, she is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in San Eloy, a rural community located in the agricultural district of TambogranD., in the Piura province, which is three hours away from the town of Chiclayo. The main activity of this area is the production of fruit that is then sold to some local food processors manufacturing this product to export it abroad. Jacinta engages in producing and selling chica D. jora (a typical drink of the area prepared with a special kind of maize flour). This is a fairly consumed drink in the area, especially during the various holidays and celebrations. On top of this, local workers drink it before starting to work, because they believe this drink gives energy and strength. Jacinta offer this drink together with different appetizers called “piqueos” on Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays. Her activity enjoys a good reputation thanks to the good way she treats her customers. She uses the money she earns from this activity to help her husband, a farmer, cope with the economic expenses of their family. Jacinta wishes to buy more ingredients to keep on preparing this drink and increase her sales. For this reason, and for the first time, she has requested a loan of 1000 PEN to Edpyme Altenativa in order to reach her goals. She is a calm and respectful woman, whose biggest desire is to keep on working to improve her family’s quality of life. In the area where she lives she is known by neighbors and acquaintances for being a honest and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare chicha and to enlarge her stall.

loans.name: Lourdes Jeaneth

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Jeaneth Martinez tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el barrio Suyapa desde hace 4 años y con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacion a podido construir su casa que es de adobe y sin piso.
Lourdes es madre soltera  con dos hijos que dependen de ella.
Lourdes tiene que levantarse temprano a preparar el alimento para sus hijos que van a la escuela y dejar hecho los trabajos de la casa porque a las 8 de la mañana tiene que estar en el puesto donde vende la ropa y las 
sandalias para poder asi vender sus productos con las personas que visitan el mercado de Nacaome.
nos comento que a veces las ventas son bajas y vende poco pero con la ayuda de dios dice que ha salido adelante con su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y sandalias ya que en toda epoca se venden bastante las sandalias porque Nacaome es unos de los lugares mas calientes de Honduras y las personas prefieren andar comodas con sandalias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes Jeaneth Martinez is 43 years old. She has lived in the Suyapa neighborhood for 4 years and with a lot of hard work and dedication she has been able to build her one story adobe house. Lourdes is a single mother with two dependent children. Lourdes has to get up very early to prepare the food for her children who are going to school and do the housework because at 8 in the morning she has to be in the stall where she sells clothing and sandals in order to sell to the people who visit the Nacaome market. She told us that sometimes sales are low and she sells little, but with God's help she has gotten her family ahead. She will use the loan to buy clothing and sandals since these sell well year round. Nacaome is one of th hottest places in Honduras and people prefer to be comfortable with sandals..

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and sandals

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie G. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 57 years old. Rosie is married and has 4 children. Her youngest, who is aged 13, still goes to school. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 30 years.

Rosie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child and improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 44 years old. Josephine is single. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a general store business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Esmeralda quedo viuda muy joven, después de eso inicio un pequeño negocio en su casa y con los ingresos de ese negocio saco a sus hijos adelante, es por eso que ella requiere de este crédito, para comprar mas mercancía para la tienda de abarrotes, para elevar sus ingresos y si seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Esmeralda was widowed very young. After this she opened a small store in her home and with income from it is raising her children. She needs funds to buy more stock merchandise for her grocery store to increase income and continue to support her children’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en: Precila B. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Precila is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Precila makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like rice cakes. Precila has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Precila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Precila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Precila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity D. is currently in the business of selling fruits like mangoes, jack fruits, etc., at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more jackfruit and pears to sell. 

Charity is 33 years old and married to a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up an ice cream shop.

loans.use: Stock more jackfruit and pears to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata D. est âgée de 49 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs autres ménages, au quartier Pelengana sud  de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école pour se marier par volonté parentale, elle débuta tôt le petit commerce d’articles divers de toutes sortes. Elle mène cette activité depuis 15 ans  et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété. 
Dans  le dessein de renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 54 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés,  elle  est à son 4ème prêt individuel, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 4 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe et 2 sacs de riz. Elle s’approvisionne  sur place. Madame Aminata D. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à rembourser son prêt et à participer à des événements sociaux.
texts.en: Mrs. Aminata D. is 49 years old, married and the mother of 8 children.  She lives in a traditional family with her husband, her children and several other household members, in the Pelengana neighborhood in the south of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Having left school to get married at her parents’ wishes, she started her small business of diverse articles of all sorts early on.  She has run her business for 15 years and enjoys a great reputation and fame.  With the intention of strengthening her business funds in order to meet the demands of her customer base, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso 54 months ago.  After three group loans and three individual loans, all fully paid back, she is on her fourth individual loan, which she expects to use to buy four cartloads of heating wood and two bags of rice.  She stocks up in town.  Mrs. Aminata D. sells for cash and for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.  She expects to make a monthly profit off 40,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay back her loan and to participate in social events.

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Kanyogoga Bakyara Tukore Group

texts.en:
Ronald K. is the leader of his lending group, Kanyogoga Bakyara, in Mubende. He is 36 years old and married with three children. Ronald has an agriculture business where he sells produce from Kanyogoga and his main customers are the people in his locality. He has always been involved in the farming business and due to the high demand, he has succeeded in what he does. 

Ronald needs a loan to be able to buy a camera so that he can also take photos around his area for a fee.

loans.use: Buying a camera to start taking photos

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, en la zona de Bajo San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, casada tiene 3 hijos, la actividad que realiza es la venta de comida, con esta actividad ella genera los ingresos para su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar arroz, fideo, y otros productos de primera necesidad que están subiendo de precio en el mercado, para poder abastecerse y tratar de no subir el precio de sus comidas para no perder sus clientes.

Es cliente de Impro desde hace dos años y paga muy bien; por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Verónica lives in her own house with her husband and children in the zone of Bajo San Martin in the city of La Paz. She is married with 3 children and the activity she carries out is food sales. With this activity she generates her family's income.

The loan she is requesting is to buy rice, noodles, and other basic supplies which are increasing in price in the market in order to be able to stock up on them and try not to raise the price of her food and lose her customers. 

She has been a client of Impro for two years and pays back very well. For her social character she qualifies to obtain a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies such as rice, noodles, and more for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eusebia; ella tiene 52 años D. edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. ropa, ella venD. diferentes tipos D. ropa en forma ambulatoria, ella la mercadería lo trae D. diferentes lugares como Bolivia y Chile, la socia quiere tenr una tienda para vender los polos, pantalones, blusas entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio D. venta D. ropa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank named "Comuzone I". The community bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

The member's name is Eusebia. She is 52 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She has a clothing retail business through which she sells various types of clothing along the streets. She brings her merchandise from different places such as Bolivia and Chile. She would like to have a store from where to sell polo shirts, slacks, blouses etc. She requests a loan in order to purchase merchandise for her clothing retail business.

She is very happy to receive a loan and she is committed to the payment terms of her loan.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng L. is 53 years old and a resident of the Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She is married with six children, two of whom are married. Her husband, Kheil, is 55 years old. He is a local fisherman.

Seng L. makes a living cultivating rice and selling fresh fish in her community. She is currentL. earning around $1.50 a day. She has a few farmlands on which she doesn’t grow any crops yet, and she is going to grow peanuts, but her cash on hand is insufficient to do it. That is why Seng L. is applying for a loan as capital to allow her to purchase seeds and to hire the plowing machine to plow on her farmland so that she can start to plant.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and to hire a plow so she can start to plant

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Don Eusebio vive en San Gustin mextepec, es un hombre casada, tiene solo un hijo de 14 años, su hijo estudia la secundaria en una esceula que está en su misma comunidad, no tiene un casa propia porqué vive con su padre, es mas bien prestada, la esposa de don Eusebio se lleva muy bien con sus suegros y es muy trabajadora, es ama de casa pero tambíen trabaja como comerciante vendiendo ropa interior para dama y caballero en una plaza en San Felipe del progreso.

Don Eusebio es albañil, estudio hasta terminar la secundaria apesar que es joven no hay trabajos para el, solamente le quedo aprender albañileria que es un oficio en donde no piden esceula pero es muy duro, solo trabaja cuando hay alguna construcción, como una casa, algun local o edificios en la ciudad de México.

Don Eusebio tambíen es comerciante desde hace varios años sale junto con su esposa a trabajar los domingos en la plaza de San Felipe del progreso, su esposa se coloca a un lado de el vendiendo ropa interior y don Eusebio vende zapatos, articulos de limpieza de calzado como cremas, brochas y tintas, tambien vende vasos de licuadoras y licuadoras completas, tambíen las repara.

Lo compplicado en el negocio de don Eusebio es cuidar el producto para que no le pegue el sol, si le pega el sol a las cremas el envase se infla o se derrite la grasa y la gente ya no lo compra.

Don Eusebio quiere una vida mejor para su familia y una mejor educación para su hijo, por eso quiere cumplir su meta de tener mercaia propia, porqué la mayor parte de mercancia es comprada con dinero prestado, por eso quiere mejorar y no dever dinero para que vaya avanzando con su familia.
texts.en:
Eusebio lives in San Gustin Mextepec. He is a married man and he only has a 14-year old son. His son is in high school in a school located in their community. He doesn't have a house of his own because he lives with his father; it is on loan to him. Eusebio's wife gets along very well with her in-laws and she is very hard working. She is a housewife but she also works as a merchant selling undergarments for ladies and gentlemen in a plaza in San Felipe del Progreso. 

Eusebio is a construction worker. He completed high school, and even though he is young there is no work for him. The only thing he was able to take up is construction, which is a trade that doesn't require training, but it is difficult work.  He only works when there is a contract for a house, a store, or a building in the Mexico City. 

Eusebio has also been a merchant for many years. He sets out together with his wife to work on Sundays at the plaza in San Felipe del Progreso.  His wife sets up in one side selling undergarments and Eusebio sells shoes, and shoe care products, such as polish, brushes, dyes, as well as blenders. He also repairs blenders. 

The difficult part about Eusebio's business is to keep his products away from the sun. If they are left in the sun the polishes expand or melt and the products won't sell. 

Eusebio wants a better life for his family and a better education for his son. For this reason he wants to reach his goal of having his own merchandise. The greatest part of his merchandise is purchased with borrowed money. He wants to improve his business and not have to owe money, and to be able to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase shoe care products.

loans.name: Nancy Marleni

texts.es: Nancy tiene 41 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos mejores hijos de 11 y 13 años de edad en casa de sus padres Nancy se inicio con una pequeña bodega aproximadamente cinco años actualmente cuenta con una bodega amplia y con dos mototaxi la cual una trabaja su esposo y la otra la da en alquiler, el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para el mantenimiento de sus mototaxi y capital de trabajo, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Nancy, 41, lives with her husband and two minor children who are 11 and 13 years of age in Nancy’s parents’ house.  About five years ago Nancy started out with a small store.  She now has a well-stocked store and two mototaxis one of which her husband operates and the other she leases out.

The granted loan will be for mototaxi maintenance and for working capital.  The loan is granted because she has good personal references and the ability to pay.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 34-year-old single man. He makes plates, cooking pans and cooking pots using scrap metals. He has been in this business for six years, and was previously employed as a driver. He says that he has been able to keep his customers because he learned good customer care through training offered by Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Wilson hopes that one day he will be able to open another outlet for his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en: Making wooden beds for a profit is a part of 59-year-old Nuth N.’s daily routine in the local furniture shop. Nuth N. has been working in this job since 2008, and has a proper salary every month to use for the family. Nuth N.’s wife is a rice farmer who has been earning a revenue by cultivating rice on her existing farmland for many years. They have given birth to five children: three are single and the other two are married. Presently, this family's living condition is not comfortable because some parts of their wooden wall is rotten and it is really so difficult to live in when the heavy rains come. To solve this problem, Nuth N. will use his loan to buy some poles to repair the broken parts of his wall.

loans.use: To buy some poles for repairing the broken parts of his wall.

loans.name: Rosa Adilia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, vive en la ciudad de Estelí. Es dueña de una pulpería y tortillería también.
Este ha sido su segundo préstamo de Kiva, ya que con el primer  crédito que obtuvo pudo mejorar su negocio, surtió mas su venta antes no vendía ningún tipo de carne ahora si vende pollo, res, tiene mas personas que le ayudan con el negocio, trabajan haciendo mas tortillas ya que su clientela aumento, compra mas materia prima, tiene una cocina industrial pues antes solo tenia una estufa.
Solicita el  préstamo  para  seguir comprando mas materia prima como maíz, quiere una nueva cocina donde puedan hacer mas tortillas, mejorar su cuarto de habitación y comprar una refrigeradora para vender refrescos, helados, gaseosas, jugos. En esta nueva inversión la estarían ayudando a administrarlo su hijo mayor y su esposo.
Ella espera que con este segundo préstamo le ayudara sentirse mas desahogada, poder comprar mas mercadería para abastecer su venta, tener variedad de producto y sobre todo ayudar a su hijos a finalizar sus estudios, ya que su hijo mayor esta por terminar su secundaria y pronto ira a la universidad y quiere apoyarlo hasta donde pueda para que el tenga una profesión.
texts.en:
