Rosa, 45 years old, is married with two children and lives in the city of Estelí. She owns a small grocery store and a tortilla-making business too. This is her second Kiva loan. With her first loan she was able to improve her business buy offering more products like meats. Before she did not sell any meat and now offers chicken and beef.  She has also hired more people to help her with the business, and they now make more tortillas because she has more customers. Rosa was also able to acquire an industrial kitchen; prevously she only had one stove. 

With this loan she will continue buyin supplies like corn for her grocery, build a new kitchen for making tortillas, improve her living quarters, and buy a refrigerator to sell soda, ice cream, and juices. Her husband and eldest son will be helping her with these new endeavors.

She hopes that this second loan will help her feel less exhausted. She will also be able to buy more merchandise and offer a greater variety of products. Most of all she hopes to help her children complete their studies. Her eldest son is close to finishing high school and soon will be attending university, and Rosa wants to offer all the support she can so that he will have a profession.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator to sell cold drinks and other groceries like corn

loans.name: Sugeida Concepcion

texts.es:
Sugeida, reside en  Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su hermano y su hijo, tiene casa propia y administra una tienda de productos de consumo, este negocio nació hace 6 años, con apoyo de financiamientos.
Por el momento su necesidad en el negocio es un freezer y más productos de consumo, para cual solicita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto y solvente la necesidad.
Para Sugeida el objetivo es dar a su hijo los estudios necesarios, trabajar por sus necesidades y por lo mismo trabaja diario para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sugeida resides in Jiquilisco, Usulutan department. She is 28 years old and lives with her brother and her child in her own house. She operates a consumer products store. The business was born some 6 years ago, with the help of loans.

At present, her business needs are a freezer and more consumer products. For that reason, she requests a loan to cover the costs and satisfy the necessity.

For Sugeida, her objectives are to provide for her son's educational needs, to work for their basic necessities, and at the same time, work daily to improve her earnings.

loans.use: TO BUY A FREEZER AND TO EXPAND HER INVENTORY OF CONSUMER PRODUCTS

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Chore - Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, fábrica de carbón, cría de animales, etc. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Este comité está pasando en el 2do. ciclo con muchas ganas de salir adelante con este grupo.
La sra. Marina se dedica a la cria y venta de cerdos, es un negocio que adoptó desde hace mucho tiempo, pues a pesar de que al principio le costó mucho trabajo, con el tiempo fue ganando clientes y buena reputación en el negocio, lo cual le ayudó a superarse dentro de la competencia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar balanceados y medicamentos para cerdos, pues quiere ganar mayor cantidad de clientes y necesita mantener el nivel de calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
The committee “La Esperanza” (The Hope) was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Chore-Santaní joining together. All of the committee members engage in independent businesses involving sales, producing charcoal, raising animals, and other trades. They have developed a close group that is capable of working together in activities that strengthen their friendship. The committee is in its second loan cycle and eager to move forward as a group.

Sra. Marina raises and sells pigs. She has been in this business for a long time. Even though she had to work extremely hard in the beginning, Marina was able to gain customers over time and develop a good reputation in her business. This has helped her overcome the competition. She is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed and medicines for her pigs. Marina wants to attract more customers, so she needs to maintain the level of quality in her products.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed and medicines.

loans.name: Juntos Unidos Iremos Al Camino Del Exito Group

texts.es: Carmen, es la presidenta del grupo “Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito” el grupo está conformado por 10 miembros que a su vez son amigos y vecinos que tiene como objetivo alcanzar metas en conjunto. Entre ellos  está la presidenta Carmen D. 37 años D. edad casada y madre D. dos hijos. Carmen  se dedica diariamente a la venta D. productos D. belleza y a la par venta D. lencería,  gracias a las ventas D. ambos productos  ha podido generar  una economía estable en su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en la compra D. más productos D. belleza como son cremas para la piel y lencería para la venta. En el futuro le gustaría poder inaugurar  una tienda D. productos D. belleza y expandir sus ventas a diversas zonas D. la ciudad. Así como Carmen cada integrante del grupo, tiene una meta en particular, que es el éxito y la mejoría económica D. sus negocios y  la estabilidad económica para sus familias.
texts.en:
Carmen is the President of the “Juntos Unidos Iremos al Camino del Éxito” (Together We Will Go to the Road to Success) group.  It has ten members who are friends and neighbors who have the objective of reaching their goals together.

Among them is the group President, Carmen, 37.  She’s married and the mother of two children.  Carmen sells beauty products daily and also sells lingerie.   Thanks to the sales of both products she’s been able to proviD. steady income for her home.

She plans to use this loan to buy more beauty products, like skin cream, and lingerie to sell.  In the future she’d like to open a beauty product store and expand her sales to various parts of the city.

Just like Carmen, each group member has a particular goal which is success and economic improvement of their businesses and economic stability for their families.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and lingerie.

loans.name: Jessica Viviana

texts.es:
Jessica Viviana tiene 21 años, vive en Unión Libre  vive con él con viviente en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Jessica se dedica comercialización de legumbres. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta  descansar y festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Jessica Viviana, aged 23, lives in a common-law marriage in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She has no children.

The member belongs to the rural communal bank "Grupo Pucara" located in Pucara, a neighborhood of the parish of Guanujo in the canton of Guaranda, which is 15 minutes away from the office of the microfinance institution Cooperativa San José. This group is composed of 22 members who work in agriculture, rear cattle and sell vegetables.

Jessica sells vegetables. She gets her supplies at the market in Guaranda and sells her goods at the wholesale market of the same city.

She applies for a loan to buy agricultural consumables. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to have her own house. She likes to rest and go to fiestas.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables.

loans.name: En Plan De Vuelo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "EN PLAN DE VUELO" porque para el grupo la oportunidad de obtener un prestamo es emprender sus sueños, y como el nombre del grupo lo indica “planear el vuelo” hacia donde quieren llegar con la inversion de su primer prestamo. Esta ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Juana tiene 37 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y tiene 2 hijos por cierto varones. Ella se dedica a la venta de de zapato por catalogo, lo cual piensa comprar más zapatos ya que tiene muchos pedidos por entregar. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al prestamo piensa hacer mayores inversiones en sus negocios y de esta forma comenzar a tener mas ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia. Tambien quiere ahorrar de las ganancias que obtenga para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos además de darles una carrera profesional para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called “En Plan de Vuelo” (Flight Plan) because they have taken the opportunity to launch their dreams by securing this loan. The meaning behind their name is that they have a specific point where they want to arrive once they have invested their first loan. The group is from the State of Hidalgo, Mexico, and consists of 10 members.

Sra. Juana is 37 years old and studied through high school. She is a merchant and has two sons. Juana sells shoes through catalogs and wants to buy more shoes since she has many outstanding orders. She was very enthusiastic upon submitting her loan request because she believes the money will help her make additional investments into her business. As a result, she will be able to generate more earnings so that she and her entire family will have a better standard of living. In addition, she wants to save some of the profit that she earns so that she can continue investing in her business and be able to give her children a better quality of life and the chance to earn a professional degree for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase shoes through catalogs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 29-year-old businesswoman.  She is single and has no children. In the year 2006, she established her local foodstuffs business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and she now requires a new loan in order to buy more local foodstuffs for her business such as palm oil, gari (cassava grits), foo-foo (processed cassava), bennie (sesame seeds) and groundnuts.. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, she plans to rent her own store where other traders from the provincial town will buy in large quantity to sell to the villagers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her inventory.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is a 49-year-old married man with six children who lives with his family in a two-room rented house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past eight years, he has been a coffee farmer and his work has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. Lazaro’s business hardships are coffee price fluctuations and his limited capital. Nevertheless, he longs to be the leading coffee farmer in his region. 

Lazaro is requesting a loan to buy coffee to plant.

loans.use: to buy coffee to plant

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon Jairo desde hace 4 años tiene un negocios donde vende ropa y mecato, el con este negocio ha podido brindarle a su padres la posibilidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocios con ropa deportiva de los diferentes equipos de fútbol para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes mas variedad en prendas.

El al ampliar su negocio con nueva mercancía va a mejorar su calidad de vida y así se incrementaran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jhon Jairo has had a business for four years which sells clothing and snack food.  With this business he has been able to provide his parents with the ability to have a better quality of life.

His dream is to have a business with sports apparel for the various football teams, so as to be able to offer his customers more variety in clothing.
Broadening his business with new merchandise will improve his quality of life and thus increase his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man with two children age 15 and 12. 

He operates an auto garage business in Nairobi. He has been in this business for five years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is the rainy season, since he operates in an open air market.

Geoffrey plans to use this loan to purchase auto spare parts to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and open such businesses in other areas in Nairobi. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make a living as cultivators. One of them is Mrs. Hin, age 52, who has been working in this sector since 1979.

Currently, Hin and her husband grow rice on their own farmland which they inherited from their grandparents. From this business, she can generate an income of around US$2 per day. 

This humble couple has four children. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house. Her daughter works as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh where she gets a low salary every month. 

The other two children are school-age. The family planted rice two months ago but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer and crop disease. Because of this, Hin and her husband are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer and insecticide to develop their business. 

She says the income will help her to improve her family's living standards. She is very thankful to all the lenders who help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide to develop her business.

loans.name: Nelly Estela

texts.es:
La Señora Nelly es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Chilcatotoras, vive por la parroquia de Turi, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad de Cuenca, su población mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña  Nelly tiene 28 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive con su mamá con quien comparte los gastos. 

La Señora Nelly se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que cuida de sus hijos que aun son pequeños, también cría cuyes y ganado comercializando la leche que obtiene de sus vacas. Otra de sus ocupaciones es la agricultura y lo que cosecha es  para el consumo de su casa. 

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas y en el alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Nelly is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres de Chilcatotoras" who lives by the Turi parish. This is a place with a cold climate whose people devote themselves to livestock and crop farming. Many work in the city of Cuenca, and the people keep up their culture and traditions. 

Doña Nelly is 28 years old, married, and has conceived as fruit of her conjugal bond three children who are eight, five and three years of age. Her first two children attend school. Her husband works in construction. She does not have her own home and so lives with her mom with whom she shares expenses. 

Ms. Nelly devotes herself to the household tasks as she is taking care of her children who are still young. She also raises guinea pigs and cattle, selling the milk she obtains from her cows. Another of her occupations is crop farming and what she harvests is for the consumption of her household. 

This is her third loan in the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of hens and feed for her animals. 

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy hens and animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es:
María es madre de familia de 53 años, vive con su hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece a la provincia de La Libertad.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y turística.

María cuenta con su negocio de venta de comida de forma ambulatoria en una zona muy transitada de la ciudad, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, pero a pensado en solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos, mesas, sillas y una cocina, con la finalidad de seguir brindando un buen servicio y satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.

Con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante María se ha ganado la confianza y el respeto de sus vecinos, demostrando que cuando uno se propone una meta se puede hacer realidad, con el objetivo de que su hijo tenga un mejor futuro y pueda ser profesional.
texts.en:
María is a 53-year-old mother who lives with her son in her own home which has water and electricity.  Her home is located in Chepén district, in La Libertad province.  People in this area work in farming, livestock raising and tourism.

María has a business selling food as an itinerant street vendor in a very busy area of the city.  She has been in this business for several years and has her own customer base.  She has decided to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy supplies, tables, chairs and a stove.  Her aim is to continue providing a good service and meeting her customers' needs.  She will use the income that she makes to repay her loan and improve her son's quality of life.

Through her work and her desire to get ahead, María has gained the trust and respect of her neighbors, showing them that when you set yourself a goal you can achieve it.  Her goal is for her son to enjoy a better future and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy supplies, tables, chairs and a stove for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is widowed and has two children. She is 23 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Grace sells cake to earn a living; she has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase cake flour to make cakes. Grace has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Grace hopes to have her own bakery in the town.

loans.use: To purchase cake flour

loans.name: Nargizahon's Group

texts.en:
Nargizahon, 24, is the leader of this group. Her husband works in Russia, and each month he sends her about 4000 soms to meet their family’s daily needs. Nargizahon is raising a son who is just one year old. In order to earn additional money for the family she cultivates cotton.  Selling part of the harvest, she earns about 2000 soms per month. This profit has made it possible for her to save money to purchase furniture for their home. At the moment Nargizahon is applying for a loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers. In the future she wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to its customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Gina works hard to support her family. She has been selling assorted biscuits in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Gina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more assorted biscuits to sell to customers.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, reside en su casa propia con su espsosa e hijos, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Tambogrande del departamento de Piura.  Se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

José se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga de Tambogrande a Piura y viceversa, una zona donde predomina la agricultura. Para realizar su actividad cuenta con un camión, el cuales propio y sus principales clientes son los pobladores de la zona donde vive. El ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea realizar mantenimiento,cambio de algunos repuestos y llantas de su camión ya que está presentando algunas fallas mecánicas, con la finalidad que al tener su carro en buenas condiciones podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.  José es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de seguir saliendo adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old.  He owns the home where he lives with his wife and children.  His home has water and electricity and is located in the urban area of the Tambogrande District in the department of Piura.  He is known for his work in farming, ranching, and craftsmanship.

For a living, José transports cargo from Tambogrande to Piura and vice versa.  This area is mainly used for agriculture.  In order to do his work, he relies on his truck, which he owns.  His main customers are the people who live in his neighborhood.  He has been doing this work for several years now and thanks to it he is able to pay for his family's expenses.

He wants to do maintenance on his truck by changing some parts and the tires because it has been having mechanical problems.  Because he will be able to offer his customers better service with his car in good condition, he thought it would be a good idea to ask for his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles.  José is well known and respected by his coworkers who consider him to be a responsible person with the drive to keep moving forward to help his family financially.

loans.use: to change some parts and the tires of his cargo truck

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a determined 37-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom attend school, has been selling clothes to support her family for the last three years. She employs one person to help her to manage her enterprise which has done so well because of Lucy's good reputation amongst her customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Lucy has been able to access loans to boost her business, and she is now requesting a new one for 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of clothes for resale. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Marlon did not pursue his college education because his parents could not afford to finance his schooling. Despite this, he decided to help his parents in managing their farm lots to earn a living and save for their future. They cultivate their rice field twice a year by planting rice. They endure hardships and difficulties as they want to increase their yields and income.

Marlon aims to increase their production and have a plentiful harvest.  He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his rice farming business. He believes that this loan will help him to increase his yield and hopes that he will earn a higher income to satisfy their basic necessities and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his rice farming business

loans.name: Roberta Yovanny

texts.es:
Roberta, es una madre soltera de 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad  , ella eligio este tipo de trabajo porque acompañaba a su hermana a vender ropa y porque le parece que de esta manera puede generar un poco más de ingresos para su hogar.  Roberta es una persona honesta, responsable y muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia , Roberta empezó en el negocio desde el año 2008, gana semanalmente S/. 250 soles , con el préstamo de S/. 1500 que recibirá gracias a Kiva lo invertirá para la compra de mercadería de estación ( polos, blusas, camisas, etc) una de sus metas es terminar de construir su casa  y llegar a tener su tienda  propia de ropa de buena calidad para que sea reconocida a nivel nacional para que de esta manera puedan vivir en mejores condiciones, su asesor de crédito piensa que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
Roberta  vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.
texts.en:
Roberta, aged 38, is the single mother of two adult children. She chose this kind of work because she accompanied her sister to sell clothes and thought that this way she could earn a bit more money for her household. Roberta is an honest, responsible and hard-working person, eager to bring up her family. Roberta started her business in 2008. She earns 250 new soles per week. She will use this loan of 1500 new soles, which will be provided through Kiva, to buy seasonal merchandise (T-shirts, blouses, shirts, etc.). One of her goals is to finish the construction of her home and open her own store, where she will sell high-quality clothes and be recognized at the national level, so that the family may live in better conditions. Her credit officer thinks that she is a good customer and will pay off her loan on schedule.

Roberta lives and works in famous Nazca, or Nasca, Peru. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines, a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited the region from 300 BC to AD 800. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hard-working people, who have preserved their culture despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis and a high level of poverty in the region.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (blouses, shirts, trousers, etc.).

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 26-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of 9 and 7, all in school, lives and farms in Kitale, Western Kenya. She relies on farming fully for her family upkeep, producing milk, maize and vegetables for the local market. She currently employs one farmhand.

Sarah has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the loan will boost her farming income and enable her to expand her other businesses as well as educate her children. While lamenting the fluctuations in farm produce prices, Sarah is glad to have access to Juhudi Kilimo loan services

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arzigul

texts.ru: Арзигул проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Сама Арзигул имеет средне – специальное образование. Она по специальности бухгалтер. В этой области она проработала год. На сегодняшний день она занимается посевом зерновых культур. В основном Арзигул арендует участок земли и сеет пшеницу для продажи. Кредит берет для взятия в аренду земли и покупки семян.
texts.en: Arzigul lives in the J.Rumy region. She is 50 years old, married. Her husband has left to work in Russia. Arzingul herself has an advanced degree and has been working as an accountant for a year. She also grows grains for sale, mostly wheat, on rented land. She is requesting this loan to rent land and purchase seeds for planting.

loans.use: To rent land and purchase seeds

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат 51 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж  работает на заводе. Она торгует тортами и пирожными. Кондитерские цеха привозят ей товар, и она их продает. Рафоат в бизнесе 15 лет, а с нашей организацией сотрудничает с 2010 года. Сейчас у нее сезон в торговле. Впереди Новый год и она планирует реализовать почти весь товар. По ее словам каждый день она продает более 20 тортов и несколько коробок с кондитерскими изделиями. У нее есть постоянные клиенты не только с городов но и с дальних районов. Так как сейчас у нее есть большой заказ на торты, для этого ей нужны были наличные деньги, поэтому она получает у нас кредит.
texts.en: Rafoat is 51 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works at a factory.  She sells cakes and pastries.  Bakeries deliver products to her, and she sells them.  Rafoat has been in the business for 15 years and has been partnering with our organization since 2010.  This is a good season for sales.  New Year's holiday is coming up, and she plans to sells almost all of her products.  According to Rafoat, she sells over 20 cakes and several boxes of confectionery goods every day.  She has regular customers, who come not only from the cities, but from remote districts.  Because she has a large order for cakes, she needs cash, and this is why she is requesting this loan from us.

loans.use: to purchase cakes and pastries

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is 36 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. Leilani works very hard to provide for them.

Leilani runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leilani has been in this business for two years. She sells a variety of items such as snacks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Leilani would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: In a family consisting of two little kids residing in Siem Reap province, Sophon is 31 years old and married. To feed his family, pig-raising and rice farming are the main source of his income which can generate him about 44,000 KHR per day. Never been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) before, Sophon is getting a new loan in order to buy pigs, pig’s feed, and to make pigpen. He hopes that he can support his business on time.

loans.use: To buy pigs , pig’s feed, and to make pigpen.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en:
Itagia already has a existing business of selling taro, bananas and fresh produce at the market at Central Apia.

With her first loan of $100, she was able to purchase seeds of various kinds of vegetables mainly cabbages and green pepper. She has being trained in potting them and selling to shops and restaurants with extra money earned. She was able to deliver her fresh product to shop and to maintain the vegetable gardens and plantation along with her cabbages nursery. Now on her fourth loan, her supply of vegetables has increased.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and weed killer

loans.name: Nurida

texts.en: Nurida is a resident of the Beylagan region. She started her private business in 2004 borrowing the first loan in  the amount of $500 from Normicro, Beylagan branch. For the first loan she increased the stock of goods and working capital. Now she needs a new counter-refrigerator to store meat and diary products.

loans.use: To buy new counter-refrigerator

loans.name: Matata

texts.en: Matata loves gardening and as a result, she operates a vegetable garden which assists in earning money for the family. She is a mother of six children and her main crops are cabbages which she sells at the local market and village.

loans.use: To purchase weedkiller, string, fertilizers & seeds.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok P. L. is 25 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband (pictured here because Sok P. L. was busy at work) and their 3 children.  She works in a hotel in the tourist city of Siem Reap, and her husband works in a hospital.  Combined, they earn $10/day which is enough to send their children to school.  Sok P. L. and her husband spend money on motortaxi drivers every day so that they can get to work.  She would like to have this loan so that they can buy their own motorbike.  Over time, this investment will make their overall transportation costs much cheaper.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport her and her husband to work

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde M. Marroquin, 24, weaves and embroiders the traditional Mayan women's top called a huipil. She can make about 3 each month, and sells them in the Chimaltenango market for perhaps US$28 each. She'll rush right out and invest this loan in yarn and embroidery thread. This is her first loan of her life, and having a bit of capital to buy the raw materials will be an amazing experience.

Matilde is married and has a little 9-month-old. Right now she and her husband rent a plot of about 20 by 40 meters to grow the corn that they use as their primary food, but she dreams of actually buying a plot of her own, which would cost as much as $1000. And someday she dreams of constructing a house too.

Matilde, like several other women in her village, reports that the children under age 2 are very regularly sick, with fevers, headaches, and stomach aches. It seems to clear up a bit when they get to age two, but it's a challenge that all the young families here seem to face.

Here is a video of the women of Matilde's group at their loan meeting. The entire group, without exception, weaves and embroiders huipiles, and you can see them here working away while the loan terms and obligations are being explained.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase yarn for weaving and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
FRANCISCA is 59 years old, she has 6 children, she is a widow since 5 years ago, and she sells meat from her house door to door and also works as a cook in a city restaurant. She belongs to the group Flor de Pascua 4 along with Mrs. Juana Pérez Suárez (who makes empanadas [corn cakes]), and Mrs. Alejandrina Díaz Velasco (who bakes artisan bread). Together, with the money form the loan they will buy better kitchen utensils and will try to get a place (shop) where they can sell their products since now they have to sell their products from the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

FRANCISCA, tiene 59 años, tuvo 6 hijos es viuda desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de carne de casa en casa y además trabaja de cocinera en un restaurante de la ciudad. Pertenece al grupo Flor de Pascua 4 junto con doña Juana Pérez Suárez (hace empanadas) y doña Alejandrina Díaz Velasco (hace pan artesanal) Con el préstamo todas habilitaran sus cocinas de mejores implementos y trataran de obtener un lugar donde vender ya que en estos momentos se desempeñan como vendedoras ambulantes.

loans.use: MEAT SALES

loans.name: Messan Azanlé

texts.fr:
Born in 1980 in Lomé, Mr. Messan Azanlé A., after his studies, began learning to be a pharmacist. At the end of this process, he opened his own village pharmacy selling generic products with his financial means. Very often, he is faced with shortages and thus risks losing his clientele. To fix this situation, he is asking for $1000 in financial support to stock his pharmacy and better satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1980 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Messan Azanlé, après ses études a suivi une formation en pharmacie au terme de laquelle, il a ouvert sa propre pharmacie villageoise de vente de produits génériques avec ses moyens de bord. Très souvent il est confronté à la rupture et risque de perdre sa clientèle. Pour palier à ce problème, il sollicite un apport financier de $1000 pour approvisionner sa pharmacie et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To stock up on pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mrs. Morn N.,37, works with her husband selling porridge and noodle soup to the people in their community, making collectively around US$ 10/day in revenue. She has three children living with her. One of them works as a carpenter and the other two are enrolled in school. Morn N. hopes to use this loan to invest her and her husband's business and also to buy carpentry tools for her son to facilitate his work.

loans.use: To invest in her business and also buy carpentry tools for her son

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Since very young, doña Edith’s aspirations have been related to the art of textile and therefore, with much dedication and effort, she has become an excellent seamstress. Doña Edith owns sewing machines, overcast stitch machines, and machines for the finishing process and others, which are all very helpful in her daily work as she tailors all kinds of garments which she offers from door to door. Doña Edith is 39 years old, has two children whom she wants to provide for with studies and welfare through her work. Edith’s goal is to have her own clothing store and to achieve this purpose she requires a loan as her working capital. Let us support doña Edith, a talented mother who makes an arduous effort to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Sus aspiraciones desde muy joven han estado relacionadas con el conocimiento del arte textil, es por eso que la señora Edith, se ha convertido con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo en una excelente costurera. Ella cuenta con máquinas de coser, máquinas remalladoras, y máquinas recubridoras, entre otras, que le son de mucha utilidad para la realización de su trabajo diario ya que confecciona prendas para todos los gustos, los cuales los ofrece a domicilio.La señora Edith a sus 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos a quienes desea brindarles estudios y bienestar con su labor. Edith tiene una meta, llegar a tener su propia tienda de ropas y para el cumplimiento de este propósito requiere de un préstamo como capital de trabajo. Apoyemos a la señora Edith madre talentosa que se esfuerza arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials (needles, thread, yarn, fabric, etc.)

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is low-income, vulnerable man. He is 25 years old and lives with his parents in a village near Saatli, in the central part of the Azerbaijan Republic. Kamal has a herd of five cows. He started his business five years ago when he bought his first cow with money he had saved up.

He purchases young calves, breeds them, and then sells them in the city market. The business is profitable, but requires investment from time to time. Kamal plans to increase the number of animals in the herd and has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a $500 loan. He hopes to successfully collaborate with Normicro and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy calves and increase the size of his herd

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia (seated serving client) is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and five children in Kisumu, Kenya. She began her salon business in 1984. Besides her salon, Patricia sells ready-made clothes, shoes, purses, ties and other clothing items. The location of her shop and her many years of doing good business within the community have gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock and build a successful income-generating business. Patricia is proud of her accomplishments and that she is now able to contribute to paying household expenses. She requires US $500 to further expand her businesses.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Chaileang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chaileang S. is divorced and has three children; two sons and one daughter. All of her children are in school. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chaileang has been a silk weaver for twenty one years. It’s skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middle-man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chaileang is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Uldosh

texts.ru:
Uldosh Rashanov is a resident of the Rudaki region. He is 53 years old, is married and has 8 children. Uldosh raises livestock. He raises small horned animals. Uldosh purchases young goats at the local market and fattens them up. After the animals gain weight, Uldosh sells them to local meat sellers. This business allows Uldosh to support his family. Today, Uldosh would like to purchase a calf, which is why he needs money. He has decided to take out a loan for a 7 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Равшанов Юлдош житель района Рудаки . Возраст 53 года , женат , имеет 8 детей. Юлдош занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелкий рогатый скот . Он покупает на местном рынке молодых коз ,откармливает их. После того как животные набирают вес,клиент сдает их в мясные ларьки. Эта деятельность позволяет Юлдошу содержать его большую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить бычка для чего ему нужны деньги. Юлдош решил взять кредит сроком на 7 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua, 50 years old, is married with 9 children. For the past 20 years, she has been selling kenkey in her neighborhood. This has given her a rich experience in kenkey production and sales with many customers. As a resourceful mother, she supported 4 children who graduated from senior high school and started university education. Kenkey, a very popular Ghanaian dish, is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish.

Akua will be using the loan to purchase maize, vegetable oil, vegetables, and firewood, which are the major raw materials, in bulk. This will help reduce her costs very significantly to enable her to raise more income to support her children’s education. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust group. The group guarantees loans through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount. Akua's photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To purchase maize, vegetable oil, vegetables, and firewood, which are the major raw materials, in bulk

loans.name: Mejra

texts.en:
Mejra is a 49-year-old woman living near the town of Doboj. She is a widow and has 4 children, all grown, ranging in age from 22 to 28. Only one son lives with her now, along with his wife and new child.

This is Mejra’s third loan with Žene za Žene. She is asking for 600 KM to buy more chickens for her poultry farm. There are two types of poultry farms: ones that breed & fatten chickens to sell for meat, and ones that breed chickens to produce eggs. Mejra buys chickens that are good egg producers, and wants to buy more of these so she can increase her egg sales for the rest of the year.

Mejra wants to make sure she earns as much money as she can, and plans to use all her free time for this business. Her sales are going well so far, she reports, but she wants to earn more. This is mostly because she wants to move back to her village, which is located near the town of Srebrenica. Mejra fled her hometown during the war and has resided in Doboj ever since. While Srebrenica was very devastated by the war and remains sparsely populated, it is still her dream to live in her hometown again. Mejra hopes to earn enough money from her business so she can pay for the move back.

loans.use: To buy chickens for egg producing & selling

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Marié sans enfant pour le moment, monsieur Kodzo N.  est né le 13 Avril 1981 à Tsévié. Il a deus (02) personnes à charge. Sa femme est une ménagère à la maison. Donc il est seul à faire face aux charges de la famille. Actuellement il est meniez à la solde d’une dame. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir une moto pour en faire un taxi moto. Ce crédit lui permettra de sortir sa famille de la misère et faire face à ses besoins primaires.
 Ce crédit sera remboursé mensuellement sur une période de douze  (12) mois.
texts.en:
Married with no children as of yet, Mr. Kodzo N. was born on 13 April 1981 in Tsévié. He has two (02) people in his care. His wife is a homemaker. Thus, he has to meet his family's expenses by himself. Currently, he works as a miller for hire. He is asking for this loan to acquire a motorcycle to use as a moto-taxi. This loan will allow him to bring his family out of misery and meet his primary needs. This loan will be reimbursed monthly over a period of twelve (12) months.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Mrs. Chheang Sothy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty members in Slab Ta Aon Village in Kandal Province formed a village bank loan, and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chheang S., the village bank president, is a garment worker who makes $55 per month. She is 28 years old and the mother of two children, aged 5 and 2. Her monthly income is a small amount to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sreng Chamroeun, is a construction worker who earns $4 per day, which goes toward paying the family's expenses.

Mr. Sreng Chamroeun's business now faces a small problem because he does not have enough construction materials to build the houses for his customers. Mrs. Chheang S. requests a loan to buy construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: Buy construction equipment for home construction business

loans.name: Juliet Kusemerwa's Group

texts.en:
Juliet is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged between 20 and 10. They are all in school. She resides in and owns a 4-room house, where she is staying with 3 people and doesn't take care of any other additional family members. They neither have electricity nor water at home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Juliet runs a kiosk selling soft drinks and other food in Namungoona, near Kampala city. Juliet uses public transport to go to and from her shopping. Juliet receives over 30 customers a day and works 7 days a week. Juliet sells to all categories of people, and her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and medication. Juliet has been with MCDT for 4 years and is servicing her tenth loan, working all this long with the same group mates.

She wants to use this loan to buy another fridge.

loans.use: To buy another fridge

loans.name: Yessica Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Yesica tiene 24 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Decisiones y vive en la calle Astopilco 518 Río Seco, distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta el tercer ciclo de computación en un Instituto, pero se unió a su pareja Josías Carbajal y tienen una hija de 6 meses.
Tenía un puesto en el mercado, pero por el momento no puede atenderlo porque tiene que atender a su pequeña hija. Tuvo que cambiar a otro trabajo más fácil de realizar y optó por comprar tarjetas telefónicas, las cuales las vende en su casa y en el quiosco que tiene su madre en un hotel de la ciudad.
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió en aretes y otras joyas para venderlos en el puesto del mercado.
Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, piensa comprar más tarjetas telefónicas.
Yesica sueña con tener su casa propia y un gran negocio.
texts.en:
Yesica is 24 years old, belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Decisiones," and lives on 518 Astopilco Street, Rio Seco, in the district of El Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad. She studied until her third cycle of computation in an institute, but she married her partner Josias Carbajal and they have a daughter of 6 months. Yesica had a stand in the market, but for the moment she can't attend to it because she has to care for her little daughter. She had to change to another job that was easier for her to handle, and opted to buy phone cards that she sells in her house and in her mother's kiosk in a hotel in the city. Yesica invested her first loan of 300 soles ($100) that she paid in 4 installments, in earrings and other forms of jewelry to be sold at her stand in the market. With this loan of 500 soles, or $175 that will be paid in 4 installments, she is thinking of buying more telephone cards. Yesica dreams of having her own house and a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy telephone cards.

loans.name: Boltaeva

texts.en: B. Gulsara has been an active client of our program since 2005. She applied when she heard from her friend about our loan program. She started her business practically from scratch, but thanks to previous loans, now she has a trade outlet in the central bazaar in Khujand, where she sells sugar, sweets and chocolate. She works with the suppliers from Russia and Kyrgyzstan so her prices are lower than the bazaar prices. She has a lot of repeat customers. Mrs.B. asks the KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 12 months to import New Year candies. She thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: Import New Year candies

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania  es socia del Bancomunal Teresa D. Calcuta. 
Epifania es casada, tiene  62 años y cinco hijos  D. 44, 42, 40, 38 y 36 años, todos sus hijos están casados.   Ella tiene su negocio desD. hace cuatro años tiene un taller D. costura y una pequeña tienda en su casa, ahí venD. todos los días.
DesD. que esta en Finca  ha mejorado a comprado más mercadería.

Epifanía solicita un préstamo D. 1200. soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cervezas, gaseosas, abarrotes, Kerosene y dulces al por mayor.
Ella sueña con hacer crecer mas su negocio, tener mas mercaderías y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Epifania is a member of the communal bank Teresa D. Calcuta. She is 62 years old, is married and has five children ages 44, 42, 40, 38 and 36. All of her children are married. Epifania has had her business for four years. She owns a dressmaking shop and has a small store in her home which she runs every day. Since joining FINCA her business has improved and she has been able to purchase more merchandise. Epifania is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 which she will invest in purchasing beer, soft drinks, groceries, kerosene and candies wholesale. Her dream is to expand her business, to have more merchandise and to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks, groceries, kerosene and candies wholesale.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr: Idrissa sané est marié et pére de quatre (04) enfants. Il tient un magasin de fourniture d'articles scolaires et de petits matériels de bureau. De plus il assure dans son magasin des travaux de plastification et reliure. Il a engagé un jeune et ainsi il peut faire les démarches nécessaires pour la bonne marche de son activité qui, grace à elle, lui permet de nourir sa famille. Il souhaiterait un meilleur développement  de cette activité qui représente sa seule et unique source de revenu.
texts.en:
Idrissa Sané is married and the father of four. He has a store selling office and school supplies. Plus, he provides laminating and bookbinding services. He has hired a youngster, and thus he can take the steps necessary to run his business well. Thanks to this business, he is able to feed his family. He would like to improve his business, which represents his sole source of income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies, laminating, and bookbinding

loans.name: Chetroi

texts.en:
This is Chetroi C., a resident of Cahul District, Brinza village. C. is requesting a loan from MicroInvest to increase his working capital in order to start a business cultivating vegetables and seeds that will be grown on land in Brinza that he inherited from his parents.

We want to thank all Kiva lenders for funding people who want to begin their own businesses.

loans.use: To start a business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
“Do not do unto others, what you do not want others do unto you” is a simple quotation that Leonila always keeps in mind. She is a vegetable vendor at her age of 57 years old. She maintains a vegetable garden where she gets some of her products to be sold to her regular customers in their village. She is married to Narciso D.. They are blessed with 5 children namely; Laina, 38 years old, Narciso D. Jr., 36 years old, Leonardo, 34 years old, Leonalyn, 32 years old, and last is Nowella, 30 years old. Only her eldest child graduated from college and some did not due to financial difficulties and early marriage.

Since Leonila does not have a vending stall, she just roams around their village selling her different kinds of vegetable, some harvested in her garden while most are bought from the city market of Tuguegarao. Out of her vending business, Leonila is able to generate an income of PHP 750 weekly. She is thankful that through the business she is able to help her husband with their financial needs. She wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 which will be used in the improvement of her business and in venturing to other types of business where she could generate higher income.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Cirilo Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Cirilo Alejandro C. tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio ubicado en la concepción  - Masaya , el es soltero habita con sus padres , los planes hacia un futuro es poder construir una casa ya que la que tiene actualmente es de madera con plástico y en las madrugadas hace mucho fríos , él desde hace cinco años trabaja como agricultor , con la ayuda de sus papá , los planes hacia un futuro para sus cultivos es poder diversificarlo , el financiamiento lo quiere para la comprar de fertilizantes e insumos para que la cosecha se en buenas condiciones y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Cirilo Alejandro C., 34, lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood located in La Concepción, Masaya. He is single and lives with his parents. His plans for the future are to be able to build a house. The one he has now is made of wood and plastic. In the morning it is very cold. Since he was five years old, with the help of his parents, he has worked as a farmer. The future plans for his crops are to diversify them. He wants the loan to be able to buy fertilizer and supplies. Then his harvest will be in good condition, and he will be able to sell it for a good price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for his farm

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Maritza del Socorro M. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Maritza tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Maritza es venta la de mariscos, ella dio inicio este negocio hace 7 años comprando las cantidades camarones y pescados en pequeñas cantidades, por lo que sus productos los ofrece de manera ambulante. Los propósitos de Doña Maritza son de mantener su negocio activo. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar los mariscos que sus clientes solicitan. El deseo de Doña Maritza es darle mejoras a su vivienda y aumentar su producción y obtener un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza del Socorro M., 49, is married and has 3 children who attend school. Maritza sells seafood. She started this business 7 years ago by buying small quantities of shrimp and fish. She sells her products as a traveling vendor. Maritza’s intention is to maintain an active business. The loan is for working capital to buy the seafood that her customers request. Maritza wishes to makes improvements on her house, increase production, and obtain a fixed place to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Mrs. Melchora Y. is 61 years old and a member in good standing of Paglaum Coop. A married woman, she is blessed with six children, one of whom is still in school. She has already accessed loans through Paglaum a number of times, and one of the loans was supported by Kiva.

Now she is applying for another loan to help finance the purchase of grocery items for sale at her sari-sari store, which she operates together with her husband. They run their store in order to have enough income to feed their family and to save for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina lives in the village of Sta. Ana Echague, Isabela. She is 48 years old and married to Lorenzo Sr. The couple has six children: Darwin, 27 years old, and Efren, 26 years old, are both college undergraduates; George, 25 years old, is a vocational course graduate who is now working in Saudi Arabia; Lorenzo Jr. is 22 years old and a college graduate; Lorena is 20 years old and also a college graduate; and Kerovin is 16 years old and a high school senior student.

Rufina is engaged in selling ready-to-wear (RTW) in her village. She buys different clothes and then sells them afterwards. She now wants to borrow PHP10,000 as additional capital since she does not have enough money to assist her business.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni F. is currently in the business of selling paste and sorghum and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of sorghum to sell. Poni is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia  es socia del Bancomunal Las Amapolas.
Pelagia es casada tiene 43 años, cuatro hijos de 24, 23, 21 y 4 años que esta estudiando en el jardín de un colegio nacional
Pelagia cuando llego a Lima se dedico a trabajar en casas hasta que se casa y se dedico a cuidar a sus hijos, hace tres años se ha dedicado a la venta de productos naturales medicinales, le esta yendo bien,   es vendedora de productos medicinales naturales  en dos empresas diferentes.
Desde que Pelagia esta en Finca  aprendió ahorra y ha compartir con sus compañeras.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de productos medicinales naturales y de café orgánico medicinal.
 El sueño de Pelagia es llegar a ser una vendedora  estrella  en la empresa para las que vende.
texts.en:
Pelagia is a member of the village bank Las Amapolas. She is married, 43 years old, and has 4 children ages 24, 23, 21 and 4. The 4 year old attends kindergarten at a public school. When Pelagia arrived in Lima she worked in housekeeping until she got married and began to take care of her children full time. She has been selling natural medicines for three years. It is going well for her – she is a salesperson for two different companies. Since Pelagia has been with FINCA Peru she has learned to save money and to share with her partners. Pelagia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy natural medicines and medicinal organic coffee. Pelagia’s dream is to become a top seller in the companies she works for.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: natural medicines and medicinal organic coffee

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline O. is 32 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She is a farmer. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to hire more laborers to clear her farm. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers

loans.name: Virtud Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal virtud inicia su ciclo 18 con 21 socias. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, helados, artesanías, comida, quesos, frutas, cereales.
	 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. aceite, arroz, artesanía, carne, verduras, frutas variadas, cereales.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, salir adelante, ahorrar y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Virtud" Communal Bank begins its 18th cycle with 21 members. The members have different businesses, such as selling vegetables, ice cream, handicrafts, food, cheese, fruit and cereals. The members need different loan amounts, such as 200 soles, 400 soles and 1,000 soles, which comes to a total of 8,500 soles in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of oil, rice, crafts, meat, vegetables, various fruits and cereals. The members dream of improving their businesses, advancing, saving and watching their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of oil, rice, crafts, meat, vegetables, various fruits and and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Processing seafood

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy owns a shop where she sells provisions and foodstuffs, She makes hairs for people and also operates a video club. She is 36 years old and married. She has been in the business for the past 3 years. She hopes the loan amount of N100000 to purchase refrigerator and invest the rest in foodstuffs to sells. She thanks you for the loan

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator for cooling drinks and sachet water and invest the rest in foodstuffs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Vending of native cakes is what Erlinda E. does during her business day. She starts vending her homemade cooked native cakes at 9:00 a.m. and stops selling when they are all sold. She then repeats her business routine again the following day, and so forth.

Because she wants her business to grow and increase her daily income, Erlinda is hoping to borrow PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. She hopes that lenders will provide her with the loan that she has requested, for it will allow her to develop her vending business.

Erlinda is married to Eduardo and the couple is blessed with five children: the eldest is already married; Elpidio - 21 years old is a high school graduate; Jennelyn - 19 years old; Edralyn - 11 years old, is a grade-II pupil; and Angelica - 6 years old, is a grade-I pupil.

Erlinda hopes that she will be able to sustain the needs of her family, most especially the financial needs of her children in their pursuit of a good education.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Ratna Shova B. is a resident of Tangal. Tangal is located in Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Ratna Shova B. lives in a single family with her husband and three children.

Both Mrs. and Mr. B. are engaged in tailoring work. Tailoring is their traditional work and they learned tailoring from their forefathers. They make different types of clothes for both ladies and men. Especially they make pants and shirts for gents and blouses and traditional kurta sulwar and makhshi for ladies.

Now Mrs.B. is requesting for Rs 30000.00 loan to buy raw materials for tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.en:
Mahmadsaid, a very hard-working and responsible man, is married, and to move his family ahead, he started his own business 12 years ago, selling groceries in his new neighborhood and taking advantage of the scarcity of shops nearby. Mahmadsaid started by selling a small number of products but now he has an extensive stock and has enlarged the store to take up the whole front of his home. His children have helped out; his family unit has been instrumental in developing and growing his business. The cost of enlarging his store left him unable to afford to keep his business well-stocked, which is why he's requesting a loan of $3000 USD to purchase merchandise. You can help Mahmadsaid meet his need and contribute to the growth of his business. He and his family are sincerely grateful for your support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en: Chiv T. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo province. She is a professional weaver who makes a living of $2.60 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker engaged in building houses. On average, he earns $2.60 USD per day. Chiv T. is asking for a loan of $500 USD to purchase silk so that she can weave silk clothes to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase silk for weaving

loans.name: Jackelin

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JACKELIN tiene 21 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia JACKELIN tiene una hija que se llama Colin y tiene un año y medio.  
        
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comestibles. Ella tiene en su propio domicilio una tienda de abarrotes en “Siete Mascarones” en el distrito de Santiago. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como arroz, azúcar y fideos. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La socia en la foto esta acompañada de su esposo Frank y su hija Colin.
texts.en:
Jackelin is 21 years old and lives with her husband in the city of Cusco. She belongs to the village bank “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” in Asociación Arariwa. Jackelin has a daughter named Colin who is a year and a half old.

She alternates her home duties with selling foodstuffs. She has a small grocery store in her home in "Siete Mascarones" in the district of Santiago. She has been in this business for several years and thanks to her hard work she has done very well. She is a young mother, a hard worker, and enterprising to improve her family's situation. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, and pasta.

She is thankful for the offered opportunity and promises to pay back the loan on schedule. She is pictured in the photo accompanied by her husband Frank and her daughter Colin.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Antonia Román  del Barrio María Auxiliadora de la Ciudad de  Presidente F.. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se Denomina Nueva Esperanza están en el Quinto Ciclo   con 17  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas  y responsable entre ellas, las mismas poseen un ahorro de gs 1.300.073, cabe destacar que  las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, realizan actividades para recaudar fondos y otras  que realizan  labores domésticas para incrementar sus ingresos.
Las Señoras Retiran un crédito de gs 300.000 a 1.000.000 gs para la compra de mercaderías para la venta.
Las actividades que realizan cada integrante es como sigue: 
1
Josefa María G.
 Venta de Remedios Naturales.
2
Antonia Román.
Venta de Ropas..
3
Victoriana V.
  Venta de Cosméticos. .
4
Marta A..

5

Venta de Huevo y Queso..
6
Angélica Q..
Venta de Ropas..
7
Rufina Tíjera
Venta de Verduras.
8
 María Q..
Venta de Queso..
9
Martina Gómez.
Venta de Bebidas. .
10

Venta de Ropas..
11
Lilian Cáceres.
Elaboración de Productos de Limpieza..
12
María F..
Venta de Ropa Interior..
13

Venta De Ropas..

 Venta de Ropa Interior..
